title: Direct client hiring for Data Analyst in Richmond, VA (REMOTE)
description: Please note that this position is with our direct client Requisition # 732560 We are looking for a Data Analyst (Min 2+yrs Exp ) REMOTE (Web Cam Interview only ) POSITION DESCRIPTION DIRECT CLIENT Position Number of positions: 1 Length: 12 Months + Work Address: VA 23219 Immediate Interviews – Web Cam Interview Pls Note this position is REMOTE VDH Data Analyst 3 The Virginia Department of Health’s Division of Informatics and Information Systems is seeking an Analytics and Visualization Specialist to assist with communicable disease data reporting and analysis. The Division of Informatics and Information Systems is responsible for the organization, presentation, analysis, and verification of epidemiological health information across the Commonwealth of Virginia . The Analytics and Visualization Specialist will be responsible for data analysis and development of data visualization projects for various communicable diseases, primarily for COVID-19. This position will report to the Division of Informatics and Information Systems (DIIS) Data Analytics Manager. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Leverages appropriate analytic tools (SQL, Tableau Prep, Tableau Desktop, R, GCP, others) to integrate, clean, and transform public health and healthcare data. Builds analyses and visualizations, dashboards using appropriate software (Tableau Desktop, R/Python, GCP, others) for a variety of purposes and audiences. Purposes may include public reporting, performance evaluation, decision analytics, data quality analysis, and/or scientific publication. Audiences may include the public, healthcare providers, community action groups, other government agencies, specific disease programs, and/or leadership. Maintains, republishes, and enhances data products according to established cadences (e.g., daily, weekly, annually). Works collaboratively with business stakeholders and subject-matter experts to define and refine requirements. Documents detailed description of data cleaning steps, sources, filters, assumptions, and purposes. Maintains Documentation related to data visualization processes, tools, and best practices while continuing to enhance existing processes and procedures. Proactively identifies and communicates data quality issues and addresses issues arising from data processing. Conducts other duties as requested/assigned. Communication to stakeholders both internal and external via email, PPT presentations as wellas internal presentations JOB QUALIFICATIONS: Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent combination of experience and education Strong data analysis skills in SQL, Tableau, R/Python, and Microsoft Excel Experience working collaboratively with diverse groups and projects with defined timelines Strong attention to detail and accuracy Strong communication skills Self-starter Preferred Qualifications: Preferred > 2 years’ experience with Tableau and SQL Familiarity with health/public health data Flexibility to work on multiple projects/issues simultaneously. Knowledge of relational databases. WordPress knowledge ArcGIS/working with geospatial data Skill Matrix Required/Required Skills Candidates must have ALL the “Required” skills in order to be considered for the position. “Desired” or “Highly Desired” skills are a PLUS but may NOT be required. Skill Matrix (Please fill the last two columns of this matrix) Experience with Business workflow processes Required / Desired Amount of Experience Data Analysis Required 2 Years Tableau Required 1 Years R/Python Highly desired 1 Years SQL Required 2 Years Microsoft Suite, particularly Excel Required 2 Years ArcGIS/ Geospatial data Nice to have 1 Years Wordpress Nice to have 1 Years familiarity with Health/public health data Highly desired 1 Years
summary: The Virginia Department of Health is looking for a Data Analyst to assist with communicable disease data reporting and analysis. The ideal candidate will have experience with SQL, Tableau, R/Python, and Microsoft Excel. This position will focus on data analysis and development of data visualization projects for various communicable diseases, primarily for COVID-19.

title: Counterparty Data Analyst
description: *****W2 ONLY, NO C2C***** Job Title: Financial Data Analyst Type: Contract Client Location: Charlotte, NC (Onsite: Mon, Wed, Fri) Overview: We are seeking two Financial Data Analysts to join our team in Charlotte, NC. This role is crucial in supporting financial data analysis and reporting initiatives within the banking sector. Responsibilities: Conduct thorough analysis of financial data, ensuring accuracy and compliance with regulatory standards. Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data requirements and provide actionable insights. Utilize advanced SQL skills to extract, manipulate, and analyze data from Oracle and Teradata databases. Develop and support Alteryx workflows for data processing and reporting. Assist in regulatory reporting efforts, particularly 2052A liquidity reporting. Work closely with various lines of business to enhance data management processes and reporting efficiency. Requirements: Minimum 5 years of experience in Financial Services with a focus on data analysis. Proficiency in database structures, data warehousing, and financial accounting concepts. Advanced SQL skills and experience querying large datasets. Hands-on experience with Alteryx for data preparation and workflow automation. Advanced proficiency in Excel for data analysis and reporting. Familiarity with regulatory reporting requirements in the financial services industry. Ability to effectively communicate insights and collaborate with cross-functional teams. Preferred Skills: Knowledge of 2052A liquidity reporting requirements and regulatory compliance. Previous exposure to different lines of business within a banking environment. Join us and contribute to impactful financial data analysis projects in a collaborative and innovative environment. This position offers competitive compensation and the opportunity for professional growth within the banking industry
summary: We are seeking two Financial Data Analysts to join our team in Charlotte, NC, focusing on financial data analysis and reporting for the banking sector. The role involves data analysis, stakeholder collaboration, SQL querying, Alteryx workflow development, and regulatory reporting, particularly 2052A liquidity reporting. The ideal candidate has 5+ years of experience in Financial Services with data analysis expertise, advanced SQL skills, Alteryx experience, and strong Excel proficiency.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: We are looking for an established Data Analytics Engineer to join a well established team within a large organization which has been around for over 50 years! This organization has big plans to re-architect their data environment, integrating their ERP with HubSpot to improve their analytical outputs to drive decision making, using data. We are looking for an individual who can hit the ground running, bring new ideas to the table and preferably with previous leadership experience. You will be given the opportunity to grow in both the role and the business going forward and we are actively looking for people who want to commit to building their career longer term. Tech: SQL Tableau PoweBI DAX HubSpot Compensation $100-140k 10-20% bonus Health, Vision, Dental & life 401k matching PTO & Federal Holidays paid This position is Hybrid out of Greensboro, NC.
summary: Data Analytics Engineer needed to re-architect data environment, integrating ERP with HubSpot, driving decision making with data. Requires strong SQL, Tableau, PoweBI, DAX, and HubSpot experience. Leadership experience preferred. Hybrid position in Greensboro, NC.

title: Data Analyst
description: General Summary The Data Analyst will support the data analysis and analytical needs of the organization by applying the knowledge of mathematics, probability, statistics, data analytics, BI Analytics/reporting tools, and the principles of finance and business. Responsible for analyzing data and converting it to actionable information through the creation and implementation of innovative, flexible, and informative reports to drive growth, margin improvement, and strategic business management. This position will author and create database queries, formatted reports, and dashboards, interpret data and analyze results through statistical techniques. The position is responsible for monitoring and ensuring data integrity. As a member of an Agile team, this position is responsible for meeting Sprint goals, delivering business insights, and compelling data analysis products. This position is offered by Abōva Talent, LLC, a subsidiary of Stratacor and an affiliate of Delta Dental of Minnesota. Essential Functions Data Expertise Knowledge of the different data sources available for analysis and the ability to identify the source or sources of data best suited for each situation Understand the data in each data source as well as the opportunities and limitations of using the data Provide requirements for new data tables/data needs to support analysis Perform the essential functions such as: Queries, aggregates, and formats data for data extracts, reports, and dashboards. Create, implement, and maintain reports and dashboards (ad-hoc/scheduled) using business intelligence tools. With minimal guidance, provides troubleshooting and analysis for business questions, with an eye toward possible solution implementation. Partners with IT colleagues and business users to understand data requirements and create proofs of concept deliverables where necessary. Develops and documents data dictionaries. Documents and tracks work using modern project, feature, and solution tracking tools such as JIRA. Data Analytics Analysis of products and related factors, including, but not limited to, claims experience, profit margins, administrative expenses, rate adequacy, sales, terms, provider reimbursements, network value, experience studies, and competitive positioning Analyze and proactively monitor the current reporting/business intelligence environment, including recommending improvements Collaborate with other internal teams on data analysis needs and work with these teams to define the purpose and scope of analysis, perform the analysis, and communicate the results Support the data needs/analysis related to the strategic planning process Conduct analysis of various business relationships and partnerships including analysis of key experience drivers Analyze ongoing claim trends including, but not limited to, trends in utilization, fee inflation, and intensity in aggregate as well as within specific blocks of business, or subsets of specific blocks of business Develop solutions to streamline data analysis to support departmental and company-wide data needs more effectively and efficiently External Industry Awareness Identify and analyze the internal and external factors which affect statistics for use in data analysis, forecasting, trending, reporting/dashboarding, etc. Keep informed about analytical tools/concepts available to support necessary analysis and understand the application/relevancy to Delta Dental's business model Keep informed about market conditions, competitive information, and political factors that may impact the goals and interests of the organization. Communicate key developments to appropriate stakeholders and use information appropriately when performing analysis or collaborating on internal and external projects Special projects and other job-related duties as assigned Required Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities Experience formatting data extracts into business-friendly reports, charts, and dashboards. (Power BI experience a plus) Experience using SQL (oracle preferred, but not required) and proficiency in MS Excel (Pivot tables, VLOOKUP), Business Intelligence, and proprietary software applications Knowledge of Python (or other object-oriented programming languages) is a plus Demonstration of strong analytical and problem-solving abilities Ability to establish priorities and make decisions and to work independently and accurately, using good analytical and organizational skills Proven history and consistent ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment Aptitude to learn new technologies and new languages independently Collaborate regularly with business users to define needs Ability to work effectively with other information technology staff Advanced verbal and written communication skills Required Education And Experience Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, related field and/or equivalent work experience. Minimum 2 years of related data analytics work experience. WORK ENVIRONMENT/PHYSICAL DEMANDS Travel Requirements: Minimal local Weight Lifting Requirements: up to 20 lbs. RELATIONSHIPS Reports To: Data Analytics Manager Directly Manages: None Internal Relationships: Technology Services staff, Project Management, Other business stakeholders and product owners External Relationships: External vendors and Business affiliates
summary: This role involves data analysis and reporting to drive business growth, margin improvement, and strategic management. Responsibilities include creating reports and dashboards, analyzing data using statistical techniques, ensuring data integrity, and collaborating with business users.  This position requires knowledge of data sources, business intelligence tools, SQL, Excel, and Python.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: Build the future of data. Join the Snowflake team. Snowflake Support is committed to providing high-quality resolutions to help deliver data-driven business insights and results. We are a team of subject matter experts collectively working toward our customers’ success. We form partnerships with customers by listening, learning and building connections. Snowflake’s values are key to our approach and success in delivering world class Support. Putting customers first, acting with integrity, owning initiative and accountability and getting it done are Snowflake core values and are reflected in everything we do. As a Senior Data Analyst in the Snowflake Support organization, your work will provide direct insights about the operations of Snowflake Support and the health of our customers, helping to drive important operational and strategic decisions. We are looking for someone who is able to approach complex problems in an organized and detail-oriented manner. We work with stakeholders to understand their challenges, use data to power decision-making, and tell the story of the outcomes achieved. YOU WILL: Operate as an Analyst Business Partner to our internal Support organization, confidently creating and representing data narratives that drive outcomes Cultivate relationships with internal service teams that allow you to frame and break down complex business problems into key components, and recommend practical solutions. Improve operational efficiency by developing metrics, self-service tools, and deep analyses that produce actionable insights. Leverage cutting-edge Snowflake product features to accelerate time-to-insight Think creatively to find optimal solutions to novel problems, writing and testing code in SQL, Python Perform ad-hoc analytics that provide insights into business performance and key organizational metrics for our fast-growing Enterprise Support organization Serve as the authoritative voice ensuring comprehensive data protection; Act as a consummate data steward, fully knowledgeable of all data handling policies and data classification standards. Proactively identify opportunities for improvement including reporting automation, deep-dive investigations, and new analytical partnerships. Operate both collaboratively and autonomously, exercising judgment of which approach best applies Model new data and maintain existing modeled data, and be able to provide feedback on these data models or data collection enhancements needed for accurate and timely reporting Operate over with structured and unstructured data from various sources including Salesforce CRM, ServiceNow, Jira, Qualtrics OUR IDEAL SENIOR DATA ANALYST WILL HAVE: B.S. or M.S degree in Analytics, CS, MIS or equivalent discipline 5+ years of experience with SQL including exposure to complex data models, and solid skill writing SQL queries Expertise with databases such as Snowflake, Redshift or Teradata; comfortable working with large-scale datasets 5+ years of experience with one or more common data analysis or data manipulation language (Python, R, Spark) and associated libraries/toolkits such as NumPy, pandas, and Scikit Practical experience using a business intelligence application such as Tableau, ThoughtSpot, or PowerBI; certifying, maintaining and troubleshooting existing dashboards Skill in creating reporting and dashboards to clearly and quickly convey actionable insights, as well as the ability to tailor communications to different audiences Advanced skill in Excel or Google Sheets; Working experience with a scripting language such as Bash or Perl A constant eye for automating, improving and documenting internal processes and workflows Every Snowflake employee is expected to follow the company’s confidentiality and security standards for handling sensitive data. Snowflake employees must abide by the company’s data security plan as an essential part of their duties. It is every employee's duty to keep customer information secure and confidential. The following represents the expected range of compensation for this role: The estimated base salary range for this role is $106,000 - $156,400. Additionally, this role is eligible to participate in Snowflake’s bonus and equity plan. The successful candidate’s starting salary will be determined based on permissible, non-discriminatory factors such as skills, experience, and geographic location. This role is also eligible for a competitive benefits package that includes: medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance; 401(k) retirement plan; flexible spending & health savings account; at least 12 paid holidays; paid time off; parental leave; employee assistance program; and other company benefits. Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake. How do you want to make your impact?
summary: Snowflake is seeking a Senior Data Analyst to join their Support organization. This role will involve using data to understand the operations of Snowflake Support and the health of their customers. Responsibilities include developing metrics, self-service tools, and deep analyses to produce actionable insights. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in SQL, Python, and data visualization tools like Tableau.

title: Data Analyst I
description: Opening Full Time 40 hours Range URG 106 Psychiatry M&D Research Schedule 8 AM-4:30 PM Responsibilities GENERAL PURPOSE: Supports the development of methods for data collection, analysis, and reporting for a department or school. Analyzes and interprets data using statistical techniques. Assists with the creation of presentations and reports based on findings, which includes collating, modeling, interpreting and analyzing data. Collects data requirements, analyzes and determines technical issues, and design ad-hoc reports. Collects, analyzes and documents business requirements and supports translation into function and system requirement specifications. JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Assists with tracking and compiling of comprehensive business metric data for evaluating effectiveness of programs, processes, or practices. Protects and ensures confidentiality of data per applicable policies and procedures (i.e. HIPPA etc.). Assists with building business solutions based on data. Collects requirements and designs reports to meet data analysis needs. Assists in the preparation of detailed documentation and/or reporting, in the case of external audit. Supports audit process and assists with compilation of required documentation. Updates and maintains the integrity of assigned databased on an ongoing basis. Consults with user groups to assess data preparation and data management needs, program design, and general user interface testing. Supports the evaluation of new technology and resources, and the impact of those new technologies, for improving data outcomes. Assists in the development of standard operating procedures, process maps, code manuals and project plans for all major reporting projects, as needed. Other duties as assigned QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor's Degree in statistical analysis, data base management, or related discipline required. 1 year of experience with data analysis or customer resource management systems required or equivalent combination of education and experience. Strong attention to detail and strong organizational, data analysis and problem-solving skills required. Familiarity with statistics and statistical analysis, advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel, ability to visually portray data preferred. The University of Rochester is committed to fostering, cultivating, and preserving a culture of equity, diversity, and inclusion to advance the University’s mission to Learn, Discover, Heal, Create – and Make the World Ever Better. In support of our values and those of our society, the University is committed to not discriminating on the basis of age, color, disability, ethnicity, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, military/veteran status, national origin, race, religion/creed, sex, sexual orientation, citizenship status, or any other status protected by law. This commitment extends to the administration of our policies, admissions, employment, access, and recruitment of candidates from underrepresented populations, veterans, and persons with disabilities consistent with these values and government contractor Affirmative Action obligations. How To Apply All applicants must apply online. EOE Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled Pay Range Pay Range: $44,419 - $62,186 Annually The referenced pay range represents the minimum and maximum compensation for this job. Individual annual salaries/hourly rates will be set within the job’s compensation range, and will be determined by considering factors including, but not limited to, market data, education, experience, qualifications, expertise of the individual, and internal equity considerations.
summary: This position supports the development of data collection, analysis, and reporting methods for a department or school. Responsibilities include analyzing and interpreting data, assisting with report creation, collecting data requirements, and ensuring data confidentiality. The role also involves collaborating with user groups, evaluating new technologies, and assisting with standard operating procedure development.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: Primary Responsibilities: Work with various teams to implement data governance policies for data ingestion and operational processes. Oversee data sets according to established rules and controls; develop and implement new rules and controls as needed. Resolve data issues and address quality concerns by engaging vendors and stakeholders. Define data policies and controls for new data requirements. Analyze and document data methodologies and data feed structures related to both internal and external sources. Act as the Data Owner and subject matter expert for reference and aggregate data. Provide data quality metrics to guide decisions on enterprise data sets. Build strong relationships with key stakeholders and manage their expectations. Offer thought leadership and participate in projects aimed at enhancing data life cycles, processes, quality, and governance. Identify and document data quality issues and opportunities for improvement through data profiling and advanced analysis. Document, assess, influence, and synthesize business requirements to develop and advance data platform and stewardship capabilities. Translate complex business requirements into clear technical requirements and data solutions. Conduct detailed user acceptance testing (UAT) against complex requirements and data structures, working closely with developers to resolve issues and develop solutions for logic/design deficiencies. Key Qualifications / Skills: Extensive hands-on experience analyzing and interpreting investment data, with strong knowledge of the investment management industry. 10+ years of experience in investment management. Strong data analysis skills, with the ability to detect anomalies, patterns, and data quality issues. Proficiency in SQL; experience with Snowflake is a plus. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate in both formal and informal contexts tailored to the audience. Knowledge of data governance and data quality, including relevant tools. Hands-on experience in project management. Ability to manage enterprise-scale data projects.
summary: Data Governance expert with 10+ years in investment management. Responsible for implementing data governance policies, overseeing data sets, defining data policies, analyzing data methodologies, and acting as Data Owner. Requires strong data analysis skills, proficiency in SQL and Snowflake, and experience in project management.

title: NYSUT Data Analyst
description: Overview: NYSUT is looking for a results-oriented data analyst with strong decision-making and organizational awareness capabilities to work in Development. NYSUT Development is responsible for the NYSUT membership management systems that support record-keeping, customer service, financial transactions, customer relationship management, as well as reporting and analytics service management. The programmer analyst is crucial in assessing and meeting NYSUT's organizational business needs for the next-generation enterprise data warehouse, financial management, and data analytics/BI solution(s). The successful candidate will work in person and onsite alongside other developers  and infrastructure IT professionals, leveraging a project management-based approach to modernization and innovation across the organization by developing a fit-for-purpose tools and technology landscape to achieve current and future business needs. This includes facilitating data record management projects from inception through delivery and support – all in close collaboration with business leadership and executive sponsors. Primary Responsibilities: Collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders to determine requirements, estimate level of effort, and implement solutions for data analysis, reporting, and integration projects across Web Analytics, CRM, and marketing automation systems. Create and maintain reports and dashboards to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and identify trends. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and requirements for reporting and analysis. Develop and implement data quality checks to ensure accuracy and consistency of data. Identify opportunities for process improvement and develop automation to increase efficiency and effectiveness of reporting. Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in reporting and analytics Design, develop, test, deploy and maintain integration solutions using Javascript, Apex, Python, MySQL, and Tableau and other modern tools and services Manage and improve our data warehouse and database systems Develop and implement ETL programs and tools to load data from disparate data sets Design and develop visualizations using Tableau and Excel Translates business requirements into databases, data warehouses, and data-streams Creates procedures to ensure data accuracy and accessibility, Analyzes, plans, and defines data architecture framework, including security, reference data, metadata, and other data Creates and implements data management processes and procedures Collaborates with other teams within the organization to devise and implement data strategies, build models, and assess shareholder needs and goals Developing application programming interfaces (APIs) to retrieve data Contributes to the development of documentation for the line of business, including runbooks, policies or procedures as applicable including in full or in-part contribution to business continuity, disaster recovery, cybersecurity, and other appropriate documentation. Learning agility, ability to learn new languages and processes as platforms and services evolve Ability to travel and work nights and weekends as required for urgent responsive needs, special initiatives, and/or rollouts. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Accounting, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field or a comparable number of years of related work experience in data and analytics (or combination of education and experience) At least 1 to 3 years of experience with database technology, including RDBMS, ETL, BI is a plus Experience with CRM and ERP Automation is a huge plus Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI, warehousing, SQL programming. MySQL experience highly preferred. Fundamental programming skills with Java, Apex and a general-purpose language; RPG is a plus Foundational Experience with SAAS integration techniques such as REST APIs, Web Services, text and XML processing Experience with visualization and analysis tools, such as Tableau and Excel Ability to multi-task and work across multiple projects with competing priorities and deadlines Ability to work with large datasets and analyze complex data Ability to work independently and as part of a team Excellent collaboration and communication skills Strong attention to detail and accuracy NYSUT- Who are we? NYSUT is a statewide labor organization affiliated with more than 1,200 local unions, each representing its own members. NYSUT is affiliated with two national unions, the American Federation of Teachers (AFT) and the National Education Association (NEA). NYSUT represents nearly 700,000 people who work in, or are retired from, New York's schools, colleges, and healthcare facilities, including teachers, teacher aides and assistants, college and university faculty and professional staff, school bus drivers, custodians, secretaries, cafeteria workers, nurses, and other healthcare professionals. At NYSUT, we believe in creating a work environment free of barriers and bias, where individual outlooks and talents are respected and valued. Our organization’s policy is to ensure an equal employment opportunity to all persons without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, age, sex, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by the law. Why Should You Apply? ·        Competitive salary and excellent benefits, including comprehensive medical and dental insurance plans, life and long-term disability plans, and retirement plans ·        Generous PTO plan ·        Work-life balance ·        Collaborative and supportive work environment with a diverse group of experienced professionals ·        Opportunity to work in a highly respected organization, make a meaningful difference in the lives of working people, and be a proud part of the labor movement at the local, state, and national levels. How to Apply: Interested applicants should submit a cover letter and resume to hr@nysut.org
summary: NYSUT seeks a data analyst to work on their membership management systems, data warehouse, and data analytics solutions. The candidate will be responsible for developing reporting, analysis, and integration projects, as well as data quality checks and process improvements. They will also contribute to data management processes, data architecture framework, and documentation. This role requires strong technical skills in database technology, ETL, BI, programming languages like JavaScript, Apex, Python, and experience with visualization tools like Tableau.
benefits: Comprehensive medical and dental insurance plans
Opportunity to make a meaningful difference in the lives of working people

title: Data Analyst/Developer
description: Would you enjoy a career where you make a positive difference to the environment? As a Windsor Data Analyst/Developer for those currently located in the greater Portland, OR area, you are a critical member of a product implementation team that serves our many clients. You enjoy helping our environmental agencies transform data so that they can more efficiently and effectively take the needed actions to improve the environment. During each work day, you thrive as you work independently while contributing as an active team member. About Windsors Solutions, Inc. We are an established, small company headquartered in Portland, OR and we carry a passion for safeguarding and improving our environment. We connection information systems and streamline processes for environmental agencies. Ours is the leading solution in the US. Work life rarely has a dull moment. Your contributions and ideas will be encouraged because we have fostered a team culture where what you say is truly valued. Specific responsibilities will include Developing ETL (extract/transform/load) routines to migrate data from an existing client’s system(s) into Windsor-developed products. Supporting existing clients by troubleshooting and correcting issues in database objects (procedures, functions, triggers). Developing new database objects to support enhanced product functionality. This position requires a high level of proficiency of Microsoft SQL Server’s core platform and T-SQL coding, debugging, and performance tuning. Your communication skills are also critical: you provide effective collaboration with all stakeholders such as Windsor business analysts, the client, and other team members. You gather and define business requirements with clients. As part of your job, you convey technical concepts to non-technical individuals and communicate business requirements and specifications. Once gathered, a major part of your role is to merge these requirements into the project architecture. You are motivated towards building a long-term future with us and, like all team members, we are motivated to invest in you. Your role over time may shift and grow as you develop skills and seek new responsibilities. Skills Required Data Analyst Capabilities Microsoft SQL Server development (stored procedures, SQL queries, performance tuning) Expert knowledge Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes and tools Knowledge of how to retrieve, process, and migrate data from disparate client source systems which are stored in a variety of file formats, DBMSs, and file systems Ability to move and transform that data into the Windsor target proprietary platform Other Minimum 3 years experience as a data analyst Strong verbal and written communications skills Technical Skills Develop code using PowerShell and T-SQL Communicate technical details with the team and client Have an understanding of data models which may include relational, dimensional, entity-relationship, logical and physical and the conversion between logical to physical. Bring SQL Server operational experience – not necessarily at DBA level – but at a functional level. This experience includes basic administrative knowledge such as backup, recovery, moving, partitioning, and both logic and performance enhancements. Communication Skills Experience in requirements gathering with diverse stakeholders, documenting decisions and providing status updates as needed. Be able to translate technical concepts and findings into clear and actionable insights for non-technical audiences. Work closely with product owners and developers to implement product improvements at the database level. Demonstrate resourcefulness in problem-solving and balance independence with escalation when needed. Summary You are good fit at Windsor if you know how to: Target business process functions Relate to the underlying data model(s) Work with the big picture Get into the precise details of a problem Process and operate on existing data If needed, transform and load that data into a client’s existing system Troubleshoot logic and performance with SQL Server stored procedures Communicate to clients with an end result and client satisfaction in mind You need to work independently on your own but also enjoy being a team player.
summary: Windsor Solutions, Inc., an environmental solutions company, is looking for a Data Analyst/Developer to join their product implementation team. The ideal candidate will have strong SQL Server development skills, ETL expertise, and experience working with diverse data sources. This role requires strong communication and problem-solving skills and the ability to translate technical concepts to non-technical audiences.

title: Data Governance Analyst
description: Junior Data Governance Analyst Employment Type : Contract to Hire Contract Term: 6 months Location: Remote (MST) Job Responsibilities • Deploy and maintain Collibra Edge Sites, and set up metadata connectors, lineage connectors on Edge • Develop custom software programs that integrate Collibra with other applications to ingest additional metadata, streamline end user workflows or automate administration tasks • Implement the Collibra Operating Model based on Intermountain’s org structure and team dynamics • Implement capabilities related to business and technical metadata, data lineage, data profiling, and data quality rules in Collibra. • Customize Collibra technical functionalities such as landing page, Data Marketplace, Global Search, Workflows, etc. • Lead and participate meetings with key personas to understand their data governance needs and implement creative technical capacities in Collibra • Develops and delivers training materials, use case and asset model documentation, as well as implementation specification • Deploy and maintain Collibra Data Quality in Cloud Native environment, and implement data quality use cases to demonstrate value of Collibra Data Quality • Provide timely technical support for Data Stewards and any end users of Collibra in their Data Governance journey Qualifications: • Mastery in Collibra DIP and Collibra DQ • Experience in Data Governance and Data Quality management • Strong in data analysis languages including SQL and Python • Strong in Java programming and experience with building Spring Boot applications • Knowledge of Azure Databricks for big data analytics and processing • Experience working with healthcare-related data and systems • Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills Preferred Qualifications: These preferred skills will enhance the candidate's ability to contribute effectively to our team. If you possess expertise in any of these areas, please highlight your relevant experience in your application. • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. • Experience in deploying and managing applications on Microsoft Azure cloud services. • Experience working with healthcare-related data and systems. • Familiarity with Epic Systems' data repositories and data models. • Familiarity with the Cerner Millennium database structure. • Experience with REST/API.
summary: This is a contract-to-hire position for a Junior Data Governance Analyst. The role involves deploying and maintaining Collibra Edge sites, developing custom integrations, implementing the Collibra Operating Model, customizing Collibra functionalities, and providing technical support. Experience in Collibra DIP, DQ, data governance, data quality, SQL, Python, Java, Spring Boot, Azure Databricks, and healthcare-related data is required. Preferred qualifications include a Bachelor's degree, experience with Microsoft Azure, Epic Systems, Cerner Millennium, and REST/API.

title: Data Analyst
description: As the technology firm that created the mobile world and a rich history of 145 years of building ground-breaking solutions and innovative technologies supported by 60k+ patents, Ericsson has made it our business to make a mark. When joining our team at Ericsson you are empowered to learn, lead and perform at your best, shaping the future of technology. This is a place where you are welcomed as your own perfectly unique self, and celebrated for the skills, talent, and perspective you bring to the team. Ericsson Enterprise Wireless Solutions (BEWS) is the group responsible for leading Ericsson’s Enterprise Networking and Security business. Our growing product portfolio spans across wide area networks, local area networks and enterprise security. We are the #1 global market leader in Wireless-WAN based enterprise connectivity solutions and are growing fast in enterprise Private 5G networks and Secure Access Services Edge (SASE) solutions. How Will You Contribute to the Company? Ericsson Enterprise Wireless Solutions is seeking a Data Analyst for our Global Service and Support organization that has experience collecting, analyzing, and presenting data from a wide variety of sources. The Data Analyst will develop, own and update decision-support tools (reports and dashboards) to enable organization leaders to make data-driven decisions. Other job duties will include ad-hoc reporting, data modeling, participating in ongoing projects and programs and other support requested by the business. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with a full suite of analysis tools, such as Tableau, Power BI, Excel, ThoughtSpot, and Salesforce. Additionally, the candidate will have experience distilling complex data into simple visuals. This position will highly leverage your experience in analytics, project management, cross-functional work environment, owning and distributing reports and communicating changes. The successful candidate will work in a cutting-edge technology environment; enjoy competitive salary and benefits while working in a position that has an immediate impact in a growing industry. What Will You Do? title: PBM Data and Reporting Analyst
description: We wanted a PBM that worked better. So we took a bold approach... When we set out in 2011 as Southern Scripts to reshape pharmacy benefit management, it was because we believed there was a better way. Throughout our journey, we’ve never been afraid to challenge widely accepted industry practices or to pioneer a better model. We see that the concept of “transparency” is gaining momentum. At Liviniti , we’ve been delivering it for more than a decade. Liviniti grew from a commitment to offer an uncomplicated approach to managing pharmacy benefits. One based on transparency, affordability, quality, service, and innovation. Our name describes the future that we envision - one with infinite possibilities for better living. Join a team that is reshaping pharmacy benefit management! At Liviniti , we give people the runway to do their best work. We seek people who analyze, challenge, and think outside the box – and reward them with an environment and benefits that support their professional and personal goals. Liviniti is currently seeking a PBM Data and Reporting Analyst to join our Technology Development and Client Services Teams! Knowledge and experience in Pharmacy Benefit Management is preferred! This is a fully remote/work from home position. Role and Responsibilities The PBM Data and Reporting Analyst at Liviniti is responsible for summarizing, analyzing, and interpreting pharmacy, client, and member data to support strategic decision-making processes. The primary objective is to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of pharmacy benefit programs while ensuring cost containment and delivering high-quality patient care. This role demands a keen eye for detail, strong analytical skills, and a collaborative approach to problem-solving. The following objectives further define the key job functions with a focus on the following: Data Collection and Management: Gather and compile pharmacy and healthcare-related data from various sources, including claims, prescriptions, and pharmacy networks, ensuring comprehensive data capture. Ensure data accuracy, completeness, and consistency through rigorous validation and cleaning processes to maintain high data quality standards. Data Analysis and Reporting: Apply statistical and analytical techniques to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in pharmaceutical claim data, providing actionable insights to support decision-making. Perform cost-benefit analysis and cost-effectiveness studies for different medication and treatment options, helping to optimize financial and clinical outcomes. Create reports, dashboards, and visualizations using tools like Domo, Tableau, or Power BI, effectively conveying insights and findings to various stakeholders, including senior leadership and cross-functional teams. Compare data from different time periods and between different types of customers to better assess which plan actions are working and to what degree. Predictive Modeling and Forecasting: Utilize predictive modeling and forecasting techniques to project future pharmacy benefit program costs and utilization patterns, aiding in strategic planning and budgeting. Assess the impact of different benefit design changes on costs and patient outcomes, providing data-driven recommendations for program adjustments. Compliance and Regulatory Support: Stay updated with healthcare regulations and ensure that pharmacy benefit programs comply with relevant laws and regulations, including those related to data privacy and security. Assist in audits and compliance reporting as necessary, ensuring transparency and adherence to regulatory requirements. Program Optimization and Collaboration: Provide data-driven recommendations for optimizing pharmacy benefit programs, including formulary management, prior authorization criteria, and cost-saving strategies. Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Pharmacists, Account Managers, and IT professionals to implement recommended changes and enhance program performance. Implement data validation processes to ensure data integrity and accuracy, troubleshooting data-related issues and discrepancies promptly. Communication and Technical Skills: Communicate complex data analyses clearly and understandably, tailoring messages to diverse audiences, including technical and non-technical stakeholders. Develop and Disseminate best practices for researching and answering our clients' questions about their benefit experiences and efficacies. Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, or R, and familiarity with data visualization tools like Domo or Power BI, enabling robust and efficient data handling. Familiarity with PBM software and pharmacy claims processing systems, ensuring seamless integration and analysis of diverse data sources. Additional Responsibilities: Ability to maintain the confidentiality of sensitive medical information and knowledge of HIPAA Privacy and Security Rules Abide by all obligations under HIPAA related to Protected Health Information (PHI). If a HIPAA violation is discovered, whether individually or by another, you must report the violation to the Compliance Officer and/or Human Resources. Attend, complete, and demonstrate competency in all required HIPAA Training offered by the company. Flexibility to understand, appreciate, and embrace that this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change, or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice. What We Have to Offer Our benefits package is designed to keep our employees happy and healthy – physically, mentally, and financially. Servant Culture Medical, Dental, Vision insurance Disability and Life insurance Total Wellbeing Initiatives Employee Assistance Program Remote work options Generous Paid-Time Off Annual Reviews and Development Plans Retirement Plan with company match immediately 100% vested Required Skills and Competencies Strong analytical skills and proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages, including SQL, Python, or R. Understanding of pharmacy benefit terminology, formulary management, and medication pricing, providing a solid foundation for effective program analysis. Previous experience in healthcare analytics, pharmacy benefit management, or a related field, with a preference for experience in healthcare data analysis. Excellent communication and presentation skills, capable of conveying complex analyses clearly and persuasively. Attention to detail and the ability to work independently and as part of a team, fostering a collaborative and precise work environment. Position Type and Expected Hours of Work Full-time, salary/exempt position. Some flexibility in hours is allowed, but the employee must be available during the “core” work hours of 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM CT. We cover clients from the West to East Coast, work times must be adjusted to cover meetings in all time zones. Ability to work extended hours, weekends, and holidays pursuant to industry demands. Travel This position requires minimal travel. Required Education and Experience Bachelor's degree in data science, statistics, healthcare management, or a related field; advanced degree preferred. 2 years experience in data reporting or analysis role. Preferred Education and Experience: Familiarity with pharmacy claims coding terminology preferred. Degree or equivalent experience; preferably in a technology or technical business discipline. Intermediate level knowledge with any of the following: SQL Server or other RDMS, SSRS, or Power BI. Liviniti, LLC provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Liviniti complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training. Liviniti expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of Liviniti employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge. EOE M/F/V/D

Contribute to data standardization functions including data definition, quality, and lifecycle. Related experience may be substituted for the education on a year-for-year basis or Master’s degree in Business Administration, Public Administration or Policy, or related field from an accredited school and one (1) year of experience of data analysis or related field. Ability to translate high-level business requirements into specific database and analytic tasks. Ability to summarize large amounts of complex data from multiple resources into management reports. Ability to work independently. Ability to problem solve to determine root causes of anomalies. Ability to work on multiple projects and activities in parallel. Working knowledge of reporting and visualization software tools such as PowerBI, Tableau, etc. Demonstrated ability in the use of Windows and Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Excellent interpersonal and verbal communication skills and team-first mentality. Preferred Attributes: Knowledge of PRT transit system and Allegheny County. We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package. Interested candidates should forward a cover letter (with salary requirements) and resume. EOE https://careers.portauthority.org/positiondetails?job=567
summary: Pittsburgh Regional Transit is seeking a Data Analyst to provide data analysis and reporting, ensure data quality, and contribute to data warehousing and standardization. The role involves translating business requirements into data tasks, summarizing complex data, and working independently on multiple projects.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: Business Intelligence (BI) supports the business with data, reports and analytics ranging from operational to strategic, for monitoring, gaining insight and improving business performance. The role of a Business Intelligence Analyst Level 3 is to elicit, analyze and validate the advanced and complex BI needs of the business. This includes interviewing stakeholders, gathering, and compiling user requirements to understand the solutions they need. The BI Analyst will apply communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to present the right data in the right format to help the business make the right decision. Essential Responsibilities: Keep up to date with functionality and advanced features of Cognos / MicroStrategy tools Acquire knowledge of business processes and source data Receive requests from the business and prioritize accordingly Research and identify the key business metrics and KPIs that will be needed for the report Lead storyboarding sessions to assist business users in defining requirements Document the business initiatives and deliverables of the request Test and validate the deliverable to ensure it is accurate and ready for the user Address issues and resolve requests for additional information Maintain clear and open line of communication with business users Provide guidance and support to junior BI analysts Take ownership of projects Adhere to B&H policies and procedures including data security/privacy guidelines Adhere to B&H policies and procedures including data security/privacy guidelines Preferred Education, Experience and Licenses: 8+ years using Cognos / MicroStrategy or other BI tools Expert understanding of Business Intelligence and data science Advanced SQL coding language expertise Knowledge of python coding language Expert understanding of Data Warehouse design and data models
summary: A Business Intelligence Analyst Level 3 is responsible for understanding and fulfilling complex business intelligence needs. This involves gathering requirements, creating reports and analytics, and presenting data in a way that helps the business make informed decisions. The role requires advanced technical skills in BI tools (Cognos/MicroStrategy), data science, SQL, and Python, along with strong communication and problem-solving abilities.

title: Operations Data Analyst I
description: Description Position Summary Credit One Bank is looking for an Operations Data Analyst I to support the overall growth of the organization. The Operations Data Analyst I will focus on improving and maintaining customer service standards through the analysis of diverse business systems and processes. The individual in this position will work within the Operations Analytics team and will be responsible for collecting, consolidating, analyzing, and visualizing data from various sources, with the purpose of optimizing processes, improving operations systems, and providing the best card member experience. The ideal candidate is driven by analysis, efficiency, and quality, and will be ready to help guide the direction of a growing company. Summary Of Essential Job Functions Prepare operational reports by collecting, interpreting, evaluating, and summarizing information and trends to develop integrated business analyses and projections for incorporation into strategic decision-making Recommend systems improvements to senior management based on analysis of current practices, outcomes, and trends. Participate in the implementation and monitoring of approved changes In collaboration with direct manager and peer analysts, conduct internal stakeholder research to support strategic and business planning Perform daily, weekly, and monthly reviews and analyses of current processes using department-defined operational metrics and reports Understand and communicate the financial and operational impact of changes to procedures or strategies Perform other duties as assigned Position Requirements Bachelor’s degree in engineering, mathematics, computer science, or related quantitative field 2-5 years of experience in research or analytics environment, including programming, data mining, analysis, and reporting Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy Demonstrated knowledge of data processing and analysis tools such as Python and reporting tools like Tableau Ability to work independently and with others Demonstrate company core values of excellence, ownership, collaboration, and integrity Preferred Master’s degree any quantitative/STEM field Professional experience using Python for data analysis/statistics and Tableau for data visualization Excellent written and verbal communication skills Knowledge of credit card banking industry practices, regulations, and standards Understanding of standard business and customer service practices Credit One Bank, N.A. is a data-driven financial services company based in Las Vegas. Founded in 1984, Credit One Bank offers a spectrum of credit card products for people in all stages of financial life. Credit One Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of age, race, religion, color, disability, sex, sexual orientation, or national origin. Reasonable accommodations can be made for those who require them, including access to job applications and workplace accommodations. Employment at Credit One Bank is based on mutual consent (also known as at-will). This means that employees and the Bank may terminate the employment relationship at any time, with or without cause and with or without notice. Please contact the recruiter for this position to learn more. Credit One Bank does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies and is not responsible for related fees.
summary: Credit One Bank is searching for an Operations Data Analyst I to analyze data, optimize processes, and enhance customer service standards. This role involves collecting, analyzing, and visualizing data from various sources to support strategic decision-making and improve operational systems. The ideal candidate possesses strong analytical skills, experience with Python and Tableau, and a focus on efficiency and quality.

title: Sustainability Data Analyst
description: Why join us? Our purpose is to design for the good of humankind. It’s the ideal we strive toward each day in everything we do. Being a part of MillerKnoll means being a part of something larger than your work team, or even your brand. We are redefining modern for the 21st century. And our success allows MillerKnoll to support causes that align with our values, so we can build a more sustainable, equitable, and beautiful future for everyone. GENERAL PURPOSE The Sustainability Analyst will conduct activities that progresses the objectives of the Sustainability and Stewardship department. Responsible for collecting, analyzing, developing, and maintaining information to support the Sustainability tools and objectives. Serves as a liaison between sustainability, product stewardship, product development, product management, and external supply chain to administer activities related to corporate sustainability and compliance programs. Assignments focus on effectively assessing sustainability metrics to improve the environmental impact of the MillerKnoll organization. Essential Functions Creates workflows and documents standard work processes related to product sustainability metrics and Compliance Map with accuracy and effectiveness. Functions as a power user of key sustainability databases (Compliance Map, CMAP) and tools; ensures data is managed and maintained accurately and consistently across multiple tools. Onboard suppliers and internal MillerKnoll users to navigate and upload data to key sustainability database programs (CMAP). Executes compliance campaigns for low to medium-complexity products, collects, analyzes, and synthesizing data collected from the supply chain to review technical reports and compliance declarations. Conducts final analysis and summarizes identified compliance risks with sustainability regulations, standards, and certifications. Prepare detailed and thorough analyses and research related to strategic sustainability initiatives to assist with reporting requirements, and monitor achievements and performance to plan, such as single-use plastics and carbon emissions reductions. Track invoices, monitor payment status, and maintain detailed records for budget planning purposes. Communicates professionally with internal and external customers in support of department objectives and activities. Coordinate and assist with special projects as needed. Performs additional responsibilities as requested to achieve business objectives. Qualifications To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Education/Experience Bachelor’s degree in business administration or related field OR technical/vocational associate's degree (such as in Mathematics or Science) OR 3-5 years previous clerical experience in a technical field. Skills And Abilities Excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills. Proven ability to follow-up and perform with minimal supervision. Demonstrated ability to handle confidential information. Demonstrated ability to effectively use office automation/communication software and tools currently being used in the HMI office environment. Demonstrated ability to effectively initiate and execute a complex project with minimal supervision. Demonstrated ability to rely on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish assigned tasks and goals. Strong time management, multitasking and process management skills. Customer service focused. Demonstrated ability to follow documented processes. Demonstrated ability to embrace change in an evolving work environment. Demonstrated ability to communicate technical information effectively to people with various levels of technical knowledge. Good technical writing skills. Experience writing and reviewing formal technical reports preferred. PHYSICAL DEMANDS The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Must be able to perform all essential functions of the position with or without accommodations . Who We Hire? Simply put, we hire everyone. MillerKnoll is comprised of people of all abilities, gender identities and expressions, ages, ethnicities, sexual orientations, veterans from every branch of military service, and more. Here, you can bring your whole self to work. We’re committed to equal opportunity employment, including veterans and people with disabilities. This organization participates in E-Verify Employment Eligibility Verification. In general, MillerKnoll positions are closed within 45 days and are open for applications for a minimum of 5 days. We encourage our prospective candidates to submit their application(s) expediently so as not to miss out on our opportunities. We frequently post new opportunities and encourage prospective candidates to check back often for new postings. MillerKnoll complies with applicable disability laws and makes reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees with disabilities. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact MillerKnoll Talent Acquisition at careers_help@millerknoll.com.
summary: The Sustainability Analyst role at MillerKnoll involves collecting, analyzing, and managing data related to product sustainability metrics and compliance programs. This includes using sustainability databases like Compliance Map and CMAP, onboarding suppliers, executing compliance campaigns, and preparing reports on strategic sustainability initiatives. The ideal candidate possesses excellent communication and organizational skills, along with experience in technical fields, data management, and compliance reporting.

title: Data Analyst
description: Job Description Special Instructions to Applicants: All interested applicants should attach a cover letter and a resume in the Supporting Documents section of the application. We suggest the documents be in a PDF format to avoid formatting issues. Position Summary The Data Analyst in Graduate and Postdoctoral Studies performs technical and professional work in support of the Office of Graduate and Postdoctoral Studies in both operations and functions and provides the Dean of Graduate and Postdoctoral Studies and the Provost with data and data analysis essential for informed decision-making through comprehensive data analysis and reporting to understand and improve graduate programs and the graduate student experience at Rice, with training by and in collaboration with the Office of Institutional Research and the Data Warehouse team. This position develops and maintains internal publications and presentations; designs, formats, and compiles data required for developing and producing specialty reports; and formulates responses to general data requests from internal and external stakeholders. The ideal candidate should be a good listener, able to discern the questions asked that can be addressed with existing and non-existing data. To be creative and eager to learn both the culture of graduate study and the data tools. They must be patient, organized, detail-oriented, self-critical, and comfortable pivoting based on emerging needs; possess logical, solid, and quantitative skills, with the ability to grasp and explain the academic context behind the data; and display excellent written/verbal communication and organizational skills. This is a full-time benefits-eligible position in a prominent, central administrative office with a pay range of $63,100 - $80,000, depending on experience and qualifications. * Exempt (salaried) positions under FLSA are not eligible for overtime. This position is initially on-campus, with the opportunity to be hybrid (2 days from home) after three months. It must be Texas-based. Per Rice policy 440 , work arrangements may be subject to change. Minimum Requirements Bachelor’s Degree Two years of related experience In lieu of the experience requirement, additional related education above and beyond what is required may be substituted on an equivalent year-for-year basis. Skills Ability to work in a fast-paced, demanding environment Proficient in Microsoft Office products (Access and Excel), business intelligence software such as Tableau, and statistical software such as SPSS, SAS, and/or R Proven quantitative and qualitative research skills Work under limited supervision and follow through on assignments Seek and incorporate iterative feedback on work product Collaborate and be effective in working with diverse populations and with all constituencies of Rice Communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing Exhibit organizational skills and be detail-oriented Think critically and creatively, have a high standard of integrity, and be motivated to incorporate and model best practices into the organizational culture Ability to collect, organize, analyze, interpret, identify relevant trends, and present information in a meaningful manner using large datasets and databases Present a wide range of data visually for diverse audiences Preferences Bachelor’s Degree in a technical field Experience working for an academic institution with institutional data Familiarity with academic cloud tools such as Technolutions’ Slate, Banner, and Oracle ERP Cloud Experience building APIs to connect data sources to cloud tools and dashboards Essential Functions Under limited supervision, designs, formats, and compiles data required for the development and production of specialty reports and projects Identifies and compiles data and completes survey submission requests from various external entities Develops and maintains assigned internal publications Uses software to produce aggregate data for dissemination Creates numeric and graphic displays for succinct and meaningful consumption for multiple audiences Prepares regular status reports Participates in regional and state forums and professional, institutional research organizations Updates and maintains the GPS website with public data products to support prospective graduate student decision-making. Interprets data, identifies relevant trends across the campus and other institutions, and recommends aligned next steps Effectively communicates research findings and other information in written and spoken word and graphic or tabular displays. Performs all other duties as assigned Additional Functions Collaborates with the Data Warehouse team and GPS Data Steward to continue the buildout of the Data Warehouse Builds and provides support for university KPI management, and builds university intelligence dashboards Collaborates with other technical users, university administrators, and non-technical stakeholders across the university Implements and enforces processes and tools that will maintain understanding, integrity, and accuracy of data, identifies and executes automation opportunities for process improvement to advance university efficiency goals Rice University HR | Benefits: https://knowledgecafe.rice.edu/benefits Rice Mission and Values: Mission and Values | Rice University Rice University is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity at all levels and considers for employment qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national or ethnic origin, genetic information, disability, or protected veteran status. About Us Boasting a 300-acre tree-lined campus in Houston, Rice University is ranked among the nation’s top 20 universities by U.S. News & World Report. Rice has a 6-to-1 undergraduate student-to-faculty ratio, and a residential college system, which supports students intellectually, emotionally and culturally through social events, intramural sports, student plays, lectures series, courses and student government. Developing close-knit, diverse college communities is a strong campus tradition, which is why Rice is highly ranked for best quality of life and best value among private universities.
summary: The Data Analyst in Graduate and Postdoctoral Studies at Rice University analyzes and reports on data related to graduate programs and the graduate student experience.  The role involves using business intelligence software (like Tableau), statistical software (SPSS, SAS, R), and data analysis techniques to produce reports, presentations, and visualizations. They collaborate with the Office of Institutional Research and the Data Warehouse team to ensure data accuracy and identify automation opportunities.

title: Technical Data Analyst
description: Responsibilities Kforce's client, a Detroit MI-based automotive manufacturer who brings engineering, technology, and design together to create innovative vehicles, energy solutions, and in-vehicle services, is seeking a Technical Data Analyst. The main function of a Technical Data Analyst is to coordinate changes to computer databases, test, and implement the database applying knowledge of database management systems. Responsibilities: Work with senior management, technical and client teams in order to determine data requirements, business data implementation approaches, best practices for advanced data manipulation, storage and analysis strategies Write and code logical and physical database descriptions and specify identifiers of database to management system or direct others in coding descriptions Design, implement, automate and maintain large scale enterprise data ETL processes Modify existing databases and database management systems and/or direct programmers and analysts to make changes Test programs or databases, correct errors and make necessary modifications Resolving customer tickets for PC's and printers Printing labels, production labels, production support labels Assisting the customer with any manufacturing system issues that they encounter Number of tickets every day vary, low volume shop Troubleshoot a lot of different things Attend manufacturing and production meetings Requirements Bachelor's degree in a technical field such as Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field required 2-4 years of applicable experience required Experience with database technologies Knowledge of the ETL process Knowledge of at least one scripting language Strong written and oral communication skills Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills Demonstrated history of success Desire to be working with data and helping businesses make better data driven decisions The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future. We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave. Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law. This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions. Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.
summary: Kforce is seeking a Technical Data Analyst to coordinate database changes, testing, and implementation. Responsibilities include determining data requirements, designing ETL processes, modifying databases, testing programs, and troubleshooting technical issues. The ideal candidate will have a Bachelor's degree in a technical field, 2-4 years of experience, and strong data analysis skills.

title: Healthcare Data Analyst
description: Provides analysis needed to support the business in making decisions related to healthcare cost and quality improvement. The analyst will partner with internal customers to understand their needs, develop metrics and reports, and translate data into actionable strategies.
