title: Lead Data Analyst
description: For a faster response, kindly add and follow us on linkedIn. rk@brainwaveprofessionals.com. Lead data analyst (onsite) NYC Hybrid • Minimum of a bachelor's degree in computer science or business or equivalent work experience. • 12+ years of experience working data analyst including exposure to complex data models. • Skill in creating reporting dashboards to convey actionable insights clearly and quickly, as well as the ability to tailor communications to different audiences without sacrificing clarity. • 12+ years of experience working with SQL and relational data including exposure to complex data models. Solid skill writing queries. • Very Good knowledge with Snowflake, Redshift, and comfortable working with large-scale datasets • Experience identifying and debugging data problems and anomalies, driving ever-cleaner data for reporting layers. • A constant eye for automating, improving and documenting internal processes and workflows.
summary: Lead Data Analyst position in NYC, requiring 12+ years of experience working with SQL, relational data, complex data models, Snowflake, Redshift, and large-scale datasets. Strong reporting and communication skills are essential.

title: Data Analyst - Energy
description: About Us Groundbreaker. Game changer. Pioneer. TRC has long set the bar for clients who require more than just engineering, combining science with the latest technology to devise innovative solutions that stand the test of time. From pipelines to power plants, roadways to reservoirs, schoolyards to security solutions, clients look to TRC for breakthrough thinking backed by the innovative follow-through of an industry leader. TRC's professionals work with a broad range of commercial, industrial and government clients and the communities they serve. We deliver breakthrough solutions that address local needs -- so our clients can better succeed in an ever-changing world. Working at TRC means tackling interesting, meaningful projects. We pride ourselves on our collaborative spirit, entrepreneurial zeal and agile corporate structure. We recognize that the expertise of our staff is our strongest asset, so we generously reward employees for successful performance and invest in their careers through training and the development of new skills and certifications. Overview TRC’s Energy Transition Solutions team, within the Advanced Energy practice, is focused on developing and deploying decarbonization and transportation electrification solutions for our clients, focusing on transit and state energy agencies, airports, ports. The Energy Transition Solutions team is 100% client-focused on: Working across TRC to bring cross- company electrification, energy planning and technology deployment expertise to our clients. Working directly with clients’ planning, sustainability, resiliency and capital programs teams to support energy demand modeling and electrification planning. Integrating building and transportation electrification data sets to develop actionable plans and reports. Working directly with charge management providers and other energy consultants to access EV charging utilization data on behalf of our clients. Developing easy to understand and actionable energy analyses and dashboards to support deployment of transportation electrification assets (EVSE and DERs) and enabling technologies such as charge and load management solutions. The Data Analyst - Energy will join a team of experienced energy and transportation consulting staff and have the opportunity to continue to learn about the clean energy industry, learn new analytic skills, and participate in the growth of the Advanced Energy practice. No project is the same, and Energy Analysts get exposure to different types of work in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. This position requires the ability to communicate effectively and coordinate with internal technical team members and external customers. Responsibilities The overall responsibilities of Data Analysts - Energy are to: Perform a variety of energy-related analytic tasks and analyses under the direction of senior team members. Analyze, interpret and integrate data from a variety of sources including EV charging forecasts, existing EV and electric equipment charging utilization, and building and transportation energy demand forecasts. Partner with internal data management experts to ensure client data sets and deliverables are leveraging best practices for data integrity, data automation and data visualization. Help translate results of analysis into actionable recommendations for clients, with oversight. Perform assigned work as instructed, within budget allocated and scheduled needs for deliverables of project. Manage time across multiple projects, proactively seeking support when needed to understand/troubleshoot tasks or balance competing priorities Qualifications Degree in Technical Field, Data Science, Math or equivalent field 3-5 years' professional experience Excellent written and verbal communications skills Capable of maintaining a high energy level to handle a dynamic, fast-paced workload Excellent organizational skills Demonstrated ability to work as part of a team Enthusiasm for learning new skills and can-do attitude Preferred Qualifications Preferred qualifications are not required for an applicant to be considered a candidate for the position. Proficiency with the following software: Python (or other database programming languages), PowerBI, Tableau (or similar data visualization software), Microsoft Office Suite. Excellent writing and presentation skills. Demonstrated attention to detail, communication and organizational skills. Understanding of the mechanics of the energy market, transportation electrification and EV charging to analyze complex data. Benefits * : TRC offers a competitive benefit package consisting of: Medical, dental, vision, and disability insurance. 401k package that includes both traditional and Roth IRA options and Company match. Paid time off contingent upon full time or part time status and level of seniority (ranging from 15 to 25 days per year). All full-time employees enjoy a minimum of 8 Paid Holidays per year. TRC ensures that all employees, including those that work part-time, receive paid sick, family, and disability leave in accordance with the laws of their state of residence. These benefits are applicable to US employees depending on their employment status (full time, part time, or temporary). TRC offers jurisdiction specific benefit packages for International and Puerto Rico employees. Compensation : In accordance with local law, the below salary range is applicable for the job and location associated with this requisition. Compensation will vary based upon experience, education, skill level, geographical location, and other compensable factors. Other Compensation: Employee may be eligible for participation in the Company’s annual Discretionary Bonus Program which is contingent on Company, Business Segment, and Individual performance against Key Performance Indicators which vary by year and employee. Disclaimers TRC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. All employment decisions are made based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. The complete job description and application are available on TRC’s career site. TRC accepts applications for this position on an ongoing, rolling basis and reserves the right to cancel this posting at any time. Salary Range USD $68,000.00 - USD $75,000.00 /Yr.
summary: TRC is seeking a Data Analyst - Energy to join its Energy Transition Solutions team. This role will involve analyzing data from various sources, including EV charging forecasts, energy demand forecasts, and electric equipment charging utilization. The analyst will help develop actionable recommendations for clients, work with internal data management experts, and translate results into understandable reports and dashboards. This position requires strong analytical skills, proficiency in Python and other database programming languages, experience with data visualization software (Power BI, Tableau), and excellent communication skills. The ideal candidate will also have an understanding of the energy market, transportation electrification, and EV charging.

title: Data Analyst
description: This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Experience Level: Experienced Hire Categories Engineering & Technology Location(s): Remote - United States, US At Moody's, we unite the brightest minds to turn today's risks into tomorrow's opportunities. We do this by striving to create an inclusive environment where everyone feels welcome to be who they are-with the freedom to exchange ideas, think innovatively, and listen to each other and customers in meaningful ways. If you are excited about this opportunity but do not meet every single requirement, please apply! You still may be a great fit for this role or other open roles. We are seeking candidates who model our values: invest in every relationship, lead with curiosity, champion diverse perspectives, turn inputs into actions, and uphold trust through integrity. The Predictive Analytics group transforms our data into state-of-the-art analytics to help clients make better decisions in the face of uncertainty. Our clients come from a wide range of industries such as banking, insurance, commercial real estate and many more. They use our economic research to evaluate credit-worthiness, to monitor risks and opportunities when weighing up major investment decisions as part of their corporate strategy. Our team is made up of intellectually curious economists, data scientists, and IT professionals who combine technical skills with a strong desire to understand clients' needs. Role/Group As a Data Analyst, you will have the opportunity to contribute to a team responsible for generating and delivering industry leading risk metrics to a variety of products offered by Moody's Analytics. The Data Analyst may perform a variety of different data management job functions, including data analysis, data processing, data operations, and data support. This position involves a blend of qualitative/quantitative financial research and technical skills to source and maintain credit risk data and models. This position is for you, if you are a quick learner, have a passion for data to identify trends, uncover patterns, solve problems and your favorite question is ‘why'. The Corporate Credit Data group is responsible for managing the critical processes that ensure the accuracy and timely delivery of vital financial data that is linked to our industry-standard credit risk measurement tools and related software applications. This role will facilitate that process, working with the engineering, IT, support, and development teams to ensure the timely and seamless delivery of data to clients. Responsibilities Support and resolve data quality and delivery issues of complex credit risk models and complex data pipeline with accuracy and in a timely manner Fulfill data delivery and data requests for existing and prospective clients accurately and meeting deadlines Respond to client data queries in a timely and accurate way Engage in problem solving with Customer Success and Client Support to ensure a resolution to client queries Support Data Engineering and Data Quality Team to monitor data delivery and data pipeline status, communicate and solve issues. Support Research, Engineering, Quality, Product Team in data projects, including testing and specifications. Analyze and solve data issues from external data providers, including exploration of new data sources Identify ways to improve data inquiry and delivery processes either by automation or other means Perform data analysis using a variety of methods including statistics and relational databases Perform quality control on data by analyzing patterns and data discrepancies and resolve related issues Produce reports using Business Intelligence tools that describe data characteristics and highlight trends and issues Contribute towards documentation of the processes/projects Qualifications Requires Bachelor's degree in Economics, Statistics, Finance, Accounting, Operations, Engineering or a related field. Graduate degree and/or 1-2 years of work experience is a plus. Superb analytical skills, persistence in problem solving, excellent in data mining and code debugging, and ability to learn quickly and independently Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to manage multiple projects with tight deadlines Excellent and professional written and oral communication skills Exposure or interest in financial services space Ability to understand and analyze basic financial statement data, fixed income data, macro-economic statistics, and credit risk measures Ability to understand basics from credit risk model research papers and data specifications. Efficient in SQL and Database management tools (SQL Server, PostgreSQL, etc.) Efficient with a scripting language (Python) Experience working with AWS (Athena, S3, Glue jobs, etc.) Experience in a statistical package (R) Proficiency in MS Office, especially MS Excel Exposure to GenAI tools Preferred Work experience with Product team, Engineering team and other data team roles. title: Data Analyst
description: THE POSITION Washington County Cooperative Library Services (WCCLS) Is Seeking Our First Ever Data Analyst. The Library Data Analyst Will Synthesize And Analyze Disparate Data Sets, Creating Insightful Reports To Help WCCLS And Libraries Make Data-informed And Outcome-focused Decisions That Promote More Equitable Access To Public Library Services In Our County. The Library Data Analyst Will Lay The Systemic And Technical Groundwork Needed To Analyze large amounts of data, detecting trends and providing recommendations and solutions that will enable WCCLS to increase efficiency, identify opportunities, tell the story of our impact, and improve overall business performance. Implement evaluation frameworks, data collection, and analysis strategies for WCCLS programs and services. Communicate the value of public libraries in the county with data that is visually compelling and easy to understand. Operationalize the creation and delivery of standard reports, custom reports, and dashboards. Public library service in Washington County is delivered by a partnership between WCCLS, nine (9) cities, and three (3) nonprofit agencies. WCCLS is the primary funding source for public libraries in the county and provides critical infrastructure and support services to link independently operated libraries together into one system for the community. WCCLS' annual operating budget is approximately $40 million, of which $28 million is funding allocated for public library operations. To learn more about WCCLS and our role as the engine of our library cooperative, visit wccls.org/about . Ideal Candidate You are passionate about the vital and ever-evolving role public libraries play in our communities and are inspired by WCCLS' vision to create a curious, engaged, and literate community where everyone is welcome and thrives. You are familiar with the type of data sets libraries work with, as well as with public library operations. You have the drive to lead the creation of new systems of work in an organization, the emotional intelligence to thoughtfully lead change, and the patience to continue to make incremental progress on long-term goals. You create systems and processes to improve outcomes and increase equity of access, and you thrive working collaboratively with internal teams and external organizations. As the Library Data Analyst, on any given day you may find yourself: Working with stakeholders to build out visual dashboards to support reporting needs. Leading an internal team at WCCLS to submit our Oregon Public Library Statistical Report and collate data for libraries to do the same. Meeting with the WCCLS Leadership Team to identify opportunities to bring data analysis to bear on decision-making. Evaluating current data collection processes and prospects across teams. Creating efficiencies in data gathering and reporting via automation. For a complete list of essential duties, please use this link: Data Analyst Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply for jobs unless they believe they can perform every job description task. We are most interested in finding the best candidate for the job and that candidate may come from a variety of backgrounds and lived experiences. If you are interested in applying, we encourage you to think broadly about your background and skill set for the role, even if you believe you do not meet all the hiring criteria described above. Minimum Qualifications A Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university with major course work in Math, Computer Science, Statistics, Sociology, or a related analytic degree. AND Two (2) years of work experience in programming or a related field that included performing analysis, statistical evaluation, database design, maintenance, and administration, and statistical reporting. Please be clear and specific in the applicable sections of the employment application about how your background is relevant, including your volunteer experience. Next Steps Apply today! In lieu of a resume, you are required to complete and submit an online application, which will be used to screen for minimum qualifications (MQs) and to determine starting pay in accordance with the provision of the Oregon Equal Pay Act. MQ Review: HR will screen applications for MQs after the posting closes - after July 14, 2024. Subject Matter Expert (SME) Review: Depending on the number of applicants that meet MQs, a SME panel may perform an in-depth evaluation of your application materials, including your responses to the supplemental questions. This process will begin after July 21, 2024. Panel Interview(s): Our goal is to schedule panel interviews with candidates who successfully pass the SME review as soon as possible. Conditional Offer of Appointment: Human Resources will conduct a salary analysis for the successful candidate(s) and extend an offer of appointment. Post-Offer Check: The successful candidate(s) will undergo background, driving record, physical capacity/medical, and reference checks. Start Date: A start date will be determined after all conditions of employment have been met. Please note: This recruitment may be used to fill future full-time and part-time vacancies in the same classification, or job family, that may become available within the next six-month period. Our Commitment to You We are committed to using a merit-based system in which recruiting, selecting, and advancing employees is based on their relative knowledge, skills, and abilities. Washington County values a culture of equity, diverse perspectives, and life experiences. Our organization embraces innovation, collaboration, and work-life harmony. We are an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to diversity and an inclusive workforce. Women, minorities, veterans, and people with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Veterans' Preference: If you are a veteran and would like to request veterans' preference points for this recruitment, please review instructions using this link: Veterans' Preference Points Accommodation under the Americans with Disabilities Act: A reasonable accommodation is available to anyone whose specific disability prevents them from completing this application or participating in the selection process for this recruitment. To obtain confidential assistance, please contact Human Resources at 503-846-8606 or careers@washingtoncountyor.gov at least 48 hours before the step(s) of the selection process for which you feel you need an accommodation. Additional Resources Questions about this recruitment? Contact Mia at mia_richards@washingtoncountyor.gov New to GovernmentJobs.com? Visit https://www.governmentjobs.com/home/applicationguide for a comprehensive, step-by-step guide on the application process. Need technical support? Call Government Jobs' Live Application Support at 855-524-5627.

title: Master Data Analyst
description: Business Integrated Solutions Division (BISD) is seeking a Master Data Analyst with demonstrated experience in data analytics to work as a key member of Business Analysis and Testing Support team. This analyst will support teams working in Agile (Sprint) as well as traditional Waterfall methodologies for Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC). Responsibilities include analyzing problems; documenting business processes and data lifecycle; developing data requirements, user stories and acceptance criteria; and testing. VDOT is a fast-paced organization with very high standards for work quality and efficiency. This position is expected to handle multiple projects, and remain flexible and productive, despite changing priorities and processes. Ongoing improvement and efficiency are a part of our culture, and each team member is expected to proactively contribute to process improvements. Responsibilities: Work with the Project team members and business stakeholders to understand business processes and pain points Develop expertise in the customers' datasets and data lifecycle Profile source data; review source data and compare content and structure to dataset requirements; identify conflicts and determine recommendations for resolution Conduct entity resolution to identify matching and merging and semantic conflicts Elicit, record, and manage metadata Diagram current processes and proposed modifications using process flows, context diagrams and data flow diagrams Client and document requirements and userstories with a focus on improving both business and technical processing Decompose requirements into Epics and Features and create clear and concise user stories that are easy to understand and implement by technical staff Utilize progressive elaboration; map stories to data models and architectures to be used by internal staff to facilitate master data management Identify and group related user stories into themes, document dependencies and associated business processes Assist Product Owner in maintaining the product backlog Create conceptual prototypes and mock-ups Collaborate with staff, vendors, consultants, and contractors as they are engaged on tasks to formulate, detail and test potential and implemented solutions Perform Quality Analyst functions such as defining test objectives, test plans and test cases, and executing test cases Coordinate and Facilitate User Acceptance Testing with Business and ensure Project Managers/Scrum Masters are informed of the progress Qualifications Required: The candidate must have a minimum of 10 years of experience delivering business data analysis artifacts 5+ years of experience as an Agile Business Analyst; strong understanding of Scrum concepts and methodology Experience organizing and maintaining Product and Sprint backlogs Experience translating client and product strategy requirements into dataset requirements and user stories Proficient with defining acceptance criteria and managing acceptance process Experience with enterprise data management Expertise with Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, Access, Outlook, Visio, PowerPoint, Project Server) Experience with reporting systems – operational data stores, data warehouses, data lakes, data marts The candidate must have exceptional written and oral communications skills and have the proven ability to work well with a diverse set of peers and customers Preferred: Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) and/or Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO) Certification Certified Data Management Professional (CDMP) Experience using Team Foundation Server and work item tracking Experience with automated testing tools such as Test Complete
summary: This position requires a Master Data Analyst with 10+ years of experience in data analytics to join the Business Analysis and Testing Support team. The analyst will support teams in both Agile (Sprint) and traditional Waterfall methodologies for Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC). This position requires strong communication skills, proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, and experience with reporting systems. title: CX Data Analyst II
description: About SimpliSafe We're a high-tech home security company that's passionate about protecting the life you've built and our mission of keeping Every Home Secure. And we've created a culture here that cares just as deeply about the career you're building. Ours is a no ego culture of collaboration and innovation where those seeking their next challenge can find big opportunities and make a huge impact on the lives of all those who we protect. We don't just want you to work here. We want you to grow and thrive here. We're embracing a hybrid work model that enables our teams to split their time between office and home. Hybrid for us means we expect our teams to come together in our state-of-the-art office on two core days, typically Tuesday and Wednesday, to work together in person, and teams can choose where they work for the remainder of the week. We all benefit from flexibility and get to use the best of both worlds to get our work done. Why are we hiring? Well, we're growing and thriving. So, we need smart, talented, and humble people who share our values to join us as we disrupt the home security space and relentlessly pursue our mission of keeping Every Home Secure. What You'll Do The SimpliSafe CX Analytics team is looking for a Senior Analyst to support our Customer Operations team. In this role you will have the opportunity to influence this critical agent team that executes on a number of customer servicing efforts including technical support, back office and agent help desk. This is a unique opportunity to own the full lifecycle of data analysis, reporting, and strategic partnership with Operational leadership. You will collaborate across the organization with other analysts, engineers, and operational leaders to understand and leverage existing data sources, develop new data sources, and conduct cross-functional analysis. Your work will have a direct impact on Customer Service performance and the company's overall business success. Primary responsibilities include: Sift through raw data, partnering with a variety of technical and non-technical teams, to create structured, high quality data assets to support analysis and reporting Organize and mine datasets to find drivers of loyalty performance at both the channel and agent level, identifying optimization opportunities Develop metrics in support of agent performance to drive maximum impact Lead analytics efforts and drive creation of standardized KPIs, reports, and executive dashboards (familiarity with Tableau a plus) Lead the development of measurement frameworks for pilots and experimentation within the channel to advise on the success of tactics Act as strategic thought partner with Customer Service team leaders, proactively sharing insights and emerging issues, and making strategic recommendations What You'll Bring BS in a quantitative field or equivalent experience (Analytics, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Engineering or related field) 5+ years of equivalent experience or Masters +3 years Strong technical skills, including experience with query and data visualization tools. SQL, Excel and a BI tool (Tableau preferred) are core requirements, with experience in coffee development using git repos a plus Strong analytical and creative problem-solving skills Extreme attention to detail but with the ability to work collaboratively in a dynamic, cross-functional environment Excellent communication skills with the ability to synthesize concepts for non-technical audiences and effectively engage partners across all levels of the company Ability to work independently and collaboratively. Going beyond the question asked to proactively understand the question behind the question and create/structure your own analysis plan What Values You'll Share Customer Obsessed - Building deep empathy for our customers, putting them at the core of our work, and developing strong, long-term relationships with them. Aim High - Always challenging ourselves and others to raise the bar. No Ego - Maintaining a "no job too small" attitude, and an open, inclusive and humble style. One Team - Taking a highly collaborative approach to achieving success. Lift As We Climb - Investing in developing others and helping others around us succeed. Lean & Nimble - Working with agility and efficiency to experiment in an often ambiguous environment. We wholeheartedly embrace and actively seek applications from all individuals, no matter how they identify. We are committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we believe our work is enriched when we incorporate a multitude of perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences. We want everyone who works here to thrive and contribute to not only our mission of keeping every home secure, but also to making our workplace safe and supportive for others. If a reasonable accommodation may be needed to fully participate in the job application or interview process, to perform the essential functions of a position, or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact careers@simplisafe.com .
summary: SimpliSafe is looking for a Senior Analyst to join their CX Analytics team. This is an opportunity to work in a hybrid work environment and contribute to the company's mission of keeping Every Home Secure.

description: Senior Financial Analyst - Operations Since 2022, Associated Materials / Alside has been undergoing a transformation to maximize our potential through investments in people, operations, and brands. If you want to be part of a company where your ideas and input are more than just encouraged--they are valued--this is the place for you. At Associated Materials / Alside, your contributions will provide an immediate and lasting impact, helping us achieve what is possible. Position Summary Responsible for the distribution part of the business and finance in the distribution centers. Develop strategic relationships across various parts and levels of the business, leveraging core responsibilities of the position to create business value. Develop and deliver timely and accurate forecast, budgets, reports and analysis for assigned business units. Measurably improve assigned business units operational and financial performance through industry accepted financial practices. Key Accountabilities Deliver insights and results for SG&A to bring a more robust decision-making process to deliver insights across the enterprise. Identify and analyze operational results to identify opportunities for improvement and partner with Operations to drive improvements. Develop reporting tools to better facilitate communication between Sales and Operations to increase sales growth. Leverage business process knowledge and data querying skills to obtain / validate / analyze data. As necessary, present data and relevant conclusions to management, sales, operations, and other business unit stakeholders. Analyze information requests, assess current sources, and determine best (i.e. effective and efficient) means to meet information needs. Compile routine and ad hoc research & analysis in support of management's business unit objectives. Other duties as assigned. Required Education, Experience & Skills Bachelor's degree in Finance is required with a MBA preferred. 5+ years of progressive experience in FP&A role in a corporate setting. Experience in a distribution or supply chain environment understanding complex distribution in financial areas. Proficiency in Excel (Pivot Table, Formulas, Standard Reports, etc.) Proficiency with delivering analysis and SG&A experience. Experience in financial reporting and variance analysis. Experience with Data analytics. Strong technical and interpersonal skills. Associated Materials is a leader in exterior building products for residential and commercial remodeling and new construction markets. We produce vinyl windows, vinyl and composite siding and accessories, and metal building products--and distribute other essential building products to ensure customers find everything they need for their exterior. Headquartered in Cuyahoga Falls, Ohio, more than 4,000 associates across North America support Associated Materials. We operate 11 manufacturing facilities and more than 100 Alside and over 20 Gentek supply centers across the United States and Canada. Through our unique combination of award-winning products, manufacturing and distribution operations, installation solutions, and support services, the opportunities at Associated Materials are endless! Associated Materials ... title: Analista de BI
description: Job Description Estamos buscando uma pessoa Analista de BI para o Time Vetta! Você fará parte de um time de projetos de desenvolvimento e sustentação de sistemas de forma remota, sempre conectado com seus pares e colegas, irá alinhar o trabalho e as demandas com os Gestores no cliente e apoiará o time de desenvolvimento. VOCÊ JÁ CONHECE A VETTA? Na Vetta, acreditamos que a tecnologia e a inovação são essenciais para criar um futuro mais sustentável e eficiente para todos. Como uma empresa líder em digitalização industrial, nossas soluções estão ajudando clientes em todo o mundo a reduzir o consumo de energia, a melhorar a eficiência operacional e apoiar a transição energética através da descarbonização. Ao se juntar à nossa equipe, você terá a oportunidade de trabalhar em projetos emocionantes e desafiadores com alguns dos maiores especialistas da indústria . Além disso, você fará parte de uma equipe dedicada em gerar um impacto positivo no mundo e em ajudar nossos clientes a alcançar seus objetivos de negócios. O Time Vetta sabe a importância do trabalho em equipe e da colaboração para alcançar resultados que atingem todo o globo – ao mesmo tempo que a carreira de cada um é transformada. Se você quer compartilhar a sua perspectiva para um mundo mais sustentável, venha ser parte do Time Vetta! 💙 Responsibilities and assignments Nesse Time, Você Terá a Oportunidade De Atuar em desenvolvimentos e manutenções de painéis de BI conectado com fontes externas; Extração e manipulação de grandes conjuntos de dados; Desenvolvimento de relatórios automatizados; Realizar governança de dados; Garantir a integridade e a qualidade dos dados através de processos de validação e verificação; Realizar análises de dados para identificar tendências, padrões e insights. Requirements And Qualifications O que esperamos de você para essa vaga: Power BI; T-SQL; SQL Server; Conceitos de Data Warehouse e boas práticas de modelagem e performance; Será Desejável Se Você Tiver Experiência em identidade visual. Additional information Nossos Benefícios Sendo uma empresa voltada para pessoas, buscamos sempre valorizar a nossa equipe. Ao entrar para o Time Vetta, oferecemos: Cartão Vale Alimentação e Refeição de R$32,00/dia, para ser utilizado em vários estabelecimentos de alimentação e de refeição de acordo com as suas necessidades. Auxílio home office de R$100,00/mês, além de flexibilidade no horário de trabalho. Caso trabalhe no escritório da Vetta, em Belo Horizonte, oferecemos Vale transporte. Pensando no cuidado, oferecemos Plano de saúde e Plano odontológico, com a possibilidade de inclusão dos seus dependentes. Total Pass e Vittude para que você possa cuidar, integralmente, da sua saúde ao praticar atividades físicas e ter contato com profissionais de diferentes áreas da saúde. Clube de Descontos Online – Swile Shop, com descontos em diversas redes de produtos e de serviços. Licença maternidade e paternidade estendida, para os pais e mães viverem essa fase com tranquilidade. PLR - conforme tabela do sindicato. E TEM MAIS... Day-Off de Aniversário. No Dress Code. Vista-se com o que te deixa confortável! Programa de Incentivo à Formação Contínua e Capacitação, para que você possa continuar aprendendo e compartilhando experiências. Quer indicar alguém para a Vetta? Temos Programa de Indicação de Talentos. Se interessou em fazer parte do time? Cadastre-se agora! Ficaremos felizes em ter você conosco. 💙 Process stages Step 1: Registration1Registration Step 2: Entrevista People2Entrevista People Step 3: Mapeamento Comportamental 3Mapeamento Comportamental Step 4: Entrevista Técnica4Entrevista Técnica Step 5: Proposta5Proposta Step 6: Hiring6Hiring TRANSFORMING BUSINESS TO IMPROVE THE WORLD Somos uma empresa global de digitalização industrial , com duas décadas de experiência no segmento, que contribui com a eficiência operacional e com a redução do consumo de energia e de gases através da descarbonização . Acreditamos que, com inovação e ação , podemos tornar o mundo mais sustentável e os processos industriais mais eficientes. Atuamos em conjunto com a SMS group, líder mundial no segmento de metais, e somos responsáveis pelo desenvolvimento de soluções digitais para nossos clientes em mais de 14 países pelo mundo. As nossas soluções contam com a combinação de experiência em processos, know-how de inteligência artificial (IA) e recursos de desenvolvimento de software para resultar em tecnologias de ponta e de otimização. Queremos trazer soluções inovadoras, buscando melhores formas de tornar a indústria e o futuro mais sustentável por meio da descarbonização. Quer fazer parte dessa história? #VemSerVetta Todas as nossas vagas são inclusivas e abertas a todos e todas sem distinção por deficiência (PCD), raça, cor, religião, gênero, nacionalidade ou qualquer outra forma de diversidade.

title: Data Analyst
description: Codeworks is an IT Services firm headquartered in SE Wisconsin, known for our strong commitment to quality and for our direct client relationships. Who We’re Looking For: A Data Analyst with expertise in SQL for a long term remote contract role! Responsibilities: Serve as a liaison between business and technical teams to design and implement efficient data integration processes. Create and maintain Source to Target (S2T) documentation. Develop complex SQL queries and scripts to manipulate and analyze data effectively. Gather requirements from stakeholders and develop user stories. Translate business requirements into detailed technical specifications. Perform root cause analysis on systems issues. Conduct data analysis using complex datasets to identify patterns, trends, and insights. Plan and execute rigorous testing procedures to ensure system functionality, performance, and reliability. Perform data reconciliation and analyze test results. Conduct user acceptance testing (UAT) and collaborate with stakeholders to resolve issues or defects. Perform gap analysis and cost benefit analysis as needed. Mentor and train users on business and systems analysis methodologies. Collaborate with data quality tools, frameworks, and business intelligence platforms. Support data governance initiatives including security and privacy policies. Elicit and refine requirements for dashboards and reporting. Create comprehensive documentation including system requirements, design specifications, and user manuals. Conduct training sessions and workshops to educate end-users on system functionalities and best practices. Manage multiple concurrent projects and tasks effectively. Demonstrate strong interpersonal skills including communication, mentoring, collaboration, and team building. Qualifications: Required Skills and Experience: Minimum 5 years of experience serving as a liaison between business and technical staff for designing and implementing data integration processes and maintaining S2T documentation. Minimum 5 Years Of Experience Developing Complex SQL Queries. Minimum 5 years of experience gathering requirements, developing user stories, and translating business requirements into technical specifications. Minimum 5 years of experience performing root cause analysis and data analysis with complex datasets. Minimum 2 years of experience planning and executing rigorous testing procedures, performing data reconciliation, and conducting user acceptance testing. Proficiency with tools such as Jira, SharePoint, Teams, Alteryx, SSIS, SSRS, SSMS, Squirrel, SQL Server, Tableau, Semarchy, Git & GitHub. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to think critically and identify innovative solutions. Experience with data quality tools, business intelligence platforms, and data governance. Strong understanding of different types of data models. Experience creating comprehensive documentation and conducting training sessions. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or related field (preferred). About Codeworks: Codeworks has over 25 years of experience serving Fortune 1000 companies in Wisconsin as well as our client's national locations. Our recruiting team excels at evaluating, advising, and connecting IT professionals with new opportunities that will satisfy their expectations regarding income and opportunity for growth. At Codeworks, we're committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion in our workforce and beyond. We believe in equal opportunities and value the unique perspectives that every individual brings to our team. Join us in creating an inclusive, innovative, and collaborative workplace where your talents can thrive. Codeworks is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, or national origin.

title: Data Analyst
description: We are looking to hire a data analyst to join our data team. You will take responsibility for managing our master data set, developing reports, and troubleshooting data issues. Data Analyst Responsibilities Managing master data, including creation, updates, and deletion. Managing users and user roles. Provide quality assurance of imported data, working with quality assurance analysts if necessary. Commissioning and decommissioning of data sets. Processing confidential data and information according to guidelines. Helping develop reports and analyses. Managing and designing the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadata. Supporting the data warehouse in identifying and revising reporting requirements. Supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalization. Assessing tests and implementing new or upgraded software and assisting with strategic decisions on new systems. Generating reports from single or multiple systems.

title: Healthcare Data Analyst
description: Title: Clinical Data Specialist Location: Remote - Raleigh, North Carolina. Duration: Long Term Contract Job Description This position will serve as a Subject Matter Expert on clinical data and electronic health record systems and will act as a liaison between health care providers and the HIE to improve quality of the data sent to the HIE. This position will involve use of Mirth Interface Engine, Intersystems HealthShare Health Insight, HealthShare Clinical Viewer, and SAS technologies in support of the our client Health Information Exchange Authority. The Candidate shall: Assist in defining data quality guidelines and processes. Monitor processes and tools used to improve data quality. Track all Data Quality work via tickets in the NC HealthConnex ticketing system. Respond promptly to reported data quality issues. Work with participants and vendors to improve data quality. Participate in data analyst, project, staff, and other meetings. Report project progress and results to staff as needed. Knowledge, Skills, Abilities: • Understanding of healthcare IT architectural principles, technical designs, and specifications • Excellent verbal and written communication skills including the ability to interact and communicate effectively with non-technical clients • Ability to think analytically and problem solve • Subject matter expert (SME) level of knowledge working with clinical data, electronic health record (EHR), HL7 v2 (primarily ADT data), and C-CDA messages • At least 3 years of experience working with electronic health record data, experience with Admission, Discharge, and Transfer (ADT) preferred • Ability to run and modify basic SQL queries • Experience with analyzing and documenting processes and requirement specifications and developing clinical workflows • Knowledge of HIPAA and health care regulatory compliance as they relate to EHR systems and Health Information Exchange (HIE). • Experience with Microsoft Office Tools, including Microsoft Project, Visio, Excel, and PowerPoint.
summary: This role involves acting as a Subject Matter Expert on clinical data and electronic health record systems, serving as a liaison between healthcare providers and the HIE to improve data quality. Responsibilities include defining data quality guidelines, monitoring processes, tracking data quality work, responding to issues, collaborating with participants and vendors, attending meetings, and reporting project progress.

title: Data Analyst 3
description: The Virginia Department of Health's Division of Informatics and Information Systems is seeking an Analytics and Visualization Specialist to assist with communicable disease data reporting and analysis. The Division of Informatics and Information Systems is responsible for the organization, presentation, analysis, and verification of epidemiological health information across the Commonwealth of Virginia . The Analytics and Visualization Specialist will be responsible for data analysis and development of data visualization projects for various communicable diseases, primarily for COVID-19. This position will report to the Division of Informatics and Information Systems (DIIS) Data Analytics Manager. Essential Functions Leverages appropriate analytic tools (SQL, Tableau Prep, Tableau Desktop, R, GCP, others)to integrate, clean, and transform public health and healthcare data. Builds analyses and visualizations, dashboards usingappropriate software (Tableau Desktop, R/Python, GCP, others) for a variety ofpurposes and audiences. Purposes may include public reporting, performanceevaluation, decision analytics, data quality analysis, and/or scientificpublication. Audiences may include the public, healthcare providers, communityaction groups, other government agencies, specific VDH disease programs, and/orVDH leadership. Maintains,republishes, and enhances data products according to established cadences(e.g., daily, weekly, annually). Workscollaboratively with business stakeholders and subject-matter experts to defineand refine requirements. Documentsdetailed description of data cleaning steps, sources, filters, assumptions, andpurposes. Maintains Documentation related to data visualizationprocesses, tools, and best practices while continuing to enhance existingprocesses and procedures. Proactivelyidentifies and communicates data quality issues and addresses issues arisingfrom data processing. Conductsother duties as requested/assigned. Communicationto stakeholders both internal and external via email, PPT presentations as wellas internal presentations Job Qualifications Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor'sDegree or equivalent combination of experience and education Strong data analysis skills in SQL, Tableau, R/Python,and Microsoft Excel Experienceworking collaboratively with diverse groups and projects with defined timelines Strongattention to detail and accuracy Strongcommunication skills Self-starter Preferred Qualifications Preferred > 2 years' experience with Tableauand SQL Familiarity with health/public health data Flexibility towork on multiple projects/issues simultaneously. Knowledgeof relational databases. WordPressknowledge ArcGIS/workingwith geospatial data
summary: The Virginia Department of Health seeks an Analytics and Visualization Specialist to analyze communicable disease data, primarily for COVID-19. Responsibilities include data integration, cleaning, transformation, analysis, visualization, and dashboard development using tools like SQL, Tableau, R, and GCP. The role involves working with stakeholders, documenting processes, ensuring data quality, and communicating findings to various audiences.

title: Lead Data Analyst
description: Greif offers a great working environment and the opportunity to make an immediate impact at a company where your ideas are always welcome. Job Requisition #: 028008 Lead Data Analyst (Open) Job Description Major Responsibilities: Engage with business users, data stewards and stake holders to assist implementation of data management program enabling them to manage data efficiently and consistently with high quality while holding them to account Provide functional and technical leadership to educate data owners, stewards and stake holders the why and how of data management in ERP and other enterprise applications in the areas of CRM, Pricing, HR, financial consolidation, maintenance, MES, quality, transportation etc., Oversee operations of cross functional teams & engage with data owners, stewards to adhere to and maintain the master data governance processes Determine and prioritize key data and data attributes such as customers, suppliers, Items, chart of accounts, finance dimensions that need to be harmonized within a system and across multiple systems Participate in data migration activities to ensure compliance of data governance processes during data cleansing, data creation, data conversion, issue resolution, and data validation Establish, maintain and document data standards, data definitions using enterprise business glossary, data security and data privacy. Assist in defining roles and responsibilities related to data governance and ensure clear accountability for stewardship of the company's principal information assets Lead the development and implementation of data quality metrics and dashboards to proactively identify and resolve data quality issues in close coordination with data owners and stewards. Coach/support business colleagues in data quality control through mentorship Perform other duties as assigned Education And Experience Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Data Analytics or equivalent 5+ years’ experience implementing ERP in functional / configuration role including data migration and data management Working experience in business functions such as Finance, Commercial, Supply Chain, Logistics, Procurement and Manufacturing People management experience is a plus Experience in applications in the areas of CRM, Transportation, MES, Quality, Pricing, financial consolidation is a plus Manufacturing industry experience is preferred Experience in Agile methodology / scrum approach is a plus Knowledge And Skills Excellent written, verbal communication, presentation, project management skills Strong interpersonal skills Ability to work within a team environment using consensus building to achieve a desired result Consistently exhibits a positive, “can-do” attitude 40 EEO Statement https://www.greif.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/HR-101-Equal-Employment-Opportunity-Policy-English.pdf We offer a competitive salary, excellent benefits and opportunity for growth. Greif, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. We will not discriminate against any applicant or employee on the basis of sexual orientation, gender identity, race, gender, religion, age, national origin, color, disability, or veteran status. EOE/Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran. For more information read Greif’s Equal Opportunity Policy.
summary: Greif is seeking a Lead Data Analyst to implement and manage their data management program. Responsibilities include engaging with stakeholders, providing technical leadership, overseeing cross-functional teams, determining key data attributes, participating in data migration, establishing data standards, and developing data quality metrics. The ideal candidate has a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Data Analytics, 5+ years of experience implementing ERP in a functional/configuration role, experience in business functions like Finance, Supply Chain, and Manufacturing, and strong communication, interpersonal, and project management skills.

title: Data Analyst/Developer
description: For those currently located within commuting distance to Northampton MA: would you enjoy a career where you make a positive difference to the environment? As a Windsor Data Analyst/Developer, you are a critical member of a product implementation team that serves our many clients. You enjoy helping our environmental agencies transform data so that they can more efficiently and effectively take the needed actions to improve the environment. During each work day, you thrive as you work independently while contributing as an active team member. About Windsors Solutions, Inc. We are an established, small company headquartered in Portland, OR and we carry a passion for safeguarding and improving our environment. We connection information systems and streamline processes for environmental agencies. Ours is the leading solution in the US. Work life rarely has a dull moment. Your contributions and ideas will be encouraged because we have fostered a team culture where what you say is truly valued. Specific responsibilities will include Developing ETL (extract/transform/load) routines to migrate data from an existing client’s system(s) into Windsor-developed products. Supporting existing clients by troubleshooting and correcting issues in database objects (procedures, functions, triggers). Developing new database objects to support enhanced product functionality. This position requires a high level of proficiency of Microsoft SQL Server’s core platform and T-SQL coding, debugging, and performance tuning. Your communication skills are also critical: you provide effective collaboration with all stakeholders such as Windsor business analysts, the client, and other team members. You gather and define business requirements with clients. As part of your job, you convey technical concepts to non-technical individuals and communicate business requirements and specifications. Once gathered, a major part of your role is to merge these requirements into the project architecture. You are motivated towards building a long-term future with us and, like all team members, we are motivated to invest in you. Your role over time may shift and grow as you develop skills and seek new responsibilities. Skills Required Data Analyst Capabilities Microsoft SQL Server development (stored procedures, SQL queries, performance tuning) Expert knowledge Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes and tools Knowledge of how to retrieve, process, and migrate data from disparate client source systems which are stored in a variety of file formats, DBMSs, and file systems Ability to move and transform that data into the Windsor target proprietary platform Other Minimum 3 years experience as a data analyst Strong verbal and written communications skills Technical Skills Develop code using PowerShell and T-SQL Communicate technical details with the team and client Have an understanding of data models which may include relational, dimensional, entity-relationship, logical and physical and the conversion between logical to physical. Bring SQL Server operational experience – not necessarily at DBA level – but at a functional level. This experience includes basic administrative knowledge such as backup, recovery, moving, partitioning, and both logic and performance enhancements. Communication Skills Experience in requirements gathering with diverse stakeholders, documenting decisions and providing status updates as needed. Be able to translate technical concepts and findings into clear and actionable insights for non-technical audiences. Work closely with product owners and developers to implement product improvements at the database level. Demonstrate resourcefulness in problem-solving and balance independence with escalation when needed. Summary You are good fit at Windsor if you know how to: Target business process functions Relate to the underlying data model(s) Work with the big picture Get into the precise details of a problem Process and operate on existing data If needed, transform and load that data into a client’s existing system Troubleshoot logic and performance with SQL Server stored procedures Communicate to clients with an end result and client satisfaction in mind You need to work independently on your own but also enjoy being a team player.
summary: Windsor Solutions, Inc., an environmental solutions company, is seeking a Data Analyst/Developer to join their team in Portland, OR. The ideal candidate will have strong experience with Microsoft SQL Server, ETL processes, and data migration, and will be responsible for developing and maintaining database objects, troubleshooting issues, and gathering business requirements. The role requires excellent communication skills and the ability to work both independently and as part of a team.

title: Data Analyst - Data Governance Analyst
description: Position Description and Job Skill Set Processing Data and Public Records Requests: Receiving Requests Receive and log incoming data and public records requests from non-media parties. Ensure requests are properly documented and tracked for timely processing. Legal Review and Redaction: Assist in legal review of requested documents to determine necessary redactions to protect sensitive information before release as public records. Ensure compliance with legal requirements and agency policies regarding public records disclosures. Data Retrieval and Compilation: Coordinate with relevant departments or personnel to retrieve requested data and compile necessary documents for disclosure. Ensure completeness and accuracy of information provided in response to requests. Response Preparation Prepare responses to data and public records requests in accordance with established timelines and legal requirements. Draft correspondence and documentation ensuring clarity and completeness in responses. Communication And Follow-up Communicate with requesters to clarify requests, provide updates on processing status, and coordinate delivery of requested information. Maintain records of communications and actions taken related to each request. Microsoft Purview Oversight: Serve as the primary compliance contact for the implementation and oversight of the agency's Microsoft Purview application. Microsoft Purview is a data governance tool that helps organizations map, manage, and govern their data across various sources. - Data types to be brought under Purview oversight and management include: data/files within enterprise Microsoft 365 applications (Outlook, SharePoint, OneDrive, Teams, Exchange, etc.) and other on-premises, multicloud, and software as a service (SaaS) data. Data cover a range of public health subject matters such as: disease surveillance and reporting, environmental health (water supply, wastewater, food protection, etc.), vital records and statistics, and professional and healthcare facility licensure, just to name a few. Key Purview duties and responsibilities include: Data Cataloging: Organizing and indexing data assets for easy discovery and understanding. Data Classification: Applying labels and tags to data based on sensitivity and regulatory requirements. Data Lineage: Tracking the origins, movements, and transformations of data throughout its lifecycle. Data Insights: Providing analytical capabilities to derive insights and enhance decision-making. Data Compliance: Ensuring data usage complies with regulatory standards and internal policies. Policy Development and Compliance: Collaborate with the Director of Data Governance to develop and revise policies, Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), and guidelines related to data management and governance. Ensure that policies align with federal and state data laws, regulations, and organizational objectives. Monitor and interpret federal and state data protection laws, regulations (such as HIPAA), and industry standards. Develop training materials and conduct sessions to educate agency staff on data governance policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements. Foster a culture of compliance and data stewardship across the organization. Data Management And Systems Development Collaborate with the Director of Data Governance in developing and designing data management applications and systems. Aim to improve the agency's data capabilities for public health purposes. Provide general support to the agency in its projects funded under the CDC Public Health Infrastructure Grant (PHIG), specifically under Strategy A3: Data Modernization. Projects include: Cataloging and organization of agency data resources with the ultimate goal of creating a public facing agency-wide data catalog, Assisting with the selection and implementation of an updated process for managing external requests for data and public records Supporting the creation and implementation of project timelines Consistent and effective communication with agency staff supporting the projects, and maintaining focus on project goals and meeting deadlines Assist with the collecting, organizing and leveraging large amounts of data across multiple subject matters to enable more accessible utilization and analysis of the data using data lakes, warehouses, lakehouses, catalogs, etc. Required Skills/Experience Proficiency in Microsoft 365 applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, Teams) and Adobe
summary: This role involves managing data and public records requests, ensuring compliance with legal requirements, and overseeing the agency's Microsoft Purview application for data governance. Key responsibilities include legal review, data retrieval, response preparation, communication with requesters, data cataloging, classification, lineage tracking, and policy development. The role also includes collaborating on data management applications and systems development, supporting CDC Public Health Infrastructure Grant (PHIG) projects, and leveraging data across multiple subject matters for analysis.

title: Senior Analyst, ITP Analytics
description: The ITP process represents the short-term execution horizon of Consumer Packaging’s Integrated Business Plan for the America’s Consumer Packaging division, a $2.8 billion dollar business with 35 converting facilities across North America. The ITP Sr. Analyst position is responsible for developing and managing a Demand and Supply balance model in the Integrated Tactical Planning (ITP) Window for the Consumer Packaging Division. This analyst will also perform related analysis that will drive understanding of changes to the demand and supply model to help identify business actions that will drive improvements to the business plan. This analyst will publish ITP materials for the weekly ITP business rhythm meetings along with ITP metrics and reporting. This role will complete analyses that drive ITP and strategic decisions. The role will need to work across multiple departments and various levels of the organization to complete their work. The work may be varied and can be somewhat difficult with challenging timelines. The primary responsibilities of the Senior Analyst position are: Build Reports and participate in weekly ITP meetings. Build Demand/Supply Model and related reporting. Generate weekly FG projections for Consumer Packaging division. Create FG Inventory planning targets and reporting including gap analysis with plant collaboration. Responsible for the development, management, and distribution of business metrics and reporting for ITP. Lead and participate in cross-functional continuous improvement projects for short term planning and aged/excess inventory reduction. Complete on-demand data mining and complex ad hoc analysis concerning inventory management, sales data, production data and metrics while managing standard role responsibilities. Document Standard Operating Procedures and update as needed. Support continuous improvement for process ITP and short-term planning. Build and foster constructive partnerships with key stakeholders, cross functional teams to ensure project success and cross-team collaboration. Ensure effective, accurate and timely communication by preparing and delivering regular updates to leadership, sponsors, and other key stakeholders as required. Identify and implement best-in-class practices to enable the execution of our inventory strategy. Requirements : Bachelor’s degree with emphasis in one of the following: Industrial Engineering, Supply Chain Management, or Operations Management, MBA not required but a plus. 5-8 years in Supply Chain, Logistics, and/or Analytics preferred. Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel, SQL, Alteryx, Power BI, Qlik Experience with utilizing modeling to shape and support data-driven decisions. Advanced critical thinking and problem-solving skills. Proven ability to think strategically about initiative objectives and map the strategy into a detailed project plan. Lean Six Sigma Green Belt / Black Belt is a plus Must possess superior communication skills, diplomatic style A desire to roll-up your sleeves to drive large projects to successful completion Demonstrates reliable and consistent professionalism Up to 15% travel required Self-starter, consistent, quick learner, critical thinker, passionate about problem-solving, and able to complete advanced high-quality analysis with tight deadlines.
summary: This role involves developing and managing a demand and supply balance model for the Consumer Packaging Division, performing related analysis to drive understanding of changes, publishing ITP materials, and leading continuous improvement projects.

title: Analyst, Insights & Analytics
description: This position is critical to understanding brand business performance in order to help develop strategies and recommendations to inform future brand direction. The expectation is that this individual will report on information critical to business insights and decision-making. The Analyst on the Brand Data & Analytics team will be a key resource for the brand in answering business questions efficiently and effectively for all cross functional partners. Responsibilities Insight Generation – Generate insights that improve the business through linking various data sources (e.g., sales, competitor, market, customer, etc.) Business Analysis – Analyze brand performance and sales trends, including promotional and test analyses KPI Reporting – Create and maintain reports that assess ongoing business performance, leading indicators, and explanatory factors Ad Hoc Reporting – Develop, execute and deliver reports based on brand business requirements for various stakeholders across the organization Brand Performance – Analyze and monitor key metrics across brand health, product performance, and guest experience to assist in analyzing, understanding, and recapping the impact of overall business performance and/or promotional marketing programs Strategy Consulting – Provide guidance and strategic recommendations on promotional marketing initiatives across all levels of the organization, utilizing both quantitative and qualitative measures; present strategic recommendations based on sound financial analysis to large and small audiences across all levels of the organization Relationship Management – Develop and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders and partners while collaborating effectively across the organization to achieve objectives Project Management – Ensure that all medium/long term projects are implemented on time and achieve business goals and objectives Education And Experience Qualification Required Minimum: Bachelor’s Degree (preferably in Business Management, Data & Analytics, Marketing, Finance, or other relevant discipline) Required Minimum: 1-2 years relevant experience in relevant field or masters degree preferred REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS Or ABILITIES Results driven with the ability to perform successfully with limited supervision Have the ability to compile sound business recommendations Strong problem solving and analytical skills with the ability to research, reconcile, and arrive at conclusions Time management skills in order to prioritize and manage deadlines Comfort working in the fast-paces QSR segment with the ability to turn around deliverables for senior management with shore timeframes Proactive, team player but also able to work independently Excellent verbal, written communication, and presentation skills Excellent interpersonal skills, positive attitude, and effective collaborator committed to getting the job done Proficiency with Microsoft Office applications, with expertise in Excel (e.g., pivot tables, advanced functions, formulas, filtering, etc.) Relational database proficiency with SQL experience Inspire Brands is a multi-brand restaurant company whose portfolio includes more than 32,000 Arby’s, Baskin-Robbins, Buffalo Wild Wings, Dunkin’, Jimmy John’s, and SONIC restaurants worldwide. We’re made up of some of the world’s most iconic restaurant brands, but we’re much more than just a restaurant company. We’re a team of hundreds of thousands who individually and collectively are changing the way people eat, drink, and gather around the table. We know that food is much more than a staple—it’s an experience. At Inspire, that’s our purpose: to ignite and nourish flavorful experiences.
summary: The Brand Data & Analytics Analyst role focuses on understanding brand business performance, generating insights, and developing strategies to inform future brand direction. This role requires strong analytical, communication, and presentation skills to effectively interpret data, create reports, and provide strategic recommendations to various stakeholders within the organization.
hard_skills: Excel (Pivot Tables, Advanced Functions, Formulas, Filtering)

title: Data Insights Analyst
description: Join Our Team as a Data Analyst Are you passionate about turning data into valuable insights? Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment and have a knack for analyzing trends and patterns? If so, we are looking for someone like you to join our Business Intelligence Department at Beovexis. As a Data Analyst with us, you will play a crucial role in interpreting data, developing databases, and creating impactful reports. We appreciate your interest in joining the Beovexis team and will reach out to selected candidates. Let's make a difference together! Employment Type: Full-Time
summary: Beovexis is seeking a Data Analyst to join their Business Intelligence Department. Responsibilities include interpreting data using statistical techniques, developing databases, acquiring and maintaining data, identifying trends, ensuring data integrity, monitoring performance, and creating reports and presentations. Ideal candidates will possess a College Diploma or University Degree in Business Administration, have three years of experience in reporting and analytics, be proficient in Microsoft Excel, familiar with Microsoft Power BI and/or Oracle NetSuite, and have a strong motivation to excel in the cannabis industry.
