title: Data Specialist
description: Working within a global team of data analysts, data scientists, and content experts, the Portfolio Manager Success Specialist will work closely with Portfolio Managers and Analysts to anticipate their needs. You will be responsible for the following: Actively support, train, and engage with investment professionals within a given business line or geographical region. Operate as the point of contact for the full suite of Data Intelligence products and data to give our investment professionals a competitive advantage. Collaborate with and connect stakeholders across the firm to identify solutions, and product enhancements. QUALIFICATIONS & REQUIREMENTS Bachelor’s/master’s degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Economics, or a related field. Strong ability to perform data analysis and wrangle data using Python. Understanding of SQL and relational databases. Familiarity with AWS, Git, Airflow is a plus. Firm understanding of time-series data, third-party data vendors, and how they apply to quant and fundamental analysis. Prior experience with financial data and its use is strongly preferred. Strong troubleshooting and creative problem-solving abilities. 4 days in office in New York or Chicago
summary: A Portfolio Manager Success Specialist will work with Portfolio Managers and Analysts to anticipate their needs, train them on data intelligence products, and identify solutions and product enhancements. The role requires data analysis, Python, SQL, and AWS experience.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: Job Overview A Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for collecting and analyzing data to identify trends and patterns that inform future business decisions. Their duties include complex data modelling, designing data analysis methodologies and compiling reports to present to senior management. Responsibilities and Duties Liaising with internal and external stakeholders to identify areas of the business that could benefit from analysis Reviewing data collection processes and assessing the validity of the information stored Using, researching and assessing data processing software Identifying anomalous data and examining and eliminating any processes or procedures that contribute to unreliable data being collected Working closely with the IT department to ensure that the data collection and storage systems are secure and robust And other duties assigned by supervisor or manager Qualifications Education Associate’s degree is a related field, preferred Experience In-depth understanding of database design and management, including SQL and data modeling Excellent mathematical skills, particularly in statistics Expertise in computer programming, data mining and data visualization techniques Problem-solving skills and creativity Business administration skills
summary: A Business Intelligence Analyst collects and analyzes data to identify trends and patterns for business decision making. Responsibilities include complex data modeling, designing data analysis methodologies, and creating reports for senior management. They collaborate with stakeholders, assess data validity, utilize data processing software, and ensure data security and robustness.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: About Aurora Solar Aurora is on a mission to create a future of solar for all. Our award-winning software puts the power of data and technology into the hands of every solar professional to make solar adoption simple and predictable. Our software has designed millions of solar projects so far, empowering solar companies to sell, design, and install residential and commercial solar arrays accurately, seamlessly, and at scale. We are a remote-first collaborative team of sustainable energy enthusiasts who love what we do. We’ve been named one of "The Best Mid-Sized Remote Companies To Work for in 2024" by BuiltIn.com and have been recognized for the second time as a Certified Green Business (CGB) with the city of San Francisco. We’re in this together to support the world’s transition to solar. About The Team You’ll be joining a team of seasoned data professionals covering data engineering, analytics engineering, and analytics. We’re collaborative, curious, and passionate about applying data to solve one of society’s most pressing issues. About The Role In this role, you will work cross-functionally with Finance, Product, and Go-to Market teams to design dbt data models, build compelling dashboards, and source relevant data from various SaaS applications. You will not only draw insights from disparate data sets through compelling visualizations but also partner with teams to guide decision making, forecasting, and execution. You’ll partner with data engineering to ensure data is available and work closely with analytics engineers and analysts to follow dbt and Looker best practices. You will report to the Director of Analytics. Your Impact Translate data in insightful dashboards to drive decision making Design and evolve logical and scalable dbt data models that reflect company KPIs Design and maintain Looker dashboards Partner with other analysts to ensure adherence to dbt/Looker best practices, QA dashboards/models, and learn/support other domains’ data needs Engage with cross-functional teams to understand their data requirements; help scope and prioritize these requirements to develop analytics projects and dashboards What You Bring 3+ years of analyst experience using SQL to develop data models and deliver insights 1+ years of experience working with Looker and dbt Solid experience designing and optimizing dbt and Looker models based on business and performance requirements Advanced problem-solving skills Proven ability to communicate effectively to technical and non-technical audiences Experience in full-stack data modeling and owning the end-to-end process ensuring data quality with a focus on back-end data modeling Demonstrated success examining issues, opportunities, and problems, with the ability to work under their own initiative A collaborative mentality with a proven record of engaging with multiple collaborators across different business areas Nice to Haves Python forecasting experience What We Offer 🏖️Flexible PTO - Take the time when you need it 🍼Parental Leave - 16 weeks with 100% base salary + gradual return to work 💰WFH Stipend - An initial $500 (Non-engineers) or $750 (Engineering roles) 🏢 Coworking Stipend - $300 / month if you prefer to be at a coworking facility near you ☀️Energize Fridays - Company-wide days to log off and recharge 📶Connectivity Stipend - Up to $75 / month towards internet or phone 🩺Medical, Dental, and Vision - Premiums are 100% covered for Aurorans and 90% for dependents Please take a look at our 2024 U.S. Benefits Booklet for a deeper dive into our offerings Where Aurorans are: Aurora currently has teams within the US, Canada, Mexico, and Germany with additional locations on the horizon. We’re united in our work to support the world’s transition to solar! Aurora is dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive workforce of people who believe in and are passionate about creating a future of solar energy for all. We are an equal opportunity employer, we welcome and consider qualified applicants regardless of gender identity, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences. We encourage you to apply even if you believe that you do not meet all of the above criteria! Aurora is committed to creating an inclusive and accessible experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation that would better enable your success during the application or interview process, please complete this form. For San Francisco applicants: Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records for employment.
summary: Aurora Solar is seeking a Data Analyst to join their remote-first team. The role involves building dbt data models, creating dashboards in Looker, and working cross-functionally with Finance, Product, and Go-to Market teams. The ideal candidate has 3+ years of analyst experience, 1+ years with Looker and dbt, strong problem-solving skills, and experience in full-stack data modeling. Nice-to-have skills include Python forecasting.

title: Data Analyst
description: At TAYS, every team member is vital. We recognize and celebrate diverse insights, believing they fuel our innovative spirit. We are not just tech-savvy; we are people-centric. you will have a voice. Your unique perspective will help us to solve complex problems, and we welcome your ideas. Here, you will collaborate closely with our clients, forging lasting relationships. We are on a quest for the brightest minds who relish technical challenges. If you are ready to contribute to our vibrant high-tech community, high touch let us uncover possibilities together! Opportunity As a Data Analyst professional, you will collect, process, and perform statistical analyses of data to support decision-making and help the organization achieve its objectives. The role of a Data Analyst involves extracting actionable insights from raw data, creating meaningful visualizations, and communicating findings to various stakeholders within the organization. This position is permanent, W2 position and will consist of a hybrid schedule. The Data Analyst must be within 2 hours of Woodlawn, MD. Primary Responsibilities Data Collection and Processing: Gather and compile data from various sources, ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and reliability. Clean, transform, and preprocess raw data to prepare it for analysis. Data Analysis and Interpretation: Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies within the dataset. Utilize statistical and machine learning techniques to derive meaningful insights and predictions. Identify correlations, causations, and relationships between different data points. Build predictive models and conduct forecasting using statistical methods or machine learning algorithms. Evaluate model performance and refine models based on feedback and changing requirements. Report Generation and Visualization: Develop and maintain SharePoint dashboards, reports, and visualizations to effectively communicate data findings to stakeholders. Present data insights in a clear, understandable manner using visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, etc.). Collaboration and Communication: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives and align data analysis efforts accordingly. Communicate findings, insights, and recommendations to technical and non-technical stakeholders. Continuous Learning and Improvement: Stay updated with the latest trends, tools, and techniques in data analysis and related domains. Proactively identify opportunities to improve data analysis processes and methodologies. Minimum Qualifications 8 years of experience and a Bachelor's in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related field. Expertise in predictive analytics. Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills. Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, SAS, SQL, or similar. Experience with data manipulation and analysis libraries (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, SciPy). Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI). Knowledge of statistical analysis, machine learning, and data modeling techniques. Excellent communication and presentation skills. Ability to work in a collaborative team environment and adapt to changing priorities. The ability to obtain and maintain a Public Trust security clearance. Desired Qualifications Prior SSA experience. Experience with big data. Strong customer relationship management skills. Active Public Trust or higher Why TAYS Is The Perfect Place For You Flexibility: Enjoy a work-life harmony with our flexible working options. Hybrid Work: While our heart is in Baltimore, most of our roles are hybrid. Benefits: Competitive packages, including tuition reimbursement. Leisure: Generous PTO, including 11 federal holidays and 2 floating holidays. Team Events: Quarterly gatherings for team bonding or community service. Military Friendly: We value the dedication and discipline of veterans and service members and urge them to apply. Commitment To Diversity TAYS Inc. is an equal-opportunity employer. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, parental status, veteran status, age, disability, or any other protected class.
summary: TAYS Inc. is seeking a Data Analyst to gather, process, analyze, and interpret data to support decision-making. The ideal candidate will have 8+ years of experience, a Bachelor's degree in a related field, and strong proficiency in Python, R, SQL, SAS, data manipulation libraries (Pandas, NumPy, SciPy), and data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI). The role involves collecting and cleaning data, performing statistical analyses, building predictive models, generating reports, and communicating insights to stakeholders. This is a permanent, full-time position with a hybrid work schedule located within 2 hours of Woodlawn, MD, and requires a Public Trust security clearance.

title: Data Analytics Specialist
description: Responsibilities Kforce has a client that is seeking a Data Analytics Specialist in Bentonville, AR. Responsibilities: Data Analytics Specialist will build a strong relationship with Walmart as a trusted Category advisor across all areas of the Beer business and deliver actionable insights driven by data Lead, motivate and drive strong engagement with internal and external partners Effectively communicate, manage, and prioritize workload across multiple projects Develop impactful category analyses and consumer insights using a range of syndicated and non-syndicated data sources Synthesize learnings from various sources (shopper data, scan data, custom research) to create clear and impactful selling stories in a visually appealing manner using PowerPoint As a Data Analytics Specialist, you will effectively educate internal teammates and external customers on growth opportunities through clear and impactful communications Enhance suite of tools to automate topline performance tracking and influence recommendations across merchants Requirements Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, or similar field 2-3 years of experience in Category and/or data analytics Intermediate - Advanced proficiency utilizing Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint to manipulate and organize data Efficiency in dashboarding software (Power BI) is required Familiarity with syndicated data, software, and measures (IRI, Nielsen, etc.) Strong verbal and written communication skills Ability to use large data sets to develop insights, identify and present opportunities and recommendations to external partners in a persuasive manner The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future. We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave. Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law. This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions. Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.
summary: Kforce is seeking a Data Analytics Specialist to build relationships with Walmart, analyze data from various sources, develop insights, and communicate recommendations to internal and external partners. The role requires strong analytical skills, experience with syndicated data, and proficiency with Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Power BI.

title: Senior Data & Automation Analyst
description: What does a great Senior Data & Automation Analyst do at Fiserv? In this role you will be a member of Fiserv’s Corporate Assurance & Advisory Services (CAAS) Department, an international team covering a wide range and scope of audit activities in the highly regulated payments and card industry. As a Data Analytics & Automation Audit Professional, you will assist the CAAS Department by providing data and automation support to perform independent evaluations of the adequacy and effectiveness of Fiserv’s finance, operations, compliance, and technology functions, with a focused objective to provide support for a variety of audits. In addition, you will assist in the implementation of the automation roadmap for audit, which includes improving audit department efficiency through Robotic Process Automation (RPA), leveraging tools like Alteryx and Power BI to enable continuous auditing. What you will do: Support the implementation of automation capabilities for defined scope areas to increase audit efficiency. Lead the development and implementation of expanding full population analytics. Support the vision and development of continuous assurance monitoring. Assist in the development of the annual risk assessment by implementing KRI’s to define audit universe. Identify risk and achieve management objectives across a variety of processes/functions. Determine effective and efficient automation strategies by developing strong partnerships with key business functions. Provide daily direction and develop / grow automation teams capabilities. What you will need to have: Bachelor's degree with an emphasis in data science, information technology, or equivalent degree or experience in these fields. Proficiency in analytical tools, specifically Alteryx Designer, Alteryx Server, Power BI, SQL, and/or RPA Computer proficiency, specifically Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.) 3-4 years of working experience in Audit or Automation What would be great to have: Experience in business analysis, data analysis, mathematics, data warehousing, statistical data mining, and/or data science Experience in collecting, classifying, and analyzing data. Understanding database schematics or data sets Experience in analysis, data analysis, data visualization, mathematics, statistical data mining, or data science Previous experience with one or more of the following: SAS Software, Tableau, or other data analysis tools Travel required : Up to 5%
summary: As a Senior Data & Automation Analyst at Fiserv's Corporate Assurance & Advisory Services (CAAS) Department, you will support audit activities in the payments and card industry. You'll provide data and automation support, implement automation capabilities, develop full population analytics, and assist in continuous assurance monitoring. You'll also identify risks, develop automation strategies, and lead automation teams.

title: Analyst - Excel Data (Sr)
description: Excel Analyst Reston, VA Must Experienced Excel Analyst 3+ years of experience processing large data sets in an excel environment Must have the ability to forecast, see ahead and anticipate issues, revise plans, then adjusts accordingly Expert level formula and lookup experience Must have the ability to meet deadlines in a high performance environment Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills Must have the ability to handle sensitive information with discretion and a high level of confidentiality Must have strong organizational skills BA/BS Degree required Duties DUTIES: Utilize Excel to process large data sets Manipulate and clean data outputs to provide high quality data analytics Process unstructured data using proprietary software Quadrant is an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, status as a protected veteran, or status as an individual with a disability.
summary: Excel Analyst position requiring 3+ years of experience processing large data sets in Excel. Must have expertise in formulas, lookups, and data manipulation. Strong communication, organization, and confidentiality skills are essential.

title: Marketing Data Analyst
description: Senior Marketing Data Analyst – Driving Data-Driven Marketing Success Are you passionate about transforming data into actionable insights? Join our client's dynamic digital marketing team as a Senior Marketing Data Analyst and play a crucial role in driving revenue-generating strategies today! What You’ll Do: Dive Deep into Data: Use advanced techniques to collect and analyze customer, marketing, and web behavioral data. Your insights will shape the future of marketing campaigns. Master Statistical Methods: Apply statistical techniques to understand user behavior, campaign performance, and conversion rates. Conduct A/B tests to optimize marketing efforts. Predict the Future: Develop predictive models to forecast user engagement, customer lifetime value, and campaign success. Utilize machine learning for segmentation and personalization. Optimize Attribution: Explore multi-touch attribution models to accurately allocate credit across marketing channels and understand the impact of touchpoints on conversions. Visualize and Inspire: Create compelling data visualizations using tools like Tableau or PowerBI. Present findings to stakeholders, translating complex data into actionable insights. Optimize the Marketing Mix: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to analyze the impact of various marketing channels. Help optimize budget allocation for maximum performance. Segment for Success: Use clustering techniques to segment customers based on behavior, demographics, and preferences. Tailor marketing strategies for each segment. Ready to elevate your career with your data expertise? Message Kristen Lee on LinkedIn or apply directly to this posting today! What You Bring: Education: Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field. A Master’s degree is a big plus! Experience: 5 years of industry experience, preferably with exposure to financial products. 2-3 years of direct experience in Marketing Analytics, including web, social media, and campaign performance. Skills: Proficiency in statistical software (R, Python, or similar). Understanding of NLP techniques for analyzing customer feedback and sentiment analysis. Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI). Expert knowledge of marketing analytics tools Strong SQL skills for data extraction and manipulation. Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure).
summary: Senior Marketing Data Analyst role focused on leveraging data to drive revenue generation for a client. Responsibilities include data analysis, statistical modeling, predictive modeling, attribution analysis, data visualization, marketing mix optimization, and customer segmentation.

title: Data Analyst, Enterprise Analytics
description: Job Details Description Caring For the Community You Love Choose a career to make a difference in people's lives every day, choose Fisher-Titus! Perks Of Working At Fisher-Titus Hours of Work- Full time, salary/exempt Comprehensive Benefits Package- Medical & Dental coverage, 401K match, paid time off, tuition assistance and more! Shift, Weekend & PRN differential About Fisher-Titus Fisher-Titus proudly serves the greater Huron County area’s 70,000-plus residents by providing a full continuum of health and wellness care from heart and cancer care to outpatient services such as lab, imaging, and physical rehabilitation. Vision: Be the first choice for healthcare and employment within our community Mission: Deliver compassionate and convenient care to the highest level of excellence that promotes lifelong health and wellness for our community General Summary Responsible for the development, implementation, and support of enterprise analytics dashboards & reports. Essential Functions Solution Development: BI/Data analyst experience or equivalent. Gather and transform business requirements and analysis into specifications that will be used to drive quality solutions Develops solutions in alignment with overall strategic goals and directives. Provide development estimates and timelines for scheduling and planning. Ability to present complex ideas in a clear, concise fashion to technical and non-technical audiences Design, build and implement ETL processes, reports, data visualizations & dashboards Optimize database design, stored procedures, scripts, functions, and other BI components for best performance Define and implement data quality processes to monitor and detect data quality issues Production Support: Provide monitoring and support as required to ensure the availability and performance of enterprise data and BI environments for both external and internal users Provides bridge between technology and departmental customers/end users including ongoing end-user access and usage support Responds promptly according to information Service Level Agreements (SLAs) Supports on-call as assigned As queue manager responded quickly and consistently calling the end user and updating the ticket Supports peers by being available in a secondary or tertiary support level to others in IS both on and off shift as requested Mentors other analysts to enable support for your areas when you are not available Exhibits growth and increased value to FTMC by attempting to solve issues in areas not specifically supported by them Assists in communication between vendors and end users Analyzes needs and advocates for area of responsibility Cooperative, focused, strong work ethic Observation/Rounding - See, ask why, show respect. Spend time monthly with end users to see process and identify issues/opportunities.
summary: This job requires a data analyst to develop, implement, and support enterprise analytics dashboards and reports. The role involves gathering business requirements, designing solutions, building ETL processes, optimizing database performance, and providing production support for enterprise data and BI environments.

title: Data BI Analyst
description: This is a remote position. DISCLAIMER: This job posting is intended for active pooling of candidates who will become part of our talent pool. Your qualifications will be assessed against both current and future job openings. Should your application align with a role that corresponds to your skills and experience, and an opportunity arises, our recruitment team will reach out to you immediately. Please note that this does not guarantee immediate placement or contact. Additionally, we exclusively consider applications from individuals who are currently reside in the US/Canada during their application process. Salary: $65,000 - $75,000 per annum Experience Required: Minimum 1 year of project experience Requirements This person will work with the business to gather requirements, create technical specs for BI report, find and document data sources, document metric logic, pass requirements to the BI developers, and coordinate testing and roll- outs. This role will be essential in coordinating the different activities and phases of the BI projects. You will not build reports because we have BI developers, but we need someone that understand what they do to put proper requirements together. They will be expected to juggle many reports at the same time to keep the developers busy with building and delivering reports. Experience/Skills Needed: Data Warehousing knowledge SQL Data Modeling KPI creation BI Tool knowledge, such as Tableau, Power BI, MicroStrategy Ability to translate abstract ideas into tactical work Project Management experience Wine industry knowledge is a plus! The ideal candidate: The ideal candidate should be comfortable leading meetings, and talking directly to customers. They should be articulate to communicate clearly. Our team is very calm and respectful and we would expect the same from anyone joining the team. We work 100% remote, so being comfortable working over Team is mandatory.
summary: This is a remote BI Analyst role focused on gathering requirements, creating technical specs for BI reports, finding and documenting data sources, documenting metric logic, and coordinating testing and roll-outs. This role will be essential in coordinating the different activities and phases of the BI projects. You will not build reports but will work with BI developers to ensure proper requirements are in place.

title: Data Governance Analyst
description: Tampa, FL (Hybrid) 12+ months Web Cam Interview $45/Hr on W2 Key Responsibilities Support the Relationship Managers with program/project management, administrative, and analytical tasks such as: Partnering with Chief Data Office (CDO) to support data governance programs for data modelling, process mapping, and data taxonomy for various RES functions. Create/modify Relationship Manager process documentation library and support corrective action plans. Coordinate Relationship Manager programs/projects with GSO project manager. Create project plans engaging with necessary teams and stakeholders, track tasks to deadlines, solve issues that may arise, and evaluate project performance. Participate in testing process, including the execution of testing scripts and documenting testing results. Analyzing data to support reporting teams to deliver accurate reports that align to the business needs/requests. Working routine administrative data fixes related to SAR/RFCs. Development Value: The ability to work with global teams from several disciplines on a regular basis. Knowledge \ Experience: 6+ years in Data Governance/Analytics in a corporate environment. 6+ years in Technical / Operations support function. Experience in data governance and project management. Knowledge of Client Business and Systems a plus. Knowledge of Corporate Real Estate a plus. Qualifications: Detailed oriented with strong organizational skills and ability to follow items through entire life cycle to ensure completeness. Bachelor's degree (or equivalent professional and/or academic training). Bilingual skills considered as a plus. Ability to work independently and unsupervised, but willing to communicate and collaborate with peers. Ability to handle short-term deadlines & conflicting priorities. Commitment to accuracy, quality, and attention to detail. Strong organizational & process documentation skills.
summary: This role supports Relationship Managers with program/project management, administrative, and analytical tasks related to data governance. Responsibilities include partnering with the Chief Data Office, creating documentation, coordinating projects, testing, analyzing data, and handling administrative data fixes. The ideal candidate has 6+ years of experience in data governance/analytics and technical/operations support, knowledge of Agile methodologies, strong data handling and organizational skills, and excellent communication abilities.

title: Data Analyst
description: Position Description POSITION OVERVIEW: The Data Analyst is responsible for the full life cycle of data analytics including requirements gathering, analysis design, data collection and cleaning, performing analysis, and reporting findings. This position will support the Portfolio Management Office (PMO) at the Engineering Department and report to the Division Manager of PMO. The candidate is expected to analyze data using a variety of tools and data sources, including QuickBase, Power BI, Paginated Reporting (SSRS), Python, SQL, Excel formulas, as well as commercial cloud platforms such as Snowflake, Power BI’s Cloud Services (e.g., Data Flows and Dataverse) and Amazon Redshift - respectively. JOB DUTIES: Collaborate to build scalable processes and metrics. Extract or mine data from a variety of data sources. Process, clean, and validate the integrity of data for analysis. Analyze large amounts of information to find patterns and solutions. Provide information on analytic results to functional leaders using visualizations including Power BI, data maps etc. Present results in a clear manner. Propose solutions and strategies to tackle business challenges. Liaison with Business and IT teams. All other duties and responsibilities as assigned. Harris County is an Equal Opportunity Employer https://hrrm.harriscountytx.gov/Pages/EqualEmploymentOpportunityPlan.aspx If you need special services or accommodations, please call (713) 274-5445 or email ADACoordinator@bmd.hctx.net This position is subject to a criminal history check. Only relevant convictions will be considered and, even when considered, may not automatically disqualify the candidate. Requirements Education: Bachelor's degree in management Information Systems, Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Technology, or a relevant quantitative field. Experience: A minimum of 5 years of professional experience in Information Systems, Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Technology, or a relevant quantitative field. Knowledge, Skill & Abilities (KSAs): Must have programming experience using Python & SQL. Must have good applied statistical skills, including knowledge of statistical tests, distributions, regressions, etc. Must have experience with Data Wrangling and be proficient with handling imperfections in data. Must possess excellent analytical, problem-solving, and verbal and written communication skills. Must possess keen attention to detail and the ability to discern conclusions from aggregated data. Must be able to work efficiently and without constant supervision. Must possess and understand the importance of customer service skills and professionalism. Ability to self-start; assume ownership in setting goals. Must possess the ability to learn and understand project management principles and processes. Must possess Intermediate or excellent skills with Microsoft products and can interact with computerized systems to manipulate data and create reports. Prior experience with writing and analyzing business and system requirement documents that convey complex business analysis and technology solutions. Experience in forecasting, financial, and project analysis combined with an understanding of key performance indicators. NOTE: Qualifying education, experience, knowledge, and skills must be documented on your job application. You may attach a resume to the application as supporting documentation but ONLY information stated on the application will be used for consideration. "See Resume" will not be accepted for qualifications . Preferences Education: Master's degree in management Information Systems, Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Technology, or a relevant quantitative field. Experience: 8 years of professional experience in Information Systems, Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Technology, or a relevant quantitative field. Knowledge, Skill & Abilities (KSAs): Experience in eBuilder, Tririga, Snowflake, QuickBase, PowerBI, Python & SQL is a plus. Experience as a Software as a Service (SaaS) administrator. General understanding of engineering and construction terminology. Experience with Power BI reporting and other reporting tools is a plus. Prior experience with writing and analyzing business and system requirement. documents that convey complex business analysis and technology solutions. Experience in forecasting, financial, and project analysis combined with an understanding of key performance indicators. General Information Position Type, and Typical Hours of Work: Full-Time | Regular | 40 hours per week. Hybrid schedule: Three days in the office and two days working from home. Subject to early mornings, late evenings, weekends and holidays at times, depending upon the project or workload. Salary: Commensurate with experience, based on 26 pay periods. Physical Demands and Environmental Exposure: Most assignments will be performed in an office, meeting, or operations command center environment, but some field work may be required. May be required to work extended work hours during activation of disaster recovery operations for an unspecified length of time (varies based on the extent of the event). This position requires bending, stooping, and lifting up to 25 lbs., frequent walking, standing, sitting, reaching, and ascending/descending stairs. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to perform the essential functions of this job successfully. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. FEATURED BENEFITS: Medical, vision, and dental insurance. Wellness. Professional development opportunity. Flexible spending account. 457 deferred compensation plans. Retirement pension (TCDRS). Transportation assistance (Metro Ride Sponsor Program). Disability and life insurance. Harris County is a Qualified Employer for the Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program (PSLF). Employment may be contingent on passing a drug screen and meeting other standards. Due to a high volume of applications positions may close prior to the advertised closing date or at the discretion of the Hiring Department.
summary: The Data Analyst role involves analyzing data to support the Portfolio Management Office (PMO) at the Engineering Department. This includes gathering requirements, analyzing data, reporting findings, and collaborating on scalable processes and metrics. The ideal candidate will have experience with a variety of tools and data sources, including QuickBase, Power BI, SSRS, Python, SQL, Excel, Snowflake, Power BI's Cloud Services, and Amazon Redshift.

title: Data Analyst
description: About Us: Nationwide Marketing Group works on behalf of thousands of independent appliance, furniture, bedding, electronics, specialty electronics, custom installation and rent-to-own dealers helping them grow their businesses and thrive on their own terms. With more than 5,000 members operating some 14,000 storefronts, Nationwide Marketing Group is the largest buying, marketing and business support organization of its kind, representing billions in combined annual sales across the membership. For over 50 years, the organization has remained committed to the independent channel, empowering members with the scale, sophistication and efficiencies they need to compete while delivering the unmatched business intelligence, tools and resources required to win in an ever-changing business environment. To learn more, visit our website at nationwidegroup.org or Nationwide Marketing Group LinkedIn Job Summary: As a member of the NMG technology analytics team, you are curious and passionate about collaborating with analytics team members and business partners to ensure the quality and reliability of reports, dashboards, and analyses that transform data into insights that inspire action. Job Responsibilities: Employ analytical skills to test dashboards to ensure accurate calculation of KPIs and metrics as needed for business reviews. Leverage reporting tools to conduct end-to-end testing and QA of analyses and report deliverables, preferably PowerBI, Data Studio, and SQL. Collaborate with analytics team members and business partners to assist in testing and verifying data sets, analytic models, reports, and analyses using analytics technology such as SQL, Python, and Google Data Studio. Apply data visualization principles and skills to verify that insights and decision tools are actionable and accurate. Assist in the development and testing of descriptive, diagnostic, and/or predictive analyses to ensure they meet business requirements and standards. Support proactive projects and ad hoc analyses through rigorous testing and validation processes. Collaborate with team members to manage work items and tasks towards achieving shared goals; monitor performance and quality to identify, suggest, and implement improvements. Develop analyses and reports supporting proactive projects and ad hoc analyses. You collaborate with team members to manage work items and tasks towards achieving shared goals; monitor performance and quality to identify, suggest and implement improvements Collect and document requirements for the reporting system, metrics, and KPIs, ensuring clarity and comprehensiveness. Proactively seek opportunities to learn new technical, business, and professional skills related to QA and testing, as well as share knowledge with fellow analysts. title: Senior Data Analyst-Retail
description: Analyst, Data & Analytics Strategy (HPBB) We are seeking an experienced data analytics professional who understands the strategy and tools necessary to enable our client to better collect and utilize customer data. The ideal candidate is a customer-obsessed, outcome-oriented visionary who can lead and inspire cross-functional teams to develop and deploy data and analytics solutions that deliver value and efficiency for the business. In this role, you will be responsible for overseeing the requirements gathering, data strategy and maintenance of key affiliate and loyalty platforms to ensure they’re set up to deliver against our roadmap and value targets, as well as ongoing support & backlog grooming of day-to-day platform data enhancements . This role is heavily cross functional, partnering primarily with our MarTech platform owners and technology teams to successfully translate business requirements into data requirements. Your responsibilities expand across global markets, with the local marketing and analytics teams being your key customer. Being a subject matter expert on our clients data and analytics stack is going to be critical to ensure you’re able to provide the necessary support and education for the marketing teams. Responsibilities: Drive execution of customer data to support affiliate marketing & loyalty programs, supporting both platform and analytics partners Ensure requirements and platform setup align with the broader vision for how we connect with our leading-edge cross-channel vision for customers Coordinate closely with key stakeholders within Data Analytics, Marketing and Technology, especially the Data Strategy SMEs for Data Application Documents and translates data requirements to deliver and prioritize best in class data practices Lead investigation and abatement of data supply chain issues in support of data quality and accuracy; proactively identify data monitoring and alerting requirements Key Proficiencies include: Deep experience in customer data and analytics products, including loyalty, crm or influencer marketing programs Confident working in a fast-moving environment, with a willingness to make quick decisions based on continuous prioritization and evolving customer needs Good sense of curiosity with genuine desire to learn and think with agility – identifying patterns/trends and applying them in new and unfamiliar situations Robust collaboration skills, with demonstrated experience working cross-functionally Understanding of cultural nuances and previous experience working with people of different cultures and backgrounds Self-starter mindset with a knack for solving complex problems Strong relationship-building skills Requirements: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree or equivalent work experience 5 years in customer data and analytics space, ideally in retail 5 years working directly in loyalty or CRM data Working level knowledge of SQL required
summary: Analyst responsible for developing and implementing data and analytics strategies to support affiliate marketing and loyalty programs.  This role involves gathering requirements, ensuring platform alignment with the company's vision, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and resolving data quality issues. The ideal candidate will have deep experience in customer data and analytics, particularly in loyalty and CRM programs.

title: Data BI Analyst
description: This is a remote position. Data BI Analyst (1 year experience, remote) Be part of our future! This job posting builds our talent pool for potential future openings. We'll compare your skills and experience against both current and future needs. If there's a match, we'll contact you directly. No guarantee of immediate placement, and we only consider applications from US/Canada residents during the application process. Hiring Type: Full-Time Base Salary: $57K-$67K Per Annum. Are you a talented BI Analyst with a passion for data analysis and a strong background in business intelligence? We are seeking a skilled and motivated individual to join our team as a BI Analyst. As a BI Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing complex data sets, generating insights, and providing actionable recommendations to drive business growth and efficiency. Responsibilities: Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights. Develop and maintain data models, dashboards, and reports to support business decision-making. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions. Conduct ad-hoc analysis to answer specific business questions and provide actionable recommendations. Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and business intelligence. Requirements: Bachelor's Degree required with an emphasis in business, economics, math, engineering, or analytics preferred. Advanced degree or certification preferred. 1+ years of experience, with at least 1 year of analytic experience. Proficiency in interacting with various database and file storage systems (Examples: Oracle, Hadoop, NoSQL). Understanding of join types. Experience with data manipulation languages, such as SQL, required. Knowledge of statistical concepts and analytic techniques, including descriptive statistics, forecasting, economic modeling, exploratory analysis, and variance analysis required. Ability to perform univariate analytic analytical techniques. Experience using Microsoft Excel, including the use of pivot tables, formulas, macros, VBA, charts/graphs. Experience with visualization tools such as Tableau, PowerBi, or QlikView. Strong analytical, critical, and systems thinking required. Skills: Good understanding of Agile framework (SCRUM). Familiarity with Salesforce is a plus. Benefits: Competitive salary based on skills, qualifications, and experience 1. Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance plans. Retirement program with lifetime pension benefits. Paid time off and holidays. Flexible work schedule and remote work options. Opportunities for professional development and growth. Collaborative and inclusive work environment.
summary: We are looking for a skilled and motivated BI Analyst to join our team.  This role involves analyzing complex data sets, generating insights, and providing actionable recommendations to drive business growth and efficiency. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in business intelligence, data analysis, and experience with various database and file storage systems.

title: Senior Data Analyst (Remote)
description: The Data Services team at Patterson Dental specializes in crafting sophisticated data strategies, architecting robust data models, and enabling innovative self-service and data-driven capabilities. Our focus extends to upholding the highest standards of data quality and governance. We play a pivotal role in designing, developing, testing, and deploying large-scale data warehouse solutions and other data services that power Patterson’s leading SaaS products in the dental services market. The Senior Data Analyst plays a pivotal role in shaping business strategies by uncovering high-value insights and trends from complex data sets . This role is instrumental in driving business value and informing the creation of new product features by demonstrating the potential of our foundational data capabilities. Essential Functions To perform this job successfully, an employee must be able to perform each essential function satisfactorily, with or without reasonable accommodation. To request a reasonable accommodation, notify Human Resources or the manager who oversees the position. Conducts advanced data analysis to extract actionable insights that drive business decisions and strategy development. Collaborates with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and deliver comprehensive data-driven solutions. Leads the design, implementation, and maintenance of analytics dashboards and reports to monitor key performance indicators and business metrics. Performs thorough data validation and quality checks, ensuring the accuracy and reliability of data outputs. Manages and manipulates large datasets using SQL and other data manipulation languages, ensuring optimal performance and accessibility. Identifies and interprets trends or patterns in complex data sets, translating them into understandable and actionable business insights. Contributes to the development and implementation of data models and algorithms to enhance analytical capabilities. Provides mentorship and guidance to others , fostering a culture of continuous learning and development within the team. Stays abreast of industry trends and advancements in data analysis methodologies, tools, and best practices, especially within the healthcare domain. Ensure s the ethical use , safety, and privacy of Patterson and customer/patient data . Required Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field. 5+ years of experience in data analysis, preferably in the healthcare or related industry. Proficiency in SQL and experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau). Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. Familiarity with cloud platforms (preferably Azure) and big data technologies. Knowledge of statistical programming languages (e.g., Python, R) is a plus. Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders. Preferred Qualifications Experience with machine learning algorithms and predictive modeling. Familiarity with healthcare data standards and regulatory requirements (e.g., HIPAA). Working Conditions We support the flexibility to work at a Patterson facility or fully remote from anywhere. Patterson Dental is committed to supporting a robust remote work culture, with well-established virtual collaboration practices and equal opportunities for career advancement and professional growth, regardless of physical location. Travel to corporate sites is periodically required (Quarterly or so) Periodic on call rotations and available outside of normal business hours on evenings and weekends during critical production release or issue escalation periods Th is role is eligible for hire in any of the following States: AK, AZ, CA, CO, CT, DC, HI, ID, IL, KS, KY, ME, MA, MI, MN, MT, NE, NV, NH, NM, NY, OR, RI, SD, TX, UT, VT, WA, WV, WI The potential compensation range for this role is below. The final offer amount could exceed this range, based on various factors such as candidate location (geographical labor market), experience, and skills. $90,000 - $110,000
summary: Patterson Dental seeks a Senior Data Analyst to extract actionable insights from complex datasets, driving business decisions and strategy development. The role involves designing, implementing, and maintaining analytics dashboards and reports, ensuring data quality and reliability, and managing large datasets using SQL and other data manipulation languages. Proficiency in SQL, data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau), and familiarity with cloud platforms (preferably Azure) and big data technologies are essential. Experience with machine learning algorithms and predictive modeling, knowledge of healthcare data standards and regulatory requirements (HIPAA), and strong communication skills are preferred.

title: Supply Chain Data Analyst
description: At Bayer CropScience LP we’re visionaries, driven to solve the world’s toughest challenges and striving for a world where 'Health for all Hunger for none’ is no longer a dream, but a real possibility. We’re doing it with energy, curiosity and sheer dedication, always learning from unique perspectives of those around us, expanding our thinking, growing our capabilities and redefining ‘impossible’. There are so many reasons to join us. If you’re hungry to build a varied and meaningful career in a community of brilliant and diverse minds to make a real difference, there’s only one choice. Supply Chain Data Analyst Supply Chain Data Analyst for Luling, LAto gather, analyze, cleanse, document & visualize data for production planning, inventory, material transportation and warehousing; update & maintain supply chain and logistics KPIs; integrate & analyze plant data for root cause analysis and predictive production planning; coordinate, design & track service-level agreements; support digitalization projects; develop & implement process improvement plans to reduce or eliminate redundant activities. Requires Bachelor’s in Supply Chain Operations, Logistics, Information Systems or closely-related field. Will accept a single degree or any combination of degrees, diplomas, professional credentials or professional experience determined to be equivalent by a qualified evaluation service. Position also requires 3 yrs experiencemanipulating, analyzing & visualizing large datasets to identify and quantify supply chain inefficiencies; using SAP modules , including Materials Management, Warehouse Management & Transportation Management,to monitor real-time data for integrated production planning and efficient inventory control;conducting business analysis & predictive modeling using Blue Yonder TMS, Fourkites, and Siemens MES to identify and mitigate capacity limitations, supplier delays and/or high logistics costs at key production steps; managing visualization, development & maintenance of supply chain KPIs, includingproduction rates, real-time inventory levels and/or material transportation timelines for on-time delivery;and using Business Intelligence tools, including Power BI, Tableau, & Spotfire, to visualize transportation, material management and/or production data and communicate key insights to logistics and/or planning stakeholders for strategic decision-making.Telecommuting permitted from home office location within reasonable commuting distance of Luling, LA up to 3 days per week. Mail resume to Jill Martin, Bayer CropScience LP, 800 N. Lindbergh Blvd. E2NE, St. Louis, MO 63167 or email resume to careers_us@bayer.com . Include reference code below with resume. YOUR APPLICATION Bayer CropScience LP offers a wide variety of competitive compensation and benefits programs. If you meet the requirements of this unique opportunity, and want to impact our mission Science for a better life, we encourage you to apply now. Be part of something bigger. Be you. Be Bayer. To all recruitment agencies: Bayer CropScience LP does not accept unsolicited third party resumes. Bayer CropScience LP is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Disabled/Veterans Bayer CropScience LP is committed to providing access and reasonable accommodations in its application process for individuals with disabilities and encourages applicants with disabilities to request any needed accommodation(s) using the contact information below. In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire. Bayer CropScience LP is an E-Verify Employer. Location: United States : Louisiana : Luling Division: Enabling Functions Reference Code: 820042 Contact Us Email: careers_us@bayer.com
summary: Supply Chain Data Analyst role at Bayer CropScience LP in Luling, LA. Responsibilities include data analysis, visualization, and reporting for production planning, inventory, material transportation, and warehousing. The candidate will be responsible for updating and maintaining supply chain KPIs, integrating and analyzing plant data for root cause analysis and predictive planning, coordinating and tracking service level agreements, supporting digitalization projects, and developing process improvement plans. The role requires a Bachelor's degree in a related field and 3 years of experience in data analysis, supply chain optimization, and using relevant software tools such as SAP, Blue Yonder TMS, Fourkites, Siemens MES, Power BI, Tableau, and Spotfire.

title: Data Analyst
description: Summary The Operations Data Analyst will provide direct support to operational groups by converting data into high-value assets, such as insights and predictive models, that contribute to measurable improvements in business processes and performance. This role is responsible for identifying suitable data for the current business problems, collecting, joining, aggregating, validating, and cleansing data for analysis. In addition, they are responsible for building predictive models to improve long-term and short-term operational performance of the airline. Visa Sponsorship Available No Minimum Requirements Combination of Education and Experience will be considered. Must be authorized to work in the US as defined by the Immigration Act of 1986. Must pass a Criminal Background Check. Education: Bachelor’s Degree Education Details: A Bachelor’s degree in one of the following fields: Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Bioinformatics, Economics, Physics, Operations Research, or related fields. Years of Experience: Minimum three (3) years of experience in a technical and/or analytical environment. •Technical experience working with data to include sourcing, extracting, validating, exploring, and transforming. •Competency with Python and SQL. •Initiative, curiosity, and problem-solving skills through personal development projects and ongoing education. •Results driven, accepting responsibility for individual performance and contributions to team projects. •Ability to foster healthy internal and cross-departmental professional relationships. •Comfortable with a fast pace dynamic environment. •Strong computer skills including but not limited to MS Office products. •Ability and willingness to travel as required to conduct site visits. Preferred Requirements •Strong knowledge in one of these fields: statistics, data mining, operations research, econometrics, and/or information retrieval. •Knowledge/experience in airline operations or analytics. •Strong written and verbal communication skills, proven presentation skills to all levels of audience. •Strong intellect and analytical aptitude, along with ability to be self-driven. •Demonstrated proficiency in Python, R, MATLAB, SQL or other programing languages. •Some AWS experience including Sage Maker, Lambda functions and Athena. •Some knowledge of different types of predictive machine learning algorithms. Job Duties •Translate advanced analytics problems into technical approaches that yield actionable recommendations, in diverse domains such as: predictive maintenance, delay prediction/recovery, crew behavior prediction, spare optimization. •Conduct site visits, collaborate with subject matter experts, and oversee performance projects from initiation-to-completion. •Communicate results and educate stakeholders and senior management through insightful visualizations, reports, and presentations. •Coordinate and facilitate conversations with cross-functional groups in a collaborative environment. •Work with operational leaders to understand key drivers and enhance modeling and forecast accuracy, identify areas of improvement, create a plan to address improvement areas, execute and provide reporting/analysis. •Retrieve, prepare, and process a rich variety of data sources from structured and unstructured cloud and non-cloud sources during the development/exploratory process and work with Data Engineering to refine and deploy across environments. •Perform exploratory data analysis to uncover trends and relationships and organize into actionable insights/products that can improve the operation. •Act as an analytical mentor to others in the organization. •Manage time effectively to meet deadlines across multiple projects. •Leverage supervised machine learning algorithms like regression or classification to create models. •Model Allegiant’s customer service standards in personal actions and when providing direction. •Other duties as assigned. Physical Requirements The Physical Demands and Work Environment described here are a representative of those that must be met by a Team Member to successfully perform the essential functions of the role. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the role. Office - While performing the duties of this job, the Team Member is regularly required to stand, sit, talk, hear, see, reach, stoop, kneel, and use hands and fingers to operate a computer, key board, printer, and phone. May be required to lift, push, pull, or carry up to 20 lbs. May be required to work various shifts/days in a 24-hour situation. Regular attendance is a requirement of the role. Exposure to moderate noise (i.e. business office with computers, phones, printers, and foot traffic), temperature and light fluctuations. Ability to work in a confined area as well as the ability to sit at a computer terminal for an extended period of time. Some travel may be a requirement of the role. Essential Services Provider Allegiant as a national air carrier is deemed an essential service provider during declared national and state emergencies. Team Members will be required to report to their assigned trip or work location during national and state emergencies unless prohibited by local, state or federal order. EEO Statement Equal Opportunity Employer: Disability/Veteran For more information, see https://allegiantair.jobs People of color, women, LGBTQIA+, immigrants, veterans and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply. $70,000 - $95,000 a year Full Time Benefits: Profit Sharing Medical/Dental/Vision/Life/ Disability Insurance Medical Travel Reimbursement Legal, Identity and Pet Insurance 401K with an employer match Employee Stock Purchase Plan Employee Assistance Program Tuition Reimbursement Flight Benefits Paid vacation, holidays, and sick time Part Time Benefits: Profit Sharing Medical Travel Reimbursement Legal, Identity and Pet Insurance 401K with an employer match Employee Stock Purchase Plan Employee Assistance Program Tuition Reimbursement Flight Benefits Sick time
summary: The Operations Data Analyst will use data to create insights and predictive models that improve business processes and performance. Responsibilities include identifying suitable data, collecting, joining, aggregating, validating, and cleansing data for analysis, building predictive models, and translating advanced analytics problems into technical approaches. This role requires strong analytical skills, proficiency in Python and SQL, experience in data sourcing, extraction, validation, exploration, and transformation, and the ability to collaborate with subject matter experts and communicate results to stakeholders.

title: Climate Data Analyst II
description: Job Title Climate Data Analyst II Location: EPRI Palo Alto, EPRI Washington DC Office, Remote/Home Based Job Summary And Description The successful candidate will join the Energy Systems and Climate Analysis Group at EPRI (http://esca.epri.com), a team of leading earth scientists, climate economists and energy system analysts. In this role, you will contribute to the Climate Resilience Analysis project team’s research activities and efforts to improve understanding of climate risk and approaches to enhance energy-societal resilience. EPRI works with stakeholders to characterize current and projected trends in relevant weather and climate variables, identify potential climate impacts, complete quantitative climate risk assessments, and assess possible response strategies. We are looking for candidates with demonstrated quantitative analysis and Python coding skills with applied experience with weather and climate data products. You will support the acquisition and analysis of climate data that will be used for physical climate risk assessments, climate adaptation and resilience strategies, and related topics. This work will be done in close collaboration with project leads. You may also be asked to support the team’s broader portfolio of projects, including work with historical observations and gridded (i.e., reanalysis) data, climate projection data (e.g., downscaled CMIP6 products) and/or integration with energy system data and tools. You may also assist project managers with communications and writing reports as needed. Strong consideration will be given to candidates with demonstrated Python skills and familiarity with weather and climate data. The ESCA team offers the opportunity to work with established experts in a stimulating and innovative research environment to tackle some of today’s most pressing societal challenges – energy and climate change – in collaboration with electric companies and government entities. Job Duties & Responsibilities Performs complex analysis with moderate direction and supervision Works directly with EPRI staff and may engage in supervised interaction with members and industry Key Responsibilities And Requirements Conducts technical searches and analyzes information in support of the project team Development of python packages for climate research May conduct independent research Assists Project/Program managers in assessing customer needs, formulating technical approaches, preparing proposals, technical publications/papers, and making presentations Education Master’s Degree or PhD in a technical field or equivalent experience required The Ideal Candidate Would Have Master’s Degree or PhD in meteorology, climate sciences, geography, earth sciences, environmental engineering, energy resources, computer science, or a related field Experience collecting and analyzing weather and climate data (weather and climate model outputs, surface station observations, reanalysis products, satellite observations, etc.) Excellent Python skills including familiarity with the following packages: numpy, xarray, pandas, matplotlib, xclim, scikit-learn, dask, and tensorflow Technical aptitude and experience with quantitative data analyses and methods, including statistical downscaling and bias-adjustment, extreme value theory, machine learning, and stochastic modeling Familiarity with the published literature and policies relating to climate change impacts, adaptation, and vulnerability (e.g., IPCC WGII domain), climate scenarios and projected changes, and climate-energy-economics is a plus Experience with climate models or hydrological models is a plus Excellent research and writing skills; strong oral communications skills; ability to present complex information in a clear and concise manner A positive attitude, comfortable working both collaboratively and independently The salary range for this position is $92,150 USD to $102,900 USD annually. This salary range is an estimate, and the actual salary may vary based on various factors, including without limitation applicant's education, experience, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity and alignment with market data. The salary may also be adjusted based on applicant's geographic location. This role is eligible to participate in EPRI’s annual incentive program. The amount of incentive varies and is subject to the terms and conditions of the plan. This role is eligible to participate in EPRI’s standard employee benefit programs, which currently include the following: medical, dental, vision, 401k, STD/LTD and paid family leave, life and accident insurance, paid time off (flexible vacation, sick leave, and holiday pay). EPRI participates in E-Verify, an online system operated jointly by the Department of Homeland Security and the Social Security Administration (SSA). EPRI uses the system to check the work status of new hires by comparing information from the employee's I-9 form against SSA and Department of Homeland Security databases. EPRI is an equal opportunity employer. EEO/AA/M/F/VETS/Disabled Together . . . Shaping the Future of Energy. www.epri.com
summary: EPRI seeks a Climate Data Analyst II to join their Energy Systems and Climate Analysis Group. The role involves analyzing climate data to assess climate risks, develop adaptation strategies, and support research projects. The ideal candidate will have expertise in Python, climate data analysis, and related fields.

title: Data Analyst- Supply Chain
description: Want to learn more about this role and Jobot? Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page! Job details Hybrid work 9/80 schedule This Jobot Job is hosted by Jaclyn D'Amore Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Easy Apply" button and sending us your resume. Salary $34 - $38 per hour A Bit About Us Based in the Houston area, we are seeking a Supply Chain Analyst for a 9-12 month contract to join our team in the Energy industry. We make the products that fuel everyday life. We refine, transport and market motor fuels, lubricants, petrochemicals, and other industrial products. This position is an excellent opportunity for someone who is passionate about making a significant impact on the energy sector by improving supply chain processes. The successful candidate will work hand-in-hand with our team to optimize large complex data systems in our supply chain operations and contribute to our overall business strategy. If you have 2 years of experience with SQL and Python as a Supply Chain Analyst, please apply below. Why join us? Competitive Salary Excellent Benefits 9/80 work schedule Job Details Responsibilities As a Supply Chain Analyst, you will be responsible for the following Utilize SQL & Python to analyze supply chain data, identify trends and patterns, and provide actionable insights to improve efficiency and performance. Develop and implement effective supply chain management strategies. Coordinate with stakeholders to forecast demand and manage supply chain processes to meet these requirements. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure smooth and efficient supply chain operations. Conduct risk assessments to identify potential disruptions and develop strategies to mitigate these risks. Generate and present detailed reports on supply chain metrics to senior management. Participate in the selection and management of supply chain partners and vendors. Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in the energy industry and supply chain management. Qualifications The ideal candidate for the Supply Chain Analyst position should possess the following qualifications Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Business Administration, or related field. Minimum of 2 years of experience as a Supply Chain Analyst or similar role in the energy or oil industry. Proficiency in Python or R. Experience with other data analysis tools and software is a plus. Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. Demonstrated knowledge of supply chain processes and best practices. Exceptional problem-solving skills and the ability to think strategically and analytically. Excellent communication and presentation skills. Join our team and be a part of a growing and innovative energy company. description: Job ID: 732560 Data Analyst Client: State of Virginia - Department of Health’s Division Duration: 12+ Months Location: Remote The Virginia Department of Health’s Division of Informatics and Information Systems is seeking an Analytics and Visualization Specialist to assist with communicable disease data reporting and analysis. Purposes may include public reporting, performance evaluation, decision analytics, data quality analysis, and/or scientific publication. Audiences may include the public, healthcare providers, community action groups, other government agencies, specific VDH disease programs, and/or VDH leadership. Maintains, republishes, and enhances data products according to established cadences(e.g., daily, weekly, annually). Documents detailed description of data cleaning steps, sources, filters, assumptions, and purposes. Maintains Documentation related to data visualization processes, tools, and best practices while continuing to enhance existing processes and procedures. Proactively identifies and communicates data quality issues and addresses issues arising from data processing. Conducts other duties as requested/assigned. Communication to stakeholders both internal and external via email, PPT presentations as well as internal presentations Job Qualifications Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent combination of experience and education Strong data analysis skills in SQL, Tableau, R/Python,and Microsoft Excel Experience working collaboratively with diverse groups and projects with defined timelines Strong attention to detail and accuracy Communication skills Self-starter Preferred Qualifications Preferred > 2 years’ experience with Tableau and SQL Familiarity with health/public health data Flexibility to work on multiple projects/issues simultaneously Knowledge of relational databases. Word Press knowledge ArcGIS/working with geospatial data

title: Business Data Analyst
description: Job Description The Business Data Analyst, working under moderate supervision, provides reporting and analysis on assigned and low-complexity projects. The role identifies potential data sources, selects appropriate data based on business requirement, extracts and prepares data and develops knowledge and experience of appropriate tools, technologies and techniques to perform entry or mid-level analysis. The role also carries forward the clarification of business requirements and collaborates with other analysts, business members and IT on data analysis, profiling, data acquisition and gathering data requirements. Responsibilities Provides reporting and analysis on assigned low-complexity projects, identifying potential data sources and selecting appropriate data based on business requirements. Extracts and prepares data to ensure the fullest possible use of high-quality data. Develops knowledge and experience of relevant tools, technologies and techniques to perform basic or intermediate level analysis. Uses quantitative and qualitative analysis to conduct primary and secondary research and draws conclusions and advises recipients on potential impacts, alternatives and makes recommendations. Provides research and support for competitive analysis, voice of the customer, market definition, performance tracking, opinion and insight analysis, and satisfaction and loyalty analysis. Develops critical thinking skills used to understand data, business concepts and analytical concepts. Covers the use of data as needed to effectively communicate between core analytical concepts and business concepts and content. Interprets data and presents findings in a clear and concise manner through reports, visualizations, and presentations. Collaborates with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and provide analytical support for decision-making processes. Stays up to date with industry trends and advancements in data analysis techniques, tools, and technologies. Analyzes and identifies data quality issues or cleanup opportunities to improve data quality anomalies and facilitate solutions between technical, business and other stakeholders. Provides thoughtful and well-researched insights into business and market conditions, trends and opportunities, as well as consumer, agency, client and employee information. Creates and maintains accurate procedural documentation and reference materials. Collaborates with partners to generate the necessary data and maintains awareness of internal and external business activities, trends, best practices and tools. Develops relationships and promotes collaboration with key partners of the organization and identifies opportunities for process improvement and supports process improvement efforts. Qualifications 2 -4 years of overall experience in Data Science and Analytics or a related field. Bachelor's degree in a related field such as Computer Science, Information Technology, Mathematics, Statistics, or Business Administration. Equal Opportunity Employer Westfield celebrates diversity and is committed to inclusion. All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
summary: The Business Data Analyst performs data analysis, reporting, and research to support business decisions. The role requires strong analytical skills, communication skills, and the ability to interpret data and translate it into actionable insights.
