description: The Business Intelligence Analyst supports Northwest Permanente Analytics’ team vision, mission, and strategic goals by developing and delivering innovative analytic solutions that drive decision-making, action, and positive outcomes. The Analyst provides support for day-to-day operations including analysis, routine report maintenance and development, and production support. This is a hybrid position. Must reside in the Northwest Service Region (Oregon or Washington). Major Responsibilities / Essential Functions – Develops a deep understanding of operational, clinical and/or administrative functions and processes within areas of focus. Maintains expertise in the data landscape and cutting-edge technology, ready with the knowledge and skills to rapidly recommend and execute analytic solutions to business problems. Completes analyses and educates customers and leaders on trends, challenges, and opportunities that influence decision-making and action. Works through the full life cycle of analytic and/or technical projects from conception to execution: requirement gathering, data exploration, extraction, cleansing, enrichment, visualization, validation, synthesis, and interpretation. Ensures quality, clarity, and applicability of deliverables and that they meet customer expectations, regulatory requirements, and/or department standards and assists in communicating deliverables to customers, providing clear and concise explanation of data delivered, and ensures progress reporting throughout life cycle of project. Adopts and implements standard methodologies in data infrastructure, reporting and analysis. Partners with data engineers to build, enhance and maintain robust data assets including documenting business requirements and conducting UAT. Provides project coordination and/or administrative support for various business critical analysis and reporting needs. Supports the development and maintenance of project plans, including project schedules and plans for resources, communications and risks. Minimum Qualifications - Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Healthcare Administration, Economics, Analytics, Public Health, or another applicable quantitative field or equivalent education and experience. Minimum two (2) years of experience in data analytics. Demonstrated experience with analytics and visualization software such as SQL, SAS, R, Python, Power BI, or Tableau. Strong passion for data analytics and contributing to an organization focused on continuous improvement. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills – a demonstrated ability to mine data for relevant and actionable insights. Proven ability to work on multiple projects, deadlines, and priorities in a fast-paced, ever-changing, and evolving work environment. Possesses excellent interpersonal, collaboration and relationship-building skills and can work effectively within a diverse culture. Familiarity with legal, security and regulatory issues associated with managing and exposing sensitive institutional data. Experience visualizing analytics in simple, logical, and compelling ways. Preferred Qualifications – Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Healthcare Administration, Economics, Analytics, Public Health, or another applicable quantitative field. Two (2) years of data analytics experience within an integrated healthcare organization that includes hospitals, clinics, medical group practices, and a health plan. Experience with EPIC. Join Our Medical Group Northwest Permanente is a self-governed, physician-led, multi-specialty group of 1,500 physicians, surgeons, and clinicians, caring for 630,000 members in Oregon and Southwest Washington. Kaiser Permanente is one of the nation's preeminent health care systems, a benchmark for comprehensive, integrated, value-based, and high-quality care. Equal Opportunity Employer At Northwest Permanente, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation, and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. title: Financial Data Analyst
description: This is a contract position where it is required for you to be on site 5x a week. Position Overview: The Financial Data Analyst will be responsible for designing, developing and collaborating on reports/analyses within the Finance Division which will include: Job-Costing Analysis, Soft-Cost Analysis, Completion Cost analysis, and other legally-mandated reports. Duties and Responsibilities: Prepares presentation quality financial analyses/reports using SQL and Microsoft Excel Develops complex queries/scripts and automates periodic reports Cleans, manipulates and analyzes large sets of raw data Understands data relationships among various tables in Data warehouse Conducts business analysis and research to identify key metrics and opportunities for improvement Works to ensure integration of accurate and complete data sources Performs effective presentations on complex ideas that can be communicated in a simple straightforward manner Writes policies/procedures and documents methodologies used to create analyses Knowledge of data visualization software such as Microsoft Power BI is a plus Qualifications and Skills: Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business, Computer Science, Computer Technology, Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics, or related field Minimum of 2 years of relevant experience in financial reporting, advanced analytics and delivering actionable insights from data using SQL and Microsoft Excel Strong critical thinking, analytical and problem solving skills

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: About Us We are the world’s largest telenutrition and foodcare solution, backed by a national network of Registered Dietitians and designed to yield consistently healthier food choices, lasting behavior change and long-term results. Foodsmart’s highly personalized, digital platform guides members through a personalized journey to eating well while saving them time and money. Foodsmart seamlessly integrates dietary assessments and nutrition counseling with online food ordering and cost-effective meal planning for the whole family that makes the most of ingredients at home and on the go. With national and regional retail partners across the US now accepting SNAP/EBT, Foodsmart helps bring healthier food within reach to eligible members and can also assist with SNAP enrollment. Foodsmart has supported over 1.8 million members from over 700 health plan, employer and health system clients, with leading strategic and venture investors like Advocate Health, Intermountain Health, Memorial Hermann, Blue Cross Blue Shield of Massachusetts, Mayfield Fund and Founder Collective. Learn more at www.foodsmart.com About The Role The Senior Data Analyst will join our dynamic team responsible for managing and interpreting data to provide actionable insights to our operations and product teams. The Data Analyst is responsible for developing, implementing, and maintaining cutting-edge analytic systems, conducting data analysis to derive business insights, and designing scalable data models and pipelines. This role also involves collaborating closely with stakeholders from various departments to prioritize business and information needs, and presenting data-driven recommendations to the executive team. You Will Own the development, implementation, and maintenance of advanced analytic systems, simplifying intricate problems through streamlined frameworks. Conduct thorough data analysis to uncover valuable business insights, trends, and growth opportunities. Design, build, and manage scalable data models and pipelines within our data warehouse. Identify, interpret, and analyze patterns and trends within complex datasets. Collaborate closely with stakeholders in Marketing, Sales, Product, and Engineering to prioritize data-driven decision-making. You Are Proactive and act as an advocate for your customers Take pride in your work and approach every project with enthusiasm and excitement Experienced in data warehousing, data design, and data analysis. Knowledgeable of healthcare industry standards and compliance regulations. You Have Accumulated 6+ years of experience in a data analyst role, preferably within healthcare or startup environments. Proficiency in SQL and other data manipulation languages. Experience with business intelligence tools such as Tableau, Looker, or Power BI. Proficiency in at least one scripting language, with a preference for Python or R. A self-starting attitude, capable of thriving in a fast-paced, agile environment. Familiarity with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes. Understanding of machine learning algorithms and statistical models. $120,000 - $160,000 a year Role: Senior Data Analyst Level: IC3-IC4 Location: Remote Base Salary Range: $120,000/yr to $160,000/yr + equity + benefits Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries at our headquarters in San Francisco, California. Individual pay is determined by work location, job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. About Our Benefits And Perks Remote-First Company Unlimited PTO Healthcare Coverage (Medical, Dental, Vision) 401k, bonus, & stock options Gym reimbursement
summary: Foodsmart, a leading telenutrition and foodcare solution, seeks a Senior Data Analyst to join its dynamic team. This role involves developing and managing advanced analytics systems, conducting data analysis, and collaborating with stakeholders to drive data-driven decision making. The ideal candidate will have 6+ years of experience in data analysis, particularly within healthcare or startup environments, and possess strong skills in SQL, data visualization tools, and at least one scripting language (Python or R).

title: Tableau Data Analyst
description: Make your mark at Comcast -- a Fortune 30 global media and technology company. From the connectivity and platforms we provide, to the content and experiences we create, we reach hundreds of millions of customers, viewers, and guests worldwide. Become part of our award-winning technology team that turns big ideas into cutting-edge products, platforms, and solutions that our customers love. We create space to innovate, and we recognize, reward, and invest in your ideas, while ensuring you can proudly bring your authentic self to the workplace. Join us. You’ll do the best work of your career right here at Comcast. (In most cases, Comcast prefers to have employees on-site collaborating unless the team has been designated as virtual due to the nature of their work. If a position is listed with both office locations and virtual offerings, Comcast may be willing to consider candidates who live greater than 100 miles from the office for the remote option.) Job Summary Responsible for collecting, processing, analyzing and reporting data related to Engineering Operations. Produces complex, high-priority recurring and ad-hoc reports with the purpose of measuring progress towards goals, measuring performance against objectives and identifying improvement opportunities. Consults directly with internal and external customers. Has in-depth experience, knowledge and skills in own discipline. Usually determines own work priorities. Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience. Job Description The Technology, Product, Experience (TPX) organization works at the intersection of media and technology and our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products and next-generation technologies that transform the customer experience. The Comcast Network and CONNECTivity (CONNECT) organization is a highly agile, fast-paced, dedicated group at the forefront of change focused on innovating, building, and operating the best in class, most reliable access network for our customers. About The Team The BNOC (Business Network Operations center) is made up of all engineers that support the Comcast Enterprise Business customers. The Business customers that our team supports are the bigger customers that have their own NOCs (Network Operations Centers). We are responsible for the support of these customers for break/fix issues. The team must meet the customer expectations and SLAs (Service Level Agreements). Our team is responsible also providing the reporting that we must provide to the customers to meet contractual expectations. What You’ll Do Determines relevancy of data and identifies alternative data sources as needed to ensure analytics requested by business owners and technical associates can be completed. Analyzes large, complex data to determine actionable business insights using self-service analytics and reporting tools. Strong experience with SQL and data visualization tools such as Tableau. Able to create new custom reports and modify existing reports as needed using the Tableau reporting tool. Excellent working knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint. Performs research on root cause of data anomalies that are uncovered through normal course of analysis. Writes complex SQL to query large data platforms such as Teradata, SQL server, Oracle and Hadoop to obtain data necessary for analysis. Combines data as needed from disparate data sources to complete analysis. Follows best practices and established policies in business intelligence data analysis, maintenance, and data quality. Design and develop data visualizations, dashboards, and reports to effectively communicate data insights to stake holders. Produces a variety of reports, graphs, summaries, and presentations that convey analytic results and align with business needs. Identify and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets to guide business decisions. Conduct ad-hoc analysis and reporting as requested by stakeholders. Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance. Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary. Other duties and responsibilities as assigned. Skills & Experience We’re Looking For Must have a very strong knowledge of Tableau. Be able to build NEW reports as needed. Be able to modify current reports to meet customer expectations. Be able to connect to different types of databases. Must have strong SQL knowledge and how to build SQL queries. Must have a very strong knowledge of PowerPoint and Excel Very strong attention to details. Reports must be done in a timely manner to meet the expectations of the customers. Will be asked to investigate customer tickets to ensure that the tickets have the correct outage times. Will be able to correct the tickets and the ticket data as needed. Need to ensure all reports follow consistent formatting. (Fonts, Graphs, Ect) Very strong communication and interpersonal skills Must communicate with the team when issues with ticketing are found. Must interact with the BNOC team to ensure the accuracy of the reporting. This position is ineligible for visa sponsorship. To be considered for this role, you must be legally authorized to work in the United States and not require sponsorship for employment now or in the future. About Our Perks & Benefits We are determined to create an environment where our employees feel valued, understand our business goals, and are motivated. Here's a look at just some of the perks and benefits we make available to our US-based employees: Medical & Dental 401(k) Savings Plan Generous paid time off Life Milestones - from adoption assistance, childcare resources, pet insurance, and more, Comcast supports you at all life stages. Courtesy Services - We offer all of our full-time employees in serviceable areas free digital TV and internet. Discount tickets for Universal Resorts, including theme park tickets and onsite hotel rooms. Learn More At Jobs.comcast.com/life-at-comcast/benefits Reasonable Accommodation We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, perform essential job functions, and receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation. Disclaimer This information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees in this role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications. Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer. This is a Comcast Analyst 3 role. Comcast is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law. Additionally, Comcast provides best-in-class Benefits to eligible employees. We believe that benefits should connect you to the support you need when it matters most, and should help you care for those who matter most. That’s why we provide an array of options, expert guidance and always-on tools, that are personalized to meet the needs of your reality – to help support you physically, financially and emotionally through the big milestones and in your everyday life. Please visit the compensation and benefits summary  on our careers site for more details. Education Bachelor's Degree While possessing the stated degree is preferred, Comcast also may consider applicants who hold some combination of coursework and experience, or who have extensive related professional experience. Relevant Work Experience 5-7 Years
summary: This role involves analyzing data related to Engineering Operations, creating reports, identifying trends, and providing insights to stakeholders. It requires strong analytical skills, proficiency in SQL and Tableau, and experience with data visualization and reporting. The position also involves collaborating with the BNOC team and ensuring the accuracy of reporting.

title: Data Management Analyst
description: Job Description As a Data Management Analyst, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the integrity, accuracy, and accessibility of our organization's data. You will be responsible for analyzing, organizing, and managing data to support business operations and decision-making processes. Your duties will include data collection, cleansing, transformation, and maintenance, as well as developing and implementing data quality standards and procedures. You will collaborate closely with various departments to understand their data needs and provide solutions to optimize data workflows and processes. Additionally, you will assist in the development and maintenance of databases, data warehouses, and other data management systems. Key Responsibilities Collect, organize, and analyze data from various sources to ensure accuracy and completeness. Cleanse and standardize data to maintain consistency and integrity. Develop and implement data quality standards and procedures. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and provide solutions. Assist in the design, development, and maintenance of databases and data warehouses. Monitor and optimize data workflows and processes to improve efficiency and effectiveness. Generate reports and insights from data analysis to support decision-making processes. Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data management and analytics. Requirements Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field. Proven experience in data management, analysis, and manipulation. Proficiency in SQL, database management systems (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL), and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI). Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and collaboration skills. Attention to detail and ability to work independently. Familiarity with data governance and compliance standards is a plus.
summary: Data Management Analyst responsible for ensuring data integrity, accuracy, and accessibility. Duties include data collection, cleansing, transformation, and maintenance. Requires strong analytical and problem-solving skills, proficiency in SQL, database management systems, and data visualization tools. Collaboration with cross-functional teams to optimize data workflows and processes.

title: Data Analyst
description: Apply Save Job Refer a Friend Back Share This Page Share on Facebook Share on Twitter Share on LinkedIn Share via Email Job Details Requisition #:641593 Location:Johns Hopkins All Children's Hospital, St. Petersburg, FL 33701 Category:Non-Clinical Professional Schedule:Day Shift Position Summary The Data Analyst is accountable for evaluating and responding to requests for data collection, manipulation, tabulation, and analysis. Hours: Full Time, Day Shift, 40 Hours Per Week Monday-Friday-8am-5pm, Hybrid work schedule Location: St. Petersburg, FL Key Accountabilities Applies the appropriate analytic skills needed for data collection, data management, statistical analyses and reports for improvement projects, quality initiatives and special requests as deemed appropriate by leadership so data are transformed into useful, decision making information Reviews data to identify variability in processes and/or best practices throughout the facility and shares information with leadership so that improvement actions can be taken Assists in investigating and troubleshooting data inconsistencies to assure data accuracy, integrity, validity and reliability so that current state systems are understood and recommendations for improvements in data systems can be made Develops and/or implements processes and procedures for efficient and accurate data access and analysis so that consistent, reliable and accurate processes are followed assuring that data are available for decision making and external data submissions Teaches enhanced data investigational skills so that the analytic skills needed to understand and display outcomes are taught to qualified employees who are then able to independently apply these skills Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Epidemiology, Statistics, Business or related field 2 years experience in the health care or medical industry with focus on data analysis Proficient in use of Microsoft Office Suite software Proficient in use of statistical analysis software such as SPSS, SAS, STATA or R Expertise in managing complex metrics, dashboards, and scorecards Ability to translate data into useable information for professional and lay audiences Johns Hopkins Health System and its affiliates are drug-free workplace employers. We are committed to providing a healthy and safe environment for our patients, visitors and staff members. The Johns Hopkins Hospital has a tobacco-free at work policy. Employees must refrain from using any tobacco products during their work shifts — including while at lunch or on breaks, and whether they are on or off campus. Johns Hopkins Health System and its affiliates are an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employers. summary: The Data Analyst will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and presenting data to support research, quality improvement projects, and decision-making. This role will require expertise in data management, statistical analysis, and communication to various audiences. Responsibilities include identifying data inconsistencies, developing data access processes, and training staff on data analysis skills.

title: Lead Data Analyst
description: Location: This is a remote position that supports the National Security Innovation Network (NSIN) through Eccalon LLC. Hybrid working arrangements are available at our headquarters location in Arlington, VA. About the Role: We are seeking an experienced Lead Data Scientist (Business Intelligence) to join our National Security Innovation Network (NSIN) project and will have the opportunity to serve their country by embedding with key decision makers at the top levels of the U.S. Government. As the Lead Data Scientist, you will be responsible for leading the NSIN Data Cell. This role will join a team already recognized for its standout business analytics. The Senior Data Analyst will be responsible for the success of internal business operations and the decisions made to meet Government goals, all to drive for greater efficiency and accuracy of executing the mission. This will require the Senior Data Analyst to build insightful reports, research ventures and innovators across the US, and present their products to Government Leadership - all while embodying high standards of Eccalon professionalism. About the Team: NSIN is a U.S. Department of Defense (DOD) organization with the mission to build networks of innovators that generate novel solutions to national security problems. NSIN does this by building communities of non-traditional defense problem solvers from the academic and venture communities, exposing these communities to national security problems through direct interaction with DoD end users, and supporting the further development and transition of these solutions into the DOD. The principal way NSIN achieves its mission is through two mutually supporting portfolios of programs: the Talent Portfolio and the Venture Portfolio. In addition, NSIN's Regional Network Team will be physically located in more than nine different regions throughout the United States and is responsible for building new communities of problem solvers through which NSIN executes its programs. For more information regarding NSIN, please visit our site, www.nsin.mil! Job Responsibilities: Lead a team of Data Analysts providing support to NSIN Utilize NSIN’s data and information about innovation in the US for use in analyzing trends and patterns around technology investments. Generate monthly reports on how well NSIN components and the overall enterprise are working based on agency KPIs and OKRs. Support enterprise data migrations for large scale IT projects. Ensure overall data integrity and related attribute data are backed up. Provide 1:1 assistance to the workforce regarding how to record their activities and how to utilize the data for their own products. Track and respond to ad hoc product requests from leaders across the agency in a timely and polite manner. Use data profiling and other discovery techniques to locate anomalies, outliers, and other instances that would cause a bottleneck in business operations. Design and execute models for improved data collection, continually pivoting as needed to support the business. Support the team in maintaining and supporting several activities, including entering and cleaning data, researching data conversions, establishing data specifications, updating sources, and ensuring data integrity. Crosswalking field values and attributes from the origin to the destination while reconciling errors. Mine data for the purposes of experimenting with predictive model prototypes. Required Qualifications: Possess at least an earned B.A./B.S. degree. A minimum of five years of experience, within the last ten years, working in leading Data Analytics, Business Intelligence (BI), or Database Management, or a combination of all three in a corporate or Government setting. A minimum of five years of experience communicating complex data insights in a professional or academic setting. A minimum of five years of experience, within the last ten years, with relational databases, Database Management System (DBMS), and related programming languages, (e.g., SQL, R, and Python). A minimum of five years of experience with one or more data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Domo, Google Analytics, Salesforce, Power BI, or equivalent tools). A willingness and aptitude to operate successfully as part of a remote, team-based culture. About half of our organization is dispersed throughout the United States, and you'll need to be particularly sympathetic to the remote, asynchronous nature of your teammates' work. Experience with Salesforce Excellent interpersonal and presentation skills. Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with cross-functional teams. Ability to work independently and manage timelines. US Citizenship Required. Secret Clearance Preferred Qualifications: A TS clearance with eligibility for SCI at time of proposal submission. Experience leading a team or multiple teams concurrently. Experience implementing large new scale data platforms across a distributed organization. Experience teaching an organization to utilize data as a key component of the decision-making process.
summary: Lead Data Scientist (Business Intelligence) role at Eccalon LLC supporting the National Security Innovation Network (NSIN). The role involves leading a team of Data Analysts, analyzing trends and patterns around technology investments, generating reports, supporting data migrations, providing data training, responding to product requests, designing data collection models, and more. The position is remote with hybrid working arrangements available in Arlington, VA.

title: Public Health Data Analyst
description: Overview PCI Government Services (PCI-GS) in support of our client at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), National Center for Injury Prevention and Control (NCIPC), is seeking a qualified candidate to work with public health leaders and multidisciplinary teams to identify opportunities for leveraging public health data to produce actionable insights. Responsibilities Specific job duties include (but not limited to) the following: • Analyze data from internal and external sources to drive the development of scientific manuscripts, data visualizations, and evidence-based policies. • Perform data source quality assurance and quality control protocols. • Code and develop data models and algorithms to apply to data sets. • Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes. • Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy. Qualifications • Bachelor’s Degree in a technical discipline or additional FOUR (4) years related experience. • Minimum of TWO (2) years of experience in a professional or academic setting. • Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on model and product development. • Experience using statistical computer languages (e.g., R, Python, SQL) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets. • Knowledge of Power Platforms (e.g., Power BI, Power Automate) and other data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, D3) • Experience working with data architectures and processing raw datasets. • Knowledge of a variety of statistical and mathematical modeling techniques (e.g., regression, SIR models, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks. • Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams. • A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques. • Must be able to obtain and maintain a Public Trust Clearance. Software/Tools: • Knowledge and experience in statistical techniques: GLM/Regression, epidemiological models, descriptive statistics • Coding knowledge and experience with several languages: Python, R, SAS, SQL • Data Visualization experience with several tools: Power BI, Tableau, D3 Preferred: • Experience applying technical skills to public health systems is a plus. • Experience with data and code management best practices is a plus: Azure, GitHub, AWS, SQL Server Management Studio, etc. PCI Federal Services (PCIFS) and it's subsidiaries is an equal-opportunity employer. PCIFS does not discriminate on the basis of age, sex, race, national origin, religion, marital status, sexual orientation or identity, Veterans or Disability status. Preference may be extended to qualified Native American Indian candidates in accordance with applicable federal law.
summary: This role at PCI Government Services, supporting the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, requires a data-driven individual to analyze public health data, develop insights, and contribute to scientific manuscripts and policy decisions. The position involves data analysis, model development, and visualization using various tools and programming languages. Public health experience is preferred.

title: Financial Data Analysis Principal
description: Responsibilities Kforce has a client in Phoenix, AZ that is adding a Financial Data Analysis Principal to be the driving force behind their data-driven decision-making process. This role will work closely with various departments to gather, analyze, and visualize financial data, providing valuable insights to shape their financial strategies and improve their performance. Key Responsibilities: Data Gathering: Collect, organize, and maintain financial data from various sources, ensuring data accuracy and completeness Data Analysis: Utilize advanced data analysis techniques to identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities for improvement Financial Modeling: Develop and maintain financial models to support forecasting, budgeting, and decision-making Reporting: Prepare and deliver regular financial reports and dashboards to senior management, highlighting key insights and recommendations Ad-Hoc Analysis: Conduct ad-hoc financial analysis to address specific business questions and challenges Data Visualization: Create visually compelling data visualizations and presentations to communicate complex financial information to non-technical stakeholders Process Improvement: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify process improvements and efficiencies Compliance: Ensure data management and analysis processes comply with relevant regulations and industry standards Requirements Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field Proven experience in financial data analysis, preferably in a corporate setting An understanding of financial concepts and financial statement analysis Proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, SQL, Python, R) Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Excellent attention to detail and the ability to work with large datasets Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex data findings to non-technical stakeholders Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment Tableau experience strongly preferred The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future. We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave. Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law. This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions. Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.
summary: Kforce is seeking a Financial Data Analysis Principal in Phoenix, AZ to lead data-driven decision-making. The role involves collecting, analyzing, and visualizing financial data, creating financial models, reporting to senior management, and conducting ad-hoc analysis. Strong communication and presentation skills are essential, with experience in Tableau preferred.

title: Data Analyst
description: M3P Data Analyst - Rx Claims Pricing Specialist Our client, based in Minneapolis, MN, is currently seeking an experienced Data Analyst with pharmacy benefit management experience. This is a fully remote long-term contract role open to candidates located anywhere in the United States. This position involves assisting a Fortune 500 healthcare organization in preparing for the go-live of the Medicare Prescription Payment Plan (M3P) program, scheduled for January 2025. Job Description The candidate will be primarily responsible for analyzing and interpreting complex data sets, handling data extraction, and testing claims pricing. The selected candidate MUST HAVE experience pricing in Rx Claims. Responsibilities Extract, manipulate, and analyze complex data from multiple sources. Assist in Rx Claims Pricing, processing, and implementation. Find trends and patterns in data to provide meaningful insights. Create comprehensive reports and visualizations based on analysis. Communicate findings and insights to stakeholders effectively. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to conduct project management. Maintain up-to-date knowledge of industry standards and changes in regulations.
summary: A remote Data Analyst role specializing in Rx Claims Pricing for a Fortune 500 healthcare organization in preparation for the Medicare Prescription Payment Plan (M3P) program rollout in January 2025. The role involves analyzing complex data, extracting information, testing pricing, and communicating findings to stakeholders.

title: Data Analysis Officer
description: Duties As a Data Analysis Officer at CIA, you'll utilize your understanding of digital capabilities to evaluate and analyze digital and all source intelligence information to identify key adversaries and assess how they operate and interact. Using strong critical thinking skills and a variety of digital analytic and/or forensics tools and methods, you will extract valuable information from digital data and create a range of products that explain your findings to inform operations, drive collection, and support customers. Data Analysis Officers triage, review, and identify items of intelligence and operational interest from technical collections and other datasets. You will leverage advanced methods to analyze data sets and create and refine capabilities to exploit large data sets quickly and accurately. Data Analysis Officers also identify and prioritize intelligence gaps, determine the appropriate collection actions needed, and drive the collection process. Requirements Conditions of Employment You must be physically in the United States or one of its territories when you submit your resume via MyLINK. You must be registered for the Selective Service, if applicable. You must be a U.S. citizen and at least 18 years of age (dual-national US citizens are eligible). You must be willing to move to the Washington, DC area. You must successfully complete a thorough medical and psychological exam, a polygraph interview, and a comprehensive background investigation. For further requirements information, please visit: https://www.cia.gov/careers/how-we-hire/requirements/ Qualifications Minimum Qualifications Critical thinking skills Analytic and research skills Written and verbal communication skills Ability to meet the minimum requirements for joining CIA , including U.S. citizenship and a background investigation Desired Qualifications Foreign language skills Ability to script/code Education Bachelor's degree in one of the following fields: Computer Science Computer Engineering Digital/Computer/Network Forensics Applied Mathematics Telecommunications Information Security/ Assurance Data Analysis/Analytics At least a 3.0 GPA on a 4-point scale is preferred
summary: The Data Analysis Officer at the CIA analyzes digital intelligence to identify adversaries and assess their operations. They utilize digital analytic and forensics tools to extract information, create reports, and inform operations. Responsibilities include identifying intelligence gaps, prioritizing collection actions, and driving the collection process.

title: CAS | Analista de Dados PL - Principalidade
description: Job Description O desafio principal desta vaga é aumentar a relevância do relacionamento dos associados com a cooperativa, aumentando assim o tempo de relacionamento dos nossos associados e a rentabilidade para a cooperativa de forma sustentável, através de uma relação de reciprocidade. Para isso, serão utilizadas alguns meios como o estabelecimento, atualizações e acompanhamento de critérios e métodos baseados em dados para medição da principalidade e análises para busca de ações para incremento deste indicador estratégico e consequentemente outros conectados com o relacionamento e a rentabilidade. Responsibilities and assignments Implementar e manter o cálculo do índice de principalidade (baseado em dados) de acordo com as boas práticas e diretrizes do CAS; Realizar análises e projeções para entendimento do comportamento de perfis específicos de associados; Realizar análises e projeções para apoio às Centrais, Cooperativas do Sistema e CAS; Realizar revisões a atualizações dos métodos de cálculo da principalidade; Criar e manter dashboards para acompanhamento do indicador de principalidade. Requirements And Qualifications Conhecimento e experiência com Banco de dados; Conhecimento em Power Bi e linguagem DAX; Conhecimento em SQL; Conhecimento em linguagem de programação, como Python ou R (desejável); Conhecimento em databricks (desejável); Excel avançado; Conhecimento em análise de dados e indicadores KPI’s; Comunicação assertiva e escuta ativa; Proatividade e senso investigativo; Pensamento analítico Additional information No Centro Administrativo Sicredi (CAS) para as posições nas áreas de negócio adotamos o formato de trabalho híbrido que se consolidou em 3 dias presenciais, na Sede da empresa, localizada na Av. Assis Brasil, 3940, São Sebastião, Porto Alegre/RS e 2 dias home office. Nas posições da área Tech adotamos o formato de trabalho home office. ____________________________________________________ No Sicredi Você Vai Ter 14º e 15º salários fixos; Participações nos Lucros (conforme a senioridade); Benefício saúde: Plano de Saúde e Odontológico sem coparticipação, Gympass, seguro de vida, Programas de saúde e bem-estar (Nutrição, Psicologia, Laboral, Massagem, Grupos de corrida e academia local); Vale Alimentação e Vale Refeição – com flexibilidade de % nos cartões VA/VR, sem coparticipação; Licença maternidade e paternidade estendida; Auxílio creche ou babá para crianças até 6 anos e 11 meses; Auxílio para filhos com deficiência, sem limite de idade; Previdência Privada até 6% do salário; Plataforma de Treinamentos – Sicredi Aprende, com diversos cursos; Carga horária de 40h semanais – Utilizando sistema de banco de horas; Auxílio Teletrabalho (exceto para posições com atuação 100% presenciais). Process stages Step 1: Registration1Registration Step 2: Avaliando o seu currículo2Avaliando o seu currículo Step 3: Alinhamento de expectativas3Alinhamento de expectativas Step 4: Bate Papo com GP4Bate Papo com GP Step 5: Identificando o seu perfil (PDA) 5Identificando o seu perfil (PDA) Step 6: Bate Papo com a Área6Bate Papo com a Área Step 7: Desafio Técnico7Desafio Técnico Step 8: Hiring8Hiring Somos o Sicredi, a primeira Instituição Financeira Cooperativa do Brasil Há 121 anos, nos reinventamos a cada dia e nos desafiamos em tudo o que fazemos, sendo impulsionados pelo trabalho de cada uma das nossas pessoas colaboradoras. Nosso propósito é construir uma sociedade mais próspera ao lado dos mais de 42 mil talentos que também acreditam nessa transformação. Evoluímos constantemente e mantemos a essência do cooperativismo para superar as barreiras, conquistar novos horizontes e desenvolver a sociedade com maior inclusão, diversidade e equidade. Não é à toa que ficamos em 4° lugar no GPTW Brasil. Seguimos buscando talentos que queiram fazer parte da construção de um mundo melhor e queremos contar com você. #VemSerSicredi!
summary: This role focuses on enhancing the relevance of member relationships with the cooperative, aiming to increase both member relationship duration and profitability sustainably through mutual benefits. This involves establishing, updating, and monitoring data-driven criteria and methods for measuring member engagement. The position requires performing analyses and projections to understand member behavior, support internal stakeholders, update calculation methods, and build dashboards for tracking key performance indicators.

title: Business Data Analyst
description: About Wiley X At Wiley X, protective eyewear is at our core. To ensure our products inspire confidence in everyone who wears them, we prioritize protection, optical precision, durability and fit— employing advanced technologies exceeding industry standards. Our unwillingness to compromise has always defined us. Our commitment to protection will always differentiate us. We value motivated self-starters who aspire to be part of an organization whose focus is long-term success. Our mission is to revolutionize the eyewear industry while making superior protective gear. Our team is supported through an inspirational culture and leadership that is encompassed by integrity, commitment, and teamwork. Our eyewear collectively supports a myriad of activities. People with a passion for the outdoors, those in manufacturing, government employees, and first responders all benefit from our products. Our commitment to sustainability drives us to implement environmentally conscious processes in the manufacturing and distribution of our eyewear. We continue to create innovative products for everyone and any activity that sparks their adventurous side. Job Summary We are seeking a talented and initiative-taking BC Analyst to join our dynamic team. In this role, as a Dynamics BC analyst, you will be responsible for supporting and optimizing Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central (BC), Customer Engagement (CE), and other organizational systems. Key tasks include user support, process improvement, system design, and work process updates. The role requires technical skills in Dynamics BC, CE, SQL, key reporting tools (Power BI, Domo), and business process mapping, along with necessary skills of clear communication and proactive problem-solving. Industry-specific expertise in both B2C and B2B (e.g., retail, distribution, manufacturing, finance) can enhance your effectiveness in this role and within our growing organization. Adaptability and continuous learning are essential for the success of this role. Responsibilities & Essential Functions Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and document business needs and requirements to either evaluate existing business processes or to identify areas for improvement. Lead and support the design of changes of how Dynamics BC interacts with other systems and applications, aiming to facilitate system improvements, upgrades, extensions, and add-ons for future organizational success. Ability to create and refine processes using datasets and leveraging Power Apps and Power Automate Flows, designing Power BI reports and BC Extensions for Microsoft partners or contractors to develop. Expertise in the execution of data configuration packages including setup of tables to import/export as necessary to solve errors and/or update data. Provide user training and support to intentionally optimize our system environment, all while guiding users through system functionalities, troubleshooting issues, and having the foresight to solve system opportunities proactively. Required Skills/Abilities Technical Proficiency In-depth knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central is a must-have. Strong experience with SQL, Power BI, and other data analysis tools for data querying and manipulation. Familiarity with integration tools and techniques, including Power Apps, Power Automate, and Virtual Tables. Understand and development of AL code. Analytical Skills Strong problem-solving abilities. Capability to analyze business processes and identify areas of improvement and efficiency. Proficiency in data interpretation and reporting. Attention to detail with very high-level of accuracy in work. Thoroughness in testing and validating changes. Communication Skills Excellent verbal and written communication. Ability to convey and present technical information to non-technical stakeholders. Customer engagement. Effective collaboration with cross-functional teams in both virtual and in-person environments. Openness to share knowledge and support colleagues to achieve common goals. Project Management Experience managing projects from initiation to completion, meeting specified deadlines. Ability to prioritize tasks and manage time effectively. Effectively manage internal and external resources. Familiarity with Agile and Scrum methodologies. Business Acumen Understanding of business processes and operations. Ability to align technical solutions with business goals. Experience in gathering and documenting business requirements. Use KPIs to review, evaluate, and track desired objectives. Flexibility to adjust to changing priorities and new projects/challenges. Minimum Experience Required Minimum of 3 to 5+ years of hands-on experience. Proficiency in both using and configuring MS Dynamics 365 Business Central and Customer Engagement. Ability to execute customizations through BC extensions and add-ons. SQL and Database Management to include the ability to write SQL queries, manage databases, and extract data. Knowledge of reporting tools such as Power BI, Domo, etc. Ability to read and understand AL code. Manufacturing/Consumer Goods experience preferred. Proficient in SharePoint and MS365 Productivity apps (e.g., Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.). Minimum Education Required Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, or Statistics. Certificate in MS Dynamics 365 Business Central or related field are highly desirable. Physical Requirements Lift up to twenty-five pounds Ability to sit for extended periods. Ability to use a computer for prolonged periods. EEOC At Wiley X, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and employees. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local laws.
summary: Wiley X is looking for a BC Analyst to support and optimize Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central (BC), Customer Engagement (CE), and other organizational systems. The role involves user support, process improvement, system design, and work process updates. The ideal candidate will have experience in Dynamics BC, CE, SQL, Power BI, Domo, Power Apps, Power Automate, and AL code.

title: Data Analyst - Compliance
description: Company Overview Lennox (NYSE: LII) is an industry leader in energy-efficient climate-control solutions founded over a century ago on the principles of integrity and innovation. Dedicated to sustainability and creating comfortable, healthier environments for our residential and commercial customers while reducing their carbon footprint, we lead the field in innovation with our cooling, heating, indoor air quality, and refrigeration systems. Job Description WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING: Design, develop, and create analytics using data/visual analytics tools such as Azure Data Factory and PowerBI. This includes workflows, pipelines, dashboards, scorecards, and metrics to provide actionable insights. Maintain and monitor existing workflows and dashboards to meet SOX and operational requirements while documenting and validating completeness and accuracy of data to ensure compliance with SOX (Sarbanes-Oxley) requirements. Standardize and streamline data analytics processes to drive efficiencies and consistency in methodologies and applications cross business units. Navigate a variety of servers, data types, and structures, and analyze complex data from multiple sources for informed decision-making. Develop, document, and maintain comprehensive technical specifications for various systems and processes. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment and deliver impactful data-driven solutions. Qualifications WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR: Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Data Science, Information Technology, Computer Science, or related fields. 2-4 years of professional-level experience in data science, business intelligence, or data analytics. Experience with Azure Data Factory and its components, including pipelines, data flows, and activities. They should be able to design, build, and maintain data integration workflows in Azure Data Factory. Proficiency in PowerBI, including app creation, visualization design, and data model development Proficient in Python and SQL programming languages. Experience in SAP, SAP BW, SAP HANA is preferred. Ability to troubleshoot data workflow issues, collaborate with teams, and communicate effectively. Proficient in troubleshooting data workflow issues, collaborating with teams, and demonstrating effective communication skills both verbally and in writing. Strong analytical skills for data analysis and providing insights for decision-making. Strong audit documentation skills. Commitment to continuous learning and staying updated with BI technologies. Certifications in Azure Data Factory, PowerBI, or related areas are preferred. WHAT WE OFFER At Lennox, we realize that our greatest assets are our employees. This is why we are committed to providing limitless opportunities for growth and development of all our employees, largely promoting from within the organization. Lennox offers employees a variety of flexible work options. This position is a hybrid role working Monday through Thursday in the office with the option to work on Friday at home. BENEFITS Competitive base salary Excellent medical plans designed to support healthy lifestyles Mental and financial health programs Outstanding 401k with company match and 1-year bonus Employee Stock Purchase Program Community involvement opportunities Robust Employee Assistance Program Relocation assistance is available And much, much more! The compensation range for this position is approximately $83,000 - $113,000 and will be based on the candidate’s qualification, experience, and education WE VALUE DIVERSITY Here at Lennox, we believe that diversity and inclusion is critical to our success as a global company, and we seek to recruit, develop, and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. Our goal is to build workplaces that reflect the communities where we live and work, support the growth and development of each team member as they strive to reach their full potential, and empower them to be their authentic selves. Lennox is an equal opportunity employer.
summary: Lennox, an industry leader in climate-control solutions, is seeking a Data Analyst to design, develop, and create analytics using Azure Data Factory and PowerBI. The ideal candidate will have 2-4 years of experience in data science, business intelligence, or data analytics, proficiency in Azure Data Factory, PowerBI, Python, and SQL, and experience with SAP, SAP BW, and SAP HANA.

title: Marketing Data Analyst - SQL Campaigns
description: TEKsystems has a remote role with our client in the travel and leisure sector. We are seeking a Marketing Data Analyst through at least the end of 2024. This position could go full-time in the future and is able to work 100% remotely from home. The primary objective of the role is to support SQL Campaigns in Amperity CDP for the Audience Management team. A secondary duty will be to help with Audience Insights & Reporting Enhancements. The Right Individual Will Have OUTSTANDING SQL query skills - this is the #1 requirement Some campaign development and implementation experience using SQL, and prior marketing experience with CDPs (Customer Data Platforms) Prior experience working with Tableau is highly preferred, almost required. Experience with CTEs (Common Table Expressions), and the ability to create queries from queries is required. Nice To Haves Include An understanding of how version control works Experience working with Amperity CDP Experience with Presto (open source SQL query engine) Excellent soft skills are also required including outstanding communication skills, the ability to be proactive and ask questions of the stakeholders (who work in relationship marketing and campaign marketing); and must have a sense of urgency to deliver things on time. Job Duties (70% of time): Development of SQL Campaigns in Amperity CDP: Implementing SQL Campaigns in Amperity CDP using the established process utilized by the Audience Management team, including development, testing, and handoff to stakeholders. (30% of time): Audience Insights & Reporting Enhancement: Continuously improving Tableau Dashboards and Data sources to facilitate self-service reporting, catering to various Audience Insights queries. Compensation is tied to the Colorado market for jobs performed in Colorado. Other locations may be subject to variances based on locations-related factors. We reserve the right to pay above or below the posted wage based on factors unrelated to sex, race, or any other protected classification. Requirements Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to specific elections, plan, or program terms. This temporary role may be eligible for the following: Medical, dental & vision 401(k)/Roth Insurance (Basic/Supplemental Life & AD&D) Short and long-term disability Health & Dependent Care Spending Accounts(HSA & DCFSA) Transportation benefits Employee Assistance Program Time Off/Leave (PTO, Vacation or Sick Leave) Accepting applications till July 12th About TEKsystems We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.
summary: TEKsystems is seeking a remote Marketing Data Analyst to support SQL Campaigns in Amperity CDP for the Audience Management team. Strong SQL skills are essential, along with experience in campaign development, CDPs, Tableau, CTEs, and version control. Excellent communication skills and a sense of urgency are also required.

title: Sr Data Analyst
description: Overview PepsiCo operates in an environment undergoing immense and rapid change. Big-data and digital technologies are driving business transformation that is unlocking new capabilities and business innovations in areas like eCommerce, mobile experiences and IoT. The key to winning in these areas is being able to leverage enterprise data foundations built on PepsiCo’s global business scale to enable business insights, advanced analytics and new product development. PepsiCo’s Data Management and Operations team is tasked with the responsibility of developing quality data collection processes, maintaining the integrity of our data foundations, and enabling business leaders and data scientists across the company to have rapid access to the data they need for decision-making and innovation. What PepsiCo Data Management and Operations does: Maintain a predictable, transparent, global operating rhythm that ensures always-on access to high-quality data for stakeholders across the company Responsible for day-to-day data collection, transportation, maintenance/curation and access to the PepsiCo corporate data asset Work cross-functionally across the enterprise to centralize data and standardize it for use by business, data science or other stakeholders Increase awareness about available data and democratize access to it across the company Job Description As a member of the data engineering team, you will be the key domain expert overseeing PepsiCo's business process and drive a strong discussion for how Supply Chain, Financial, Consumer, Channel, Category business needs to be defined and prioritize by working very closely with business leads, data science team and data engineering team. You'll develop an in-depth understanding of business processes in and translate business requirements to data engineering team in technical way. Responsibilities Accountabilities: Discover, analyze, and scope data requirements & representing them in conceptual and logical data models Gather and analyze data pertaining to various business processes such as forecasts, capital requirements, inventory, logistic, manufacturing and production capacity to develop supply chain models. geographics, POS, pricing and promotion, store profile, e-commerce data to develop channel models. Create high-level process models (system interface diagrams, workflow & swim lane diagrams, data flow diagrams) to represent processes for the area under analysis Empower the business by creating value through the increased adoption of data, data science and business intelligence landscape. Responsible to improve the quality of data in relation to defined expectations Perform analysis of system data to identify patterns, exceptions, and erroneous data. Compensation & Benefits: The expected compensation range for this position is between $115,000 - $197,500 based on a full-time schedule. Location, confirmed job-related skills and experience will be considered in setting actual starting salary. Bonus based on performance and eligibility; target payout is 10% of annual salary paid out annually. Paid time off subject to eligibility, including paid parental leave, vacation, sick, and bereavement. In addition to salary, PepsiCo offers a comprehensive benefits package to support our employees and their families, subject to elections and eligibility: Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability, Health and Dependent Care Reimbursement Accounts, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Insurance (Accident, Group Legal, Life), Defined Contribution Retirement Plan. Qualifications 6+ years of experience with data analysis & data profiling in project, business requirements definition or data engineering in CPG or Manufacturing Industry. 5+ years’ work experience in the areas of Integrated Business Planning, Demand Planning, Distribution Network Analysis, Manufacturing, Production Network Optimization, Transportation, or other areas related to Supply Chain or other domains such as Financial, Consumer, Channel, Category etc. 4+ years of strong Data Profiling experience & ability to identify trends and anomalies in the data to inform data model build out. Experience in working with Datasets from POS Aggregators such as IRI, Nielsen, Kantar etc. Experience working with structured/unstructured datasets, ability to clearly document and communicate requirement to technical team members. Experience with Business Intelligence tools, SQLTools. Experience with SAP and SAP/IBP is a plus Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Supply Chain and/or Operations Management is Required, Masters Preferred. Competencies: Strong knowledge and understanding of Supply Chain data elements and processes per the necessary in-scope data domain (i.e., Customer, Material, Vendor) Ability to translate business requirements into critical data dependencies and requirements Able to challenge and align various stakeholders to a common set of standards Self-starter with excellent written & verbal communication skills. Self-learner and eager to understand data, business processes, concepts, and technologies. EEO Statement All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status. PepsiCo is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Female / Minority / Disability / Protected Veteran / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity If you'd like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant under the law, please download the available EEO is the Law & EEO is the Law Supplement documents. View PepsiCo EEO Policy. Please view our Pay Transparency Statement
summary: PepsiCo is looking for a data engineer to join their Data Management and Operations team. This role will focus on defining and prioritizing business needs in areas like Supply Chain, Financial, Consumer, Channel, and Category. The candidate will be responsible for data analysis, modeling, and process documentation, as well as ensuring data quality and identifying trends and anomalies.
benefits: Health and Dependent Care Reimbursement Accounts

title: Financial Data Analyst
description: What does a successful Sr Financial Data Analyst - ISOs/Agents Residual Processing at Fiserv do? In this role, you will be responsible for collecting, interpreting, and analyzing financial data related to Independent Sales Organization’s (ISO)/Agents’ residual payments. You will play a key role in ensuring accuracy and efficiency in the processing of ISOs residuals, identifying trends, anomalies, and opportunities for optimization. What you will do: Conduct in-depth analysis of ISOs/Agents’ residuals data to ensure accuracy and compliance with established guidelines. Develop and maintain robust reporting mechanisms to track and monitor ISOs/Agents’ residuals payments and performance metrics. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to streamline ISOs/Agents’ residuals processes and drive improvements in efficiency. Provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis to support strategic decision-making and performance evaluation. Utilize advanced financial modeling techniques and statistical tools to analyze ISOs/Agents’ residuals payments and trends. Work closely with cross-functional teams, including IT and Operations, to ensure seamless integration of residuals systems. What you will need to have: Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business, Business Analytics or related field 3+ years experience in financial data analysis What would be great to have: Proficiency in Oracle SQL Credit Card Industry experience #LI-VA1
summary: This role involves analyzing financial data related to Independent Sales Organization (ISO) and agent residual payments, ensuring accuracy and compliance, developing reporting mechanisms, collaborating with cross-functional teams to optimize processes, providing insights for strategic decision-making, utilizing advanced modeling techniques, and working closely with IT and Operations.

title: Data Governance Analyst - ONSITE No remote
description: Position Description Hybrid. Do NOT submit remote candidates. Read the hybrid requirement in the attached job description carefully please and make sure your candidate fully understands the expectation. If you feel the candidate will be an issue, if they express any desire to work 100% remote, do NOT submit them and move on please. Occasional travel with expenses reimbursed. Start asap, duration likely longer than one year. Role: Data Governance Analyst Location: Jackson, MS - 75% ONSITE per month. Duration: till June 2025 Position Description and Job Skill Set Description of the job functions the contractor will be expected to perform. Receiving Requests Processing Data and Public Records Requests: Receive and log incoming data and public records requests from non-media parties. Ensure requests are properly documented and tracked for timely processing. Legal Review And Redaction Assist in legal review of requested documents to determine necessary redactions to protect sensitive information before release as public records. Ensure compliance with legal requirements and agency policies regarding public records disclosures. Data Retrieval And Compilation Coordinate with relevant departments or personnel to retrieve requested data and compile necessary documents for disclosure. Ensure completeness and accuracy of information provided in response to requests. Response Preparation Prepare responses to data and public records requests in accordance with established timelines and legal requirements. Draft correspondence and documentation ensuring clarity and completeness in responses. Communication And Follow-up Communicate with requesters to clarify requests, provide updates on processing status, and coordinate delivery of requested information. Maintain records of communications and actions taken related to each request. Microsoft Purview Oversight Serve as the primary compliance contact for the implementation and oversight of the agency’s Microsoft Purview application. Microsoft Purview is a data governance tool that helps organizations map, manage, and govern their data across various sources. Data types to be brought under Purview oversight and management include: data/files within enterprise Microsoft 365 applications (Outlook, SharePoint, OneDrive, Teams, Exchange, etc.) and other on-premises, multicloud, and software as a service (SaaS) data. Data cover a range of public health subject matters such as: disease surveillance and reporting, environmental health (water supply, wastewater, food protection, etc.), vital records and statistics, and professional and healthcare facility licensure, just to name a few. Key Purview Duties And Responsibilities Include Data Cataloging: Organizing and indexing data assets for easy discovery and understanding. Data Classification: Applying labels and tags to data based on sensitivity and regulatory requirements. Data Lineage: Tracking the origins, movements, and transformations of data throughout its lifecycle. Data Insights: Providing analytical capabilities to derive insights and enhance decision-making. Data Compliance: Ensuring data usage complies with regulatory standards and internal policies. Policy Development And Compliance Collaborate with the Director of Data Governance to develop and revise policies, Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), and guidelines related to data management and governance. Ensure that policies align with federal and state data laws, regulations, and organizational objectives. Monitor and interpret federal and state data protection laws, regulations (such as HIPAA), and industry standards. Develop training materials and conduct sessions to educate agency staff on data governance policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements. Foster a culture of compliance and data stewardship across the organization. Data Management And Systems Development Collaborate with the Director of Data Governance in developing and designing data management applications and systems. Aim to improve the agency’s data capabilities for public health purposes. Provide general support to the agency in its projects funded under the CDC Public Health Infrastructure Grant (PHIG), specifically under Strategy A3: Data Modernization. Projects include: Cataloging and organization of agency data resources with the ultimate goal of creating a public facing agency-wide data catalog, Assisting with the selection and implementation of an updated process for managing external requests for data and public records Supporting the creation and implementation of project timelines Consistent and effective communication with agency staff supporting the projects, and maintaining focus on project goals and meeting deadlines Assist with the collecting, organizing and leveraging large amounts of data across multiple subject matters to enable more accessible utilization and analysis of the data using data lakes, warehouses, lakehouses, catalogs, etc. Required Skills/Experience Required Skills/Experience Proficiency in Microsoft 365 applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, Teams) and Adobe Apply At Please send your resume and a cover letter to Susmita Sahu (Susmita at irginc dot net) at susmita@irginc.net . You may call Susmita # 573-797-9902. https://dice.com/recruiter-profile?id=73127242-68b3-45fc-ad32-f062f3579805 To contact me click "View Profile" for the contact number.
summary: Data Governance Analyst with a focus on implementing and overseeing Microsoft Purview for data governance. Responsibilities include data cataloging, classification, lineage, insights, and compliance. Additional responsibilities involve assisting with public records requests, policy development, compliance, and data management system development.  Strong experience with Microsoft 365 applications, Adobe, and data governance tools is essential.
