title: Data Governance Analyst
description: Job Title: Class Action - Data Governance Analyst Remote, 50 miles within Beaverton, OR 1+ yr contract, potential extensions and conversion MUST be US Citizen or Green Card Holder for background security purposes Job Description: • Top 3 Required Skills: Analytical, self-driven, great communicator • Job Summary Client is a worldwide provider of legal and business services, serving law firms, corporations, financial institutions and government agencies—helping them streamline the administration of business operations, class action and mass tort, court reporting, eDiscovery, regulatory, compliance, restructuring, legal transformation, and bankruptcy matters. Class Action (ECA) is responsible for administering class action lawsuits in the legal industry. ECA manages and shepherds data through the entire lifecycle of a class action or similar matter. Each case, whilst unique, undergoes a similar lifecycle and series of operations, including initial gathering of client data, notifying potential class members, receiving claim information, and calculating settlement amounts. The Data Governance Analyst works within the Data Governance team where our passion for accurate and actionable data enables the company to make smart decisions to mitigate risk and add process defining value. The Data Governance Analyst will work closely with the Data Governance Senior Manager to drive change in a data rich environment through analyzing the integrity, efficiency and availability of data. You will work alongside data owners, data stewards, and business stakeholders to provide support whilst creating and maintaining policies, standards, and the implementation of non-invasive data governance through Microsoft Purview. Essential Job Functions • 25% - Support the implementation of non-invasive data governance through the use of Microsoft Purview as the unified data governance solution • 20% - Develop and foster relationships with a broad range of business partners to understand current and anticipated future business needs regarding data and data governance • 20% - Participate in analyzing, planning, development and/or implementation through the following: o Clarification and/or implementation of technical or business requirements o Data governance policy creation, management, and analyzing potential impacts of policy choices under consideration • 15% - Serve as a liaison between functional and technology teams to ensure a common understanding about business data, including who owns data, what data means, where to find data, when data is available, and how data can be used. • 10% - Coordinate and monitor data standardization efforts and compliance, identifying data/process gaps and working with business process owners and technology teams to resolve discrepancies • 5% - Research and development of new data governance best practices and implementation strategies • 5% - Provide data governance expertise in potentially complex areas and data-intensive projects Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business Administration, or a related field is, strongly preferred Work Experience: • Minimum 5+ years' experience in data governance, data management, data engineering, business intelligence, data quality , and/or related fields • Knowledge of d ata-related government regulatory requirements, privacy and security best practices, and data lifecycle/retention policies and practices Skills & Abilities: • Passionate about the benefits of accurate and actionable data, you drive consistency and enjoy partnering with others to accomplish the task • Knowledgeable and experienced with data management processes, reference data, policy creation, data stewardship, and technologies • Demonstrates the ability to translate business issues and requirements into actionable plans, and to deliver against those plans • Experience with Microsoft Purview is critical to success in this role • Intermediate level knowledge and experience working with SQL Server and/or in the development of T-SQL code highly desired • Excellent project planning, organizational, and analytical skills – is self-motivated, delivering results with minimal supervision • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with a proven track record of achieving consensus and buy-in through education, facilitation, persuasion, and leading by example • Thinks strategically, with an equal focus on delivering to both short- and long-term business objectives Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by a worker to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Pre-Employment Requirement All employment offers are contingent upon successful completion of our pre-employment screening that may include drug testing, background/criminal check, and if applicable, must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. APR Staffing is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. About APR Staffing APR Staffing was born from the merger of two well-respected technical staffing firms in Portland. ieSolutions, founded in 2002, enjoyed an impressive reputation as one of the largest locally-owned and most respected technical staffing companies. Professional Resource Group, aka Data Resource Group, founded in 2009, also earned regional acclaim for being a fast-growing and highly-motivated professional staffing agency. Both companies have been recent award winners for the Portland Business Journal's Fastest-Growing Private Companies. The two firms, now as APR Staffing, make for one of the fastest-growing and most-respected professional and technical staffing companies in Oregon and Southwest Washington. Collaborating with our customers, we augment their workforce with technical and administrative professionals. We provide only high-caliber, professional-grade resources throughout the Pacific Northwest.
summary: This position involves implementing data governance solutions using Microsoft Purview for a legal services provider. The Data Governance Analyst will analyze data integrity, efficiency, and availability, develop relationships with business partners, and contribute to data policy creation and management. The role requires strong analytical skills, experience with data management, and familiarity with SQL Server and T-SQL.

title: Data Analyst II
description: GENERAL SUMMARY/ OVERVIEW STATEMENT: Summarize the nature and level of work performed. The Manning Lab within the Clinical and Translational Epidemiology Unit at Massachusetts General Hospital, Department of Medicine at Harvard Medical School, and the Data Science and Metabolism Programs at the Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard is currently seeking a Data Analyst I to support Dr. Alisa Manning, PhD and her research group. The Manning Lab studies the molecular and mechanistic basis of insulin resistance and obesity and is known for developing statistical strategies for translational epidemiology using whole genome sequence association studies, physiological and molecular studies in humans and integrative analytics. Our goal is to understand the relationship between Genes, Environment and Disease to foster a stimulating and interdisciplinary research environment with local and international collaborators on a range of projects. The candidate must have training in biostatistics, epidemiology, statistics, or related field. The Data Analyst will work with a team of investigators, clinical research coordinators, analysts, post-doctoral fellows on various projects. The Data Analyst will be responsible for a myriad of data-centric tasks, including data cleaning, harmonization, quality control, analysis, interpretation, as well as the development of analysis plans, execution of statistical tests and models, aiding in data visualization, and communicating findings in presentations and manuscripts. PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Indicate key areas of responsibility, major job duties, special projects and key objectives for this position.These items should be evaluated throughout the year and included in the written annual evaluation. Perform genome-wide association analyses and gene-environment interaction analyses using baseline and longitudinal data from diabetes studies. Collaborate with researchers to develop computational methods for analyzing genomic and genetic data in diabetes research. Harmonize phenotype data from biobanks to facilitate integrative analyses with omics and genetics approaches. Contribute to the development and implementation of data processing pipelines for large-scale genomic and genetic datasets. Utilize problem-solving skills to address complex analytical challenges and optimize data analysis workflows. Contribute to the communication of findings effectively through presentations and scientific publications. SKILLS/ ABILITIES/ COMPETENCIES REQUIRED: (MUST be realistic, measurable, objective, and related to the essential functions of the job.) Demonstrated strong analytic ability Demonstrated experience working in R, Python, or similar programming languages. Excellent time-management and organizational skills. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work individually and within a team to complete tasks related to research projects. EDUCATION:Specify minimum education and clearly indicate if preferred or required The ideal candidate should possess either a Master’s degree or higher in a relevant field with college-level statistics courses. EXPERIENCE: Specify minimum creditable years of experience and clearly indicate if preferred or required Master's degree in Genetics, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, or a related field. Required proficiency in statistical programming languages such as R or Python. Experience with genomic and genetic data analysis techniques, including genome-wide association studies and omics data analysis preferred. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment. Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to interdisciplinary audiences. Prior experience in diabetes research or genetic epidemiology is preferred. Primary Location MA-Boston-MGH Main Campus Work Locations MGH Main Campus Job Data/Analytics Organization Massachusetts General Hospital(MGH) Schedule Full-time Standard Hours 40 Shift Day Job Employee Status Regular Recruiting Department MGH Mongan Institute Job Posting Jul 9, 2024
summary: The Manning Lab at Massachusetts General Hospital seeks a Data Analyst I to support research on the molecular and mechanistic basis of insulin resistance and obesity. The role involves data cleaning, harmonization, analysis, interpretation, development of analysis plans, execution of statistical tests and models, data visualization, and communication of findings. The candidate will collaborate with researchers, clinical research coordinators, and analysts on various projects.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: Jack Schroeder and Associates, LLC De Pere, WI (onsite) About Us: At Jack Schroeder and Associates (JSA), we take pride in fostering a supportive environment where our employees' dedication directly impacts the exceptional service we provide to our partners. For over 50 years, we've stood out as a brokerage that goes above and beyond to support our agents. With an unmatched back-office support system, advanced technology, and a dedicated team, we make doing business easy and efficient. We are seeking a highly skilled Data Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will have experience in data analysis, Azure Data Factory, Power Query, PowerBI, SQL, Python, R, SAS, Salesforce, Tableau, ad hoc reports, dashboards, data patterns, business intelligence analyst, and predictive models. Perks and Benefits: Competitive salary package based on experience Company-paid premiums for comprehensive healthcare coverage, including medical, dental, and vision for full-time employees Free life insurance, ID theft protection, and 401k with match Employee Assistance Program and voluntary benefit options for additional protection Half-day Fridays with full-day pay during the summer season to promote work-life balance Company-paid holidays and immediate paid time off Professional development opportunities for skill enhancement and career advancement Responsibilities: Collect and analyze large datasets to identify trends and patterns Create and maintain data pipelines using Azure Data Factory and Power Query Develop and maintain reports and dashboards using PowerBI and Tableau Write complex SQL queries to extract data from databases Use Python, R, and SAS to build predictive models Work with Salesforce data to identify sales trends and patterns Create ad hoc reports for various departments within the organization Identify data patterns and provide insights to the business Collaborate with business intelligence analysts to develop data-driven strategies Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, or related field Proven experience as a Data Analyst or equivalent Experience with Azure Data Factory, Power Query, PowerBI, SQL, Python, R, SAS, Salesforce, and Tableau Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Excellent communication and collaboration skills Ability to work independently and as part of a team Physical Job Requirements & Work Environment While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to remain in a stationary position for up to eight hours in an office environment. The employee occasionally is required to move to access people or workspaces. Involves frequent telephone contact with agents and employees. Interaction with others is constant and may be interruptive or involve dealing with angry or upset people. The employee may occasionally lift files, paper, or office equipment weighing up to 35 pounds. Requires manual dexterity sufficient to operate a keyboard, calculator, telephone, copier, and other such office equipment as necessary. Vision must be correctable to 20/30 and hearing must be in the normal range for telephone contacts. It is necessary to view and type on computer screens for long periods and the ability to optimally communicate is required. The role involves collecting and analyzing large datasets, creating and maintaining data pipelines, developing and maintaining reports and dashboards, writing complex SQL queries, building predictive models, identifying sales trends and patterns, creating ad hoc reports, collaborating with business intelligence analysts, and identifying data patterns. title: Data Analyst III
description: Job Description The Data Analyst III in Hospital Provider Finance performs complex (journey-level) financial data analysis and data research assignments for the Provider Finance department in support of the development of reimbursement rates, supplemental payment programs, and financial analyses. Work involves conducting detailed analysis of data sets, including monitoring and ensuring data quality, loading data into databases from a variety of source formats, and automating data feeds to be used as input to performance dashboards and reports. Develops and delivers financial data solutions including the creation of dashboards and reports for large and complex agency programs. Works under general supervision, with limited latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment. Attends work on a regular and predictable schedule in accordance with agency leave policy and performs other duties as assigned. Essential Job Functions EJF 1. Develops data-driven reports and analysis by using knowledge of Business Objects, HCRIS, Phoenix, or other databases. Assists in the maintenance of department data either through database maintenance, or development of data tools. Utilizes data visualization tools such as Tableau to assist with decision-making and to provide recommendations for future modifications to programs. Analyzes the data and advises key personnel about data irregularities on an ad hoc basis. EJF 2. Compiles, queries, loads and analyzes data points using query languages such as SQL from a variety of source formats to develop complex financial analyses. Provides data integrity by identifying data gaps, errors, anomalies, inconsistencies, and redundancies in the content, structure, and relationships within data, cleans and prunes data to discard irrelevant information. Coordinates with Texas Medicaid and Healthcare Partnership, managed care organizations, providers, and federal personnel to improve data quality. Designs and advises leadership staff regarding data collection needs and concerns; provides suggestions regarding systematic changes that will improve the collection of data. Assists in development of data standards. EJF 3. Consults with reimbursement rate analysts, program staff, and vendors to understand the business requirements that drive the analysis and design of reporting solutions that facilitate the development of reimbursement rates and the calculation of supplemental payments to providers. Uses subject matter knowledge of the data systems to support Senior Rate Analysts with selection of appropriate data sets. EJF 4. Actively contributes to the continuous improvement of department processes through ongoing initiatives including: solutions to automate, building efficiencies, and maintaining consistency across multiple data sources and by evaluating existing tools and applications. May assist with preparing and conducting presentations and reports to external stakeholders, workgroups, legislative staff and members. Will assist with preparing and conducting presentations and reports to executive staff. EJF 5. Will assist in the development of standards, usage guidelines, and procedures for data visualization tools, as appropriate. Will train others and assist with data integrity processes, data visualization tool usage, new techniques in data processing and analytics, and best practices; provides support for data visualization tool related questions, requests, and issues. Knowledge Skills Abilities Knowledge of reimbursement rate development and supplemental payment program processes. Knowledge of Medicaid reimbursement methods. Knowledge of hospital cost report concepts. Basic understanding of relational databases and database design. Knowledge of data visualization techniques, including data model creation, calculations, and interactive dashboards. Skill in performing queries, extracting and joining data, and loading data using SQL and/or other query languages. Skill in creating mockups, prototypes, and design documents. Skill in critical thinking and problem solving. Ability to translate complex financial data into user-friendly information. Ability to identify problems, evaluate alternatives, and implement effective solutions. Ability to design and assist with the implementation and use new technology and work processes to enhance decision-making. Ability to build, establish, and maintain effective working relationships and coalitions. Registration Or Licensure Requirements NA Initial Selection Criteria Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university. Experience in Provider Finance may be substituted for educational requirement on a year-for-year basis. Experience developing in data visualization tools such as Tableau. Two or more years’ experience performing queries, extracting, and cleaning business or program performance data from a variety of source formats preferred. Experience in expressing reimbursement rate, technical and financial concepts and conclusions orally and in writing. Additional Information Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university. Experience in Provider Finance may be substituted for educational requirement on a year-for-year basis. MOS Code There are no direct military occupation(s) that relate to the responsibilities, and requirements for this position. All active duty, reservists, guardsmen, and veterans are encouraged to apply if they meet the qualifications for this position. HHS agencies use E-Verify. You must bring your I-9 documentation with you on your first day of work. I-9 Form - Click here to download the I-9 form. In compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), HHS agencies will provide reasonable accommodation during the hiring and selection process for qualified individuals with a disability. If you need assistance completing the on-line application, contact the HHS Employee Service Center at 1-888-894-4747. If you are contacted for an interview and need accommodation to participate in the interview process, please notify the person scheduling the interview. Top 10 Tips for Success when Applying to Jobs at HHSC and DSHS
summary: The Data Analyst III in Hospital Provider Finance performs complex financial data analysis and data research to support the development of reimbursement rates, supplemental payment programs, and financial analyses for the Provider Finance department. Responsibilities include data analysis, data quality monitoring, data loading, automating data feeds, creating dashboards and reports, consulting with stakeholders, and contributing to continuous improvement of department processes.

title: IT Data Analytics Analyst
description: Job Title: IT Data Analytics Analyst Primary Location: Hybrid, 3 days a week, Northwest Suburbs of IL Position Type: Direct Hire Overview TalentFish is casting a line for a dynamic & analytical IT Data Analytics Analyst. This is a hybrid, 3 days a week, role in the Deerfield, IL area. In this new role with our premier client, the IT Data Analytics Analyst, will play a pivotal role in facilitating the seamless execution of our centralized User Entitlement Review (UER) process. Utilizing internally developed tools in Outsystems and Alteryx, you'll collaborate closely with various management levels to ensure adherence to our access management policy and provide vital support in identifying and remedying compliance gaps. Don't miss this opportunity to be part of a fast-paced, high-performance team where your technical expertise will drive impactful solutions! What You Bring To The Role. (Ideal Experience) Bachelor's degree in Business Analytics, Information Systems, or related field. 2-4+ years of work experience within Data Analysis. Familiarity with auditing standards and previous experience in audit, controls, process, and/or IT audit. Knowledge in writing SQL Queries. Experience in executing end-to-end centralized User Entitlement Reviews, including data preparation, ETL processes, monitoring, and risk assessment using tools like Alteryx. Strong analytical skills and experience in translating business requirements into review strategies and quantitative analytics. Detail-oriented mindset with the ability to identify patterns, anomalies, and potential risks. Ability to combine technical knowledge with business understanding. Commitment to maintaining ethical standards and confidentiality. What You'll Do. (Skills Used In This Position) Execute end-to-end centralized User Entitlement Reviews, including data preparation, ETL processes, monitoring, and risk assessment using tools like Alteryx. Support development, testing, and implementation of UER tool updates to ensure accuracy of user access. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and technical architecture for security across various applications. Apply analytical and critical thinking skills to identify risks and compliance issues in user access controls, and proactively address inaccuracies. Assist in mapping and executing ETL processes in the user access review workflow. Maintain standard operating procedures, document best practices, and optimize user access review processes. Participate in troubleshooting activities and utilize data analysis techniques, including SQL queries, for reviewing access data accuracy. Demonstrate adaptability in dealing with changing priorities, multitasking, and embracing an "all in " attitude as part of a High-Performance team. Perform other duties as requested. Occasional travel may be required for training and support functions. In the office 3 days a week, with ad-hoc flexibility as needed. TalentFish is an employee-owned company pioneering a new realm in talent acquisition. We are redefining IT staffing by evolving AI, video screening, and our unique platform. TalentFish focuses on providing the best employee, consultant, and client experience possible. At TalentFish we are an Equal Opportunity Employer; we embrace and encourage diversity!
summary: TalentFish seeks a dynamic IT Data Analytics Analyst to execute a centralized User Entitlement Review (UER) process using Outsystems and Alteryx. This role requires 2-4+ years of experience in data analysis, familiarity with auditing standards, SQL query writing, and ETL processes. The analyst will collaborate with cross-functional teams, identify risks and compliance issues, and maintain standard operating procedures.

title: Marketing Data Analyst
description: Overview Global Marketing is the lead generation engine for the Private Client Group, and the Marketing Data & Analytics Team plays an important role in that process. You will help guide important decisions while assessing performance. The Opportunity: As a Marketing Data Analyst, you will help maintain the flow of data through the Marketing department, provide analysis and reporting to all levels of marketing partners, and help with ad hoc requests and long-term developments. Using skills in SQL, Excel (can perform complex functions) , VBA, PowerBI, and more, you will build reporting and hone your project management skills to support infrastructure improvements. You will also learn how to critically assess problems and opportunities to improve bottom-line results. The Day-to-Day: Work with marketing management to support all phases of marketing efforts Daily reporting for US and International Marketing teams Build and automate new and existing processes Understand the “why” and “how” of department data flow Communicate clearly by distilling information down for a non-technical audience Provide data-driven analysis and insights to optimize campaign performance Collaborate with other analysts, marketing managers, and database developers on both strategic initiatives and ongoing data infrastructure enhancement projects Manage ad hoc data requests from marketers to help meet a variety of needs such as troubleshooting data oddities, QA’ing data, building reporting modeling, and more Your Qualifications: 2+ years Data Analytics experience Strong proficiency in SQL, Excel, PowerBI, or relational databases A history of managing complexity; strong project management skills Demonstrated leadership and capacity for learning new skills and willingness to share knowledge and teach others Ability to communicate both technical and non-technical insights to all levels of management Why Fisher Investments: We work for a bigger purpose: bettering the investment universe. We take great pride in our inclusive culture, our learning and development framework customized for every employee, and our Great Place to Work Certification. It's the people that make the Fisher purpose possible, and we invest in them by offering exceptional benefits like: 100% paid medical, dental and vision premiums for you and your qualifying dependents A 50% 401(k) match, up to the IRS maximum 20 days of PTO*, plus 10 paid holidays (*17 days of PTO and 3 days of sick time for California employees) Family Support programs including 8 weeks Paid Primary Caregiver leave, adoption assistance and back-up child care $10,000 fertility, hormonal health and family-forming benefit FISHER INVESTMENTS IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER
summary: As a Marketing Data Analyst, you will work with marketing management to support all phases of marketing efforts, provide daily reporting for US and International Marketing teams, build and automate new and existing processes, understand the "why" and "how" of department data flow, communicate clearly by distilling information down for a non-technical audience, provide data-driven analysis and insights to optimize campaign performance, collaborate with other analysts, marketing managers, and database developers on both strategic initiatives and ongoing data infrastructure enhancement projects, and manage ad hoc data requests from marketers.

title: Technical analyst/Data

This is a 12 + month contract position. Responsibilities: Engage with business partners to analyze, implement, and update processes by utilizing sound process improvement models and techniques Manage design or redesign of processes or projects using six sigma methodologies Integrate best practices with process design to ensure continuous process improvement Build action plans and drives execution May manage teams to achieve process or project objectives; processes are within a product or service delivery within a single business unit or department and are typically directed toward improving a single business, product, or function Provide leadership for Data Movement Operations (DMO) development, maintenance and support activities Maintain multi-year roadmap to support critical business objectives, leading technology governance activities, interfacing with technology development and support teams to ensure on-time delivery of products Requirements: JIRA Micro Strategy / Tableau Agile experience - working with Scrum Master, developers, tech leads, etc. Data management/governance background - experience in process improvement, process flow, business process) Sharp communication, written and verbal skills Able to lead / manage their own workstream from inception to post implementation Experience working in a fast paced environment and able to execute all of their assigned tasks on daily basis Only candidates available and ready to work directly as Genesis10 employees will be considered for this position. With more than 300 active clients, Genesis10 provides access to many of the Fortune 100 firms and a variety of mid-market organizations across the full spectrum of industry verticals. The opportunity to have a career-home in Genesis10; many of our consultants have been working exclusively with Genesis10 for years. title: Master Data Finance Analyst
description: Overall Responsibility As an integral member of the finance and accounting team you will be the custodian of Finance Master Data. This position plays a key role in maintaining key financial data as part of Pete and Gerry’s Master Data Process. This role will maintain data, analyze data, develop and manage tools to build data standards and relevant internal controls as well as continuously improve Master Data quality against those standards along with ad-hoc duties as assigned. Job Duties and Responsibilities Create and maintain finance master data elements in ERP including general ledger accounts, department codes, customer information, vendor information, inventory items etc. Contribute to defining finance master data standards Ensure the correct data is set up and support is properly retained in compliance with the Company’s internal controls Perform audits and cleansing of existing master data elements to maintain data integrity and quality including uniqueness and consistency of data as well as identification and application of best practices. Support Finance improvement projects including developing standards, procedures and guidelines that comply with internal control needs Apply technical knowledge to determine business implications of change requests Work with the Finance team to define and implement efficient and effective processes for the creation and maintenance of core finance master data objects including the documentation of, identify process risks and inefficiencies, maintenance of data processes, and process-improvement measures. Ensure smooth operations by serving as center of expertise for maintaining finance master data attributes Ensure that process changes are adhered to in accordance with change management principles, follow a structured process to document process requirement and meet internal control compliance Ensure compliance with all internal controls, including coordination of required documents for audits Responsible for supporting and enabling the planning and execution on all relevant process rollouts and process improvements Participate as an effective team member in working collaboratively with your leader, peers and relevant others (including from other teams) to achieve business goals Minimum Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Accounting 1 – 2 years relevant accounting experience Strong understanding of internal controls including experience performing key controls Excellent organizational skills combined with strong attention to detail Comprehensive knowledge of Excel as well as other Microsoft Office tools Excellent written and verbal communication skills Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central, SAP, or similar ERP systems experience a plus
summary: This role is responsible for maintaining financial master data in an ERP system, ensuring data quality, and contributing to process improvements within the finance team. The position requires a strong understanding of internal controls and experience with ERP systems.

title: Senior Associate, Analytics
description: THIS POSITION IS HYBRID. EMPLOYEES WILL BE EXPECTED TO COME ONSITE TO OUR LA OFFICE 3X A WEEK.**** About Vaynermedia VaynerMedia is a contemporary global creative and media agency with an expertise in driving relevance for clients and delivering impactful business results. The independently-owned company was founded in 2009 by Gary Vaynerchuk, and has offices in New York, Los Angeles, Toronto,Mexico City, London, Amsterdam, Singapore, Kuala Lumpur, Bangkok, Tokyo, and Sydney. VaynerMedia has been recognized for its work at Cannes Lions, the Clio Awards and The Webby Awards. It is part of the VaynerX family of companies. The primary role of the Senior Associate, Analytics is to develop effective and high-quality data analysis, insights, and recommendations that help drive business outcomes. Who Are You? A critical thinker, upbeat, and hungry to learn. You're someone who's driven to constantly look for better ways to do things and excited at the prospect of working in a constantly evolving industry with far more "unknown" than "known", and love playing a leadership role on a team that shares your drive to always continue learning. The Task At Hand: Analyze campaign and customer data to provide conclusions, implications, and actionable recommendations designed to improve the quality of future relationship marketing communications Responsible for day-to-day analytics for assigned clients, including QA of data and reporting templates Develop and present on-going analytics deliverables to day to day clients coordinating with more senior analytics team members and account management Support team leads on any internal projects to further develop the analytics practice including implementation of analytical tools, techniques, processes, and frameworks The Ideal Candidate Has: 1-2+ years of media analytics and insights experience Result-oriented with the ability to work within strict time constraints while balancing multiple projects Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to interact at all levels of the organization A collaborative teammate with the knack to pivot in a constantly evolving environment Knowledge of a variety of media measurement methodologies and their applications including match market testing, multi-touch attribution and media mix modeling Passionate about research, television, marketing, emerging media, and technology Strong PowerPoint/Excel and Google Slide/Sheet skills Experience with one or more media platforms including Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Tumblr, YouTube, DCM, DV360, The Trade Desk Experience with SQL, Tableau preferred Query and analyze complex data sets to develop actionable insights that enable the optimization of media and content. Analyze KPIs for tactics with a focus on audience engagement, campaign effectiveness, and creative deep dives. Unsure if you meet the qualifications? We are always looking for talent which will continue to cultivate an inclusive and representative team that will enhance our perspectives, skill sets, background, and behaviors. We encourage those who are passionate about what we do to apply! Exact compensation may vary based on skills, experience, and location. Base Salary $75,000- $80,000 annually Employer-sponsored 401k with match Medical, Dental, and vision coverage Unlimited PTO Caregiver (Parental) Leave Health and Wellness benefits Unsure if you meet the qualifications? We are always looking for talent which will continue to cultivate an inclusive and representative team that will enhance our perspectives, skill sets, background, and behaviors. We encourage those who are passionate about what we do to apply! Exact compensation may vary based on skills, experience, and location. Employer-sponsored 401k with match Medical, Dental, and vision coverage Unlimited PTO Caregiver (Parental) Leave Health and Wellness benefits Base Salary $75,000 — $80,000 USD
summary: VaynerMedia, a global creative and media agency, is seeking a Senior Associate, Analytics to analyze campaign and customer data, develop insights, and provide actionable recommendations to improve relationship marketing communications. The ideal candidate will have 1-2 years of experience in media analytics and insights, strong communication skills, and knowledge of various media measurement methodologies. They will also have experience with media platforms like Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and SQL/Tableau. The position is hybrid with a requirement to work in the LA office 3 days a week.

title: Operations Excellence Data Analyst
description: Vertex Service Partners (an Alpine Investors company) Operations Excellence Data Analyst Charlotte, NC Travel: up to 20% Vertex Service Partners is a company focused on acquiring and growing residential home improvement services companies in the United States, with a focus on residential roofing & other exterior services. Vertex is backed by Alpine Investors, a top-decile private equity fund with a long history of successful investments in similar industries. Vertex will be an investment out of Alpine’s 9th fund, which will have ~$4.5 billion of committed capital. This is an opportunity to be on the ground floor of a company with the explicit mandate to grow to be a multi-billion-dollar company within the next five years, with the goal to grow the right way – through a relentless focus on employee and customer experience. Mission of the role: Develop and maintain PriceBooks (the topline and gross margin engine of our companies) that drive accurate COGS, pricing and a best-in-class sales process, to maximize value capture for fast-growing roofing brands within Vertex, contributing to our mission to build best-in-class home improvement brands. Where you’ll make an impact: Support the Operations Excellence, Technology, & Finance teams to implement pricing strategies and optimize profitability while maintaining competitive positioning and polished sales tools. Develop and maintain estimation tools to calculate material costs and labor expenses for roofing and other home services packages. Maintain accurate records of pricing adjustments, discounts, and promotions within PriceBooks. Further, implement processes for regular price audits and updates utilizing national supplier and distributor data. Apply your analytical skills to manage pristine, proprietary data sources and strengthen Vertex’s ability to make data driven decisions. Key Outcomes: Directly maximize gross margin by supporting the strategy for $100M+ (and growing) of roofing materials spend and by becoming an expert in building and maintaining partner pricing via ownership of the “PriceBook”: Develop and maintain comprehensive PriceBooks for partner companies that produces accurate gross margin, accounting & robust, insightful P&L and trend data. Develop a templatized process that enables production and maintenance of 15-20 PriceBooks / year. Define & document PriceBook standards and best practices; conduct analysis to identify the “best-in-class” PriceBooks and redesign suboptimal PriceBooks to new standards. Support Ops Excellence leadership on procurement analysis and identify high ROI opportunities for Vertex. Implement best practices for CRM management, including data hygiene, customization, and integration with other business systems to ensure business KPIs are reportable; perform data quality assessments and audits and present gap analyses. Develop dynamic estimate templates to streamline sales processes and empower roofing start-ups to effectively showcase product offerings and rapidly grow its salesforce while maintaining consistent pricing and gross margin: Act as a thought partner, thoughtfully combining Vertex models with expertise from partner companies to develop estimation tools for sales and production teams across the country. Build polished, engaging, consumer-facing sales tools. In some cases, serve as an onsite Vertex representative as partner companies go-live on Vertex’s standardized CRM. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to streamline operations and drive growth: Analyze complex data sets from key industry stakeholders to build out Vertex’s data repository. Take on new challenges as they arise, demonstrating critical thinking and growth mindset in a dynamic startup environment. Manage project plans in Monday.com; keep the team apprised of efforts across partners and ensure deadlines are met. Contribute to team culture and effort by supporting other key initiatives as needed. This role allows one to: Flex advanced data and analytical skills to develop and build out company-wide operations excellence and directly drive topline and margin expansion. Own major aspects of Vertex’s sales, procurement and pricing strategies. Take on a strategic role in a rapidly growing Company Work with a collaborative, entrepreneurial, and results oriented senior leadership team. Build a relationship with a dynamic and engaged private equity firm. Who you are: You have worked as a data analyst or in consulting, private equity or investment banking analyst for 2+ years You could be described as an “Excel super-user” with advanced modelling capabilities and the critical thinking skills to match You are proficient in SQL and confident in your querying and database management ability You are familiar with basic accounting concepts such as “GL codes” and proficient in a P&L structure You are adept at combining data analysis ability with basic accounting acumen to thoughtfully analyze pricing strategies You have an aesthetic eye towards building consumer-facing, professional work product You are comfortable with project-based work and have exceptional time management, organization, and prioritization skills You have an entrepreneurial spirit and desire to build a function from the ground up You are capable of and eager to drive accountability without direct authority You are excited by having a direct impact on top-line and bottom-line growth Personal Characteristics: Data-driven decision-maker – Skilled at working with data and finding meaning and action in numbers. Flexible & Adaptable – Willing to take on new projects and challenges to support the evolving needs of a high growth company. Get it done attitude – Willing to problem-solve on the fly and complete time sensitive work done to drive the business forward Service-Oriented - Builds strong relationships with peers across the corporate executive team and in our operating companies. Culture-carrier, prioritizing the success of the company and a deep will to win. You are a humble servant leader who treats every stakeholder with honesty and respect. You approach situations with a positive mindset and seek to create a fun, collaborative, and high-performance culture where you support your teammates Resourceful – Figures out how to drive action and achieve results creatively with finite resources Critical thinker and learner – Picks things up quickly, and asks “why” as opposed to taking “yes” for an answer Unyielding integrity and ethical standards Self-aware, accepting of feedback, open, team player and respectful of others
summary: Vertex Service Partners, a company focused on acquiring and growing residential home improvement services companies, is seeking an Operations Excellence Data Analyst to develop and maintain PriceBooks, drive accurate COGS and pricing, and optimize profitability. This role involves developing estimation tools, maintaining pricing records, managing data sources, supporting procurement analysis, implementing CRM best practices, building sales tools, analyzing data sets, and managing project plans.

title: Program Health Data Analyst
description: Cooper Thomas, LLC seeks HIM professionals for virtual full-time work opportunities supporting our client in Birmingham and Tuscaloosa, AL. As a member of the Healthcare Identity Management (HCIdM) team for a national health care network, you will use investigative methods and automated tools to resolve duplicates and exceptions, as well as perform relevant edits on patient identity fields. You will also work with medical centers, system developers, and business owners to improve the validity of Identity Management (IdM) information, design system enhancements, and implement process improvements to support identity management. We are seeking candidates for immediate employment with the following skills and qualities: Skills Experience in IdM Familiarity with IdM systems Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail Ability to multi-task and see projects to their successful completion Outstanding computer skills Communicating clearly, promptly, and diplomatically Ability to coordinate activities among various individuals, groups, and sites within a large organization Qualities Thrives in a cooperative virtual work environment Works well with others, maintaining a professional and positive attitude Enthusiastic about learning new skills and willing to ask questions in order to learn Treating project team members and clients with respect Sense of discretion in handling sensitive situations and information Comfortable working behind the scenes and taking a support role Flexible and adaptable to different modes of work Experience with large health data sets Applicants Must Have Bachelor’s degree in health information management or a related field RHIA or RHIT (RHIA preferred) Relevant experience in the health care field Cooper Thomas offers a competitive salary and benefits package, and opportunities for advancement. Equal Opportunity Employer and Veterans are encouraged to apply. All applicants are encouraged to go to the Careers page at the company website cooperthomas.com to view a position description, open an online account, and upload a resume and cover letter. Submissions without a cover letter will not be considered.
summary: Cooper Thomas, LLC is seeking a Healthcare Identity Management (HCIdM) professional to work virtually full-time. This role involves resolving duplicates and exceptions, performing edits on patient identity fields, and collaborating with medical centers, system developers, and business owners to improve identity management systems and processes. The ideal candidate will have experience in IdM, excellent organizational skills, strong computer skills, and the ability to communicate clearly and effectively. A bachelor's degree in health information management or a related field and RHIA or RHIT certification (RHIA preferred) are required.

title: Data Analyst - Sr
description: Location: Richmond- Hybrid Duration: ~12 months- possibility to extend Project Overview- Talent Acquisition Strategy and Analytics. Build out the bench strength. At least 2-3 years in DA overall. Scripting in python. Data visualization- PowerBi/Tableau is plus Capital One experience. Nice to have: Python, Scripting, AWS, Snowflake & sheets

Strong communication skills are essential for collaborating with stakeholders.

title: AI Engineer/Data Analyst
description: Immediate need for a talented AI Engineer/Data Analyst . This is a 12+ Months Contract opportunity with long-term potential and is located in Milwaukee, WI (Onsite) . Please review the job description below and contact me ASAP if you are interested. Job ID:24-32411 Pay Range: $50 - $57/hour. Employee benefits include, but are not limited to, health insurance (medical, dental, vision), 401(k) plan, and paid sick leave (depending on work location). Key Responsibilities: Customer onboarding, nominations, and vetting processes Proof of Concept design, lab scheduling, and monitoring of overall governance of AI Studio Provide Studio tours, manage demo showcase, and process improvements Conduct customer satisfaction surveys and share key learnings, run customer engagement reports and project retrospective reports as well as provide Studio summary for customer & logging product bugs with engineering team. Produce innovative solutions for client's clients driven by exploratory data analysis from complex and high-dimensional datasets, both structured and unstructured, applying advanced statistical, machine-learning and AI techniques. Use a flexible, analytical approach to design, develop, and evaluate predictive models and advanced algorithms that lead to optimal value extraction from the data. title: Data Analytics Intern
description: Quanterix is a company that is digitizing biomarker analysis with the goal of advancing the science of precision health. The company’s ultra-sensitive detection solution, Simoa, has the potential to change the way in which healthcare is provided today by giving researchers the ability to closely examine the role of biomarkers in the continuum of health to disease. Quanterix’ technology is designed to enable much earlier disease detection, better prognosis and precise treatment methods to improve the quality of life and longevity of the population for generations to come. The technology is currently being used for research applications in several therapeutic areas, including oncology, neurology, cardiology, inflammation and infectious disease. We are looking for an experienced and highly motivated Intern to join our Assay Development team in Billerica, MA . In this role, this individual will support the verification of automated workflows in Excel by writing and executing test scripts to document the accuracy of these forms. This role will also support activities related to data management and data hygiene. Success in this role will be dependent on ability to engage with multiple stakeholders, understand the business requirements, and maintain an excellent attention to detail. Basic Qualifications Education: Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in life/natural sciences, data science, or a related field. Microsoft Suite: Basic proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint). Communication Skills: Strong technical writing and oral communication skills. Attention to Detail: High attention to detail and a passion for data quality and business analytics. Learning Agility: Fast learner with the ability to quickly adapt to new tools and processes. What We’ll Expect From You: Preferred Qualifications Data Analysis Skills: Basic experience with data analysis tools such as Excel, VBA, Python, R, or other analytical software. Expectations, Skills & Abilities Role requires onsite presence. Why You’ll Like Working For Us Our Technology : Quanterix’ technology is designed to enable much earlier disease detection, better prognoses and enhanced treatment methods to improve the quality of life and longevity of the population for generations to come. The technology is currently being used for research applications in several therapeutic areas. The company was established in 2007 and is in Billerica, Massachusetts. For additional Information, please visit https://www.quanterix.com. Our Commitment to Employees : At Quanterix, we take pride in our employees' incredible work ethic, and we want to reward and recognize that by offering competitive compensation and a 401k plan with an employer match, as well as competitive health, dental, and vision benefits for employees and their dependents. We also offer an unlimited vacation policy to all exempt employees, and a generous PTO policy for non-exempt employees. All employees are awarded Equity, and we have an Employee Stock Purchase Plan, a Performance Bonus, and 1:1 Financial Counseling/Planning. We also offer Tuition Assistance. We have a free, state-of-the-art onsite fitness center for all employees. To keep you fueled up, we provide onsite employees free snacks and drinks every day! Quanterix is committed to a Diverse and Inclusive workplace. Quanterix is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate based on race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. Quanterix will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with known disabilities, in accordance with applicable law.

title: Research Data Analyst
description: Radiology Part Time 79586BR Job Summary Works on research data reporting assignments that are of moderate diversity in scope. Exercises judgment within generally defined practices and policies in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions. The final salary and offer components are subject to additional approvals based on UC policy. Your placement within the salary range is dependent on a number of factors including your work experience and internal equity within this position classification at UCSF. For positions that are represented by a labor union, placement within the salary range will be guided by the rules in the collective bargaining agreement. The salary range for this position is $67,000 - $94,200 (Annual Rate). To learn more about the benefits of working at UCSF, including total compensation, please visit: https://ucnet.universityofcalifornia.edu/compensation-and-benefits/index.html Department Description This position is with the department of Radiology. Our primary clinical research is the study of neurodevelopmental disorders and traumatic brain injury (TBI) using advanced MRI. Our lab’s research has been focused on technical development, neuroscience and clinical applications of advanced imaging methods for mapping structure and function of the human brain, especially diffusion MRI, which is a popular technique for assessing the development and integrity of white matter and for mapping axonal fiber pathways. Required Qualifications Bachelor's degree in related area and / or equivalent experience / training. Minimum of one year of related experience Working knowledge of research function. Working skills in statistical analysis, systems programming, database design and data security measures. Ability to work well with others and act as a team leader. Must feel comfortable directing and overseeing the work of others and providing feedback when necessary. Must have a proven record of successfully working independently with little direction. Ability to follow-through on projects to completion. Demonstrated record of reliability & excellent attendance. Self-motivated with the ability to prioritize multiple projects and meet deadlines. Analytical skills Scientific computation involving basic statistics Excellent communication skills, written and oral Excellent computer skills with Macintosh, Windows, Excel Preferred Qualifications Working skills in analysis and consultation. Skills to communicate complex information in a clear and concise manner both verbally and in writing. Previous experience in a biomedical research laboratory environment and medical imaging Scientific background and/or experience in neuroscientific methodology and/or neuroanatomy. About UCSF The University of California, San Francisco (UCSF) is a leading university dedicated to promoting health worldwide through advanced biomedical research, graduate-level education in the life sciences and health professions, and excellence in patient care. It is the only campus in the 10-campus UC system dedicated exclusively to the health sciences. We bring together the world’s leading experts in nearly every area of health. We are home to five Nobel laureates who have advanced the understanding of cancer, neurodegenerative diseases, aging and stem cells. Pride Values UCSF is a diverse community made of people with many skills and talents. We seek candidates whose work experience or community service has prepared them to contribute to our commitment to professionalism, respect, integrity, diversity and excellence – also known as our PRIDE values. In addition to our PRIDE values, UCSF is committed to equity – both in how we deliver care as well as our workforce. We are committed to building a broadly diverse community, nurturing a culture that is welcoming and supportive, and engaging diverse ideas for the provision of culturally competent education, discovery, and patient care. Additional information about UCSF is available at diversity.ucsf.edu Join us to find a rewarding career contributing to improving healthcare worldwide. Equal Employment Opportunity The University of California San Francisco is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information. title: Law Enforcement Data Analyst
description: Responsibilities Kforce has a client seeking a Law Enforcement Data Analyst in Miami, FL. Key Tasks: Researches, designs, and develops statistical and analytical products from a variety of police and other law enforcement data for purposes of reporting trends and patterns; Data sources include but are not limited to crime, arrest, calls for service, population estimate, and economic data (or any combination thereof) Develops analytical products and models (and supporting documentation) using data science techniques and skills; Analytical products include (but are not limited to): crime trend analyses, repeat offender analysis, projections and forecasts, research papers, policy, and program impact analyses, needs assessment, population studies, and other analyses to support the company's strategic agenda Create tables, charts, and maps utilizing information from multiple databases Uses Geographic Information System (GIS) software to analyze crime trends and develop point, hot spot/density, and other maps for presentations to Command Staff, other members, other government agencies, and the general public As a Law Enforcement Data Analyst, you will keep abreast of national law enforcement policies and new program initiatives; Networks with other agencies and explores other police agency's online documents; Assists in establishing appropriate benchmarks and research evaluation criteria Collaborates with fellow crime analysis team members regularly-works to provide proactive and innovative solutions to complex analytical challenges related to law enforcement, repeat offenders, and crime trends Designs and conducts surveys and program evaluations; Recommends corrections and improvements to newly implemented law enforcement programs based on findings of program evaluations; Identifies new departmental research ideas and makes recommendations, taking a role on developing an approach and analysis to implement these ideas Requirements Bachelor's degree required; Fields of particular interest are Criminal Justice, Economics, Sociology, Public Policy, Statistics, Computer Science, or similar At least two years of experience as a crime or intelligence analyst or skill-equivalent role Excellent written and verbal communication skills and strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills Proficient computer skills, especially Microsoft Office 365 and other analytical and visualization tools The candidate must be a current Florida resident or someone who is willing to relocate; Visa sponsorship is not available for this position The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future. We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave. Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law. This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions. Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: About IMG Academy Named by Sports Business Journal as one of the Best Places to Work in Sports in 2024, IMG Academy is the world's leading sports education brand, providing a holistic education model that empowers student-athletes to win their future, preparing them for college and for life. This position provides data, analysis, insights and recommendations in support of the company's fiercely data-driven decision-making culture in sales, marketing, and financial domains. The Sr. Data Analyst is responsible for partnering cross-functionally across the organization to understand business goals, define questions and methods for answering them. Working close with the data teams, this position makes use of multiple data sources, analysis tools and statistical frameworks to construct analytical outputs, reporting and dashboards in support of daily operations, new initiatives, and the development of sales and marketing strategies. The position serves as an internal thought leader for decision-making around one or more major areas of business focus, serving as subject matter expert for senior management, operational leaders, and the sales and marketing teams. Position Responsibilities Help the Sales Ops. Team cultivate cross-functional partnerships across departments, bringing insights to every corner of our operation as part of a collaborative, collegial learning culture. Provide analytic leadership and guidance to other members of the Sales Ops. team, offering thoughtful and timely coaching and effective feedback. Grow, mentor and manage analytics delivery of other Jr Analysts Partner with leadership in Marketing, Sales, and Operations to solicit analytics business requirements and frame actionable questions. Partner with the data team to perform data processing, querying and analysis to answer business questions and provide actionable insights. Use visualization tools to communicate stories with data, creating reporting, dashboards, KPI monitoring and self-service tools to make data and insights available for stakeholders. Partner with data team to identify and address limitations in data sources, data quality, tooling, or performance bottlenecks in analytics delivery. Be the subject matter expert on the business process and information flows Seek opportunities to perform 'data pioneering' for identifying new opportunities for analysis and insight generation while maintaining focus on reuse and repurposing of frameworks across domains. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Experience and understanding of how modern analytics frameworks are constructed to define questions and answers using applied statistical methods. Strong data process definition and refinement skills, with an instinctive understanding for identifying areas of opportunity or challenge and methods for providing a clear analysis. Ability to construct models for forecasting and tracking business performance in support of sales, marketing, operations, or financial domains. Familiarity with data analysis using R or Python. Expertise composing complex SQL queries for relational databases. Hands-on experience building custom visualizations using Tableau. Experience with modern data warehouse tools like Snowflake, Big Query, or Redshift. Experience leading cross-functionally in situations requiring collaboration, negotiation, and communication of complex analyses to non-technical or senior management audiences. Experience working as a team player with other data scientists and engineers; always looking to make things better and easier for co-workers. Excellent visual, verbal, and textual communication and presentation skills; extremely strong skills for using data to tell stories, especially counter-intuitive or controversial ones. Highly self-motivated, self-directed, resourceful, and autonomous; capable of managing multiple simultaneous deliverables with proactive status updates and requests for support. Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to pinpoint and resolve problematic issues quickly and efficiently. Comfortable working in a fast paced and dynamic environment. Bachelor's or master's degree in a quantitative discipline (Mathematics or Social Science). 5+ years' data analytics experience in a commercial or scientific setting. Experience supporting critical analytics delivery in a fast-paced environment. Experience working across functional, product and engineering teams. Experience using task management and collaboration software such as Jira and Confluence. Experience with distributed version control and software development lifecycle methods. Exposure to Agile Development or the Scrum project management methodology a plus. title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: Are you ready to open a world of opportunity in talent mobility? Our clients include some of the largest and most recognized brands in the world. We help them tap into those opportunities by placing their exceptional people where they need to be, anywhere in the world. When it comes to service, we set the bar for exceptional … and then we raise it with fresh ideas, leading tools and innovative approaches, and it’s all grounded in our values of truth, love, and integrity. If that sounds like you, and if you’re ready for a new career opportunity, we’d like to hear from you! Here’s to the world ahead. The Business Intelligence Analyst must be able to produce in-depth business intelligence solutions for management and our clients. As a member of our Business Intelligence team, this person will be responsible for building dashboards, reports or solutions that convey relevant data and metrics to our clients and help identify organizational needs by collecting and monitoring data points. Work with department managers to create reoccurring dashboards, reports, or other BI solutions that are presented to our internal and external clients. Analyzing business requirements and processes and recommending them to the management and executives for implementation. Create curriculum for training internal and external clients in the use of business intelligence tools to enhance business decision-making capability. The BI Analyst must be able to work on multiple projects concurrently, manage their workload per deadlines and have the flexibility to shift priorities with ease and professionalism. Develops and maintains documentation for data models, and report definitions. Performs other related essential duties as assigned or requested. Required Skills Strong skills building reports/dashboards with Power BI and DAX Strong skills in presentation and data visualization Strong skills in T-SQL or ANSI SQL with ability to read and write queries of varying complexity. Strong Knowledge of relational databases and data modeling Python or R knowledge/experience a plus Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel formulas Proven ability to use data and analytics to solve complex problems. The ability to process, compile, and interpret a wide variety of information into easy to interpret business intelligence solutions. Strong communication skills in order to explain and support their analyses and recommendations in meetings. Required Experience Education: Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field preferred Experience Experience with Power Query/Power BI Dataflows Experience with Azure Databricks a plus. Experience with SSRS, SSAS or Power BI Paginated Reports Experience with Power Automate As a testament to our commitment to diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging, our salary bands are transparent both internally and as a part of our external recruitment process. title: Data Analyst - Data Governance Analyst - MS - MSDH
description: Data Governance Analyst Hybrid About The Job Duration: 12-Month Contract w. possible extension Location: Jackson, MS Pay rate: Hourly Job ID: 132306 Responsibilities Receiving Requests: Receive and log incoming data and public records requests from non-media parties. Ensure requests are properly documented and tracked for timely processing. Legal Review And Redaction Assist in legal review of requested documents to determine necessary redactions to protect sensitive information before release as public records. Ensure compliance with legal requirements and agency policies regarding public records disclosures. Data Retrieval And Compilation Coordinate with relevant departments or personnel to retrieve requested data and compile necessary documents for disclosure. Ensure completeness and accuracy of information provided in response to requests. Response Preparation Prepare responses to data and public records requests in accordance with established timelines and legal requirements. Draft correspondence and documentation ensuring clarity and completeness in responses. Communication And Follow-up Communicate with requesters to clarify requests, provide updates on processing status, and coordinate delivery of requested information. Maintain records of communications and actions taken related to each request. Microsoft Purview Oversight Serve as the primary compliance contact for the implementation and oversight of the agency's Microsoft Purviewapplication. Microsoft Purview is a data governance tool that helps organizations map, manage, and govern their data across various sources. Data types to be brought under Purview oversight and management include: data/files within enterprise Microsoft 365 applications (Outlook, SharePoint, OneDrive, Teams, Exchange, etc.) and other on-premises, multicloud, and software as a service (SaaS) data. Data cover a range of public health subject matters such as: disease surveillance and reporting, environmental health (water supply, wastewater, food protection, etc.), vital records and statistics, and professional and healthcare facility licensure, just to name a few. Key Purview Duties And Responsibilities Include Data Cataloging: Organizing and indexing data assets for easy discovery and understanding. Data Classification: Applying labels and tags to data based on sensitivity and regulatory requirements. Data Lineage: Tracking the origins, movements, and transformations of data throughout its lifecycle. Data Insights: Providing analytical capabilities to derive insights and enhance decision-making. Data Compliance: Ensuring data usage complies with regulatory standards and internal policies. Policy Development And Compliance Collaborate with the Director of Data Governance to develop and revise policies, Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), and guidelines related to data management and governance. Ensure that policies align with federal and state data laws, regulations, and organizational objectives. Monitor and interpret federal and state data protection laws, regulations (such as HIPAA), and industry standards. Develop training materials and conduct sessions to educate agency staff on data governance policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements. Foster a culture of compliance and data stewardship across the organization. Data Management And Systems Development Collaborate with the Director of Data Governance in developing and designing data management applications and systems. Aim to improve the agency's data capabilities for public health purposes. Provide general support to the agency in its projects funded under the CDC Public Health Infrastructure Grant (PHIG), specifically under Strategy A3: Data Modernization. Projects include: Cataloging and organization of agency data resources with the ultimate goal of creating a public facing agency-wide data catalog, Assisting with the selection and implementation of an updated process for managing external requests for data and public records Supporting the creation and implementation of project timelines Consistent and effective communication with agency staff supporting the projects, and maintaining focus on project goals and meeting deadlines Assist with the collecting, organizing and leveraging large amounts of data across multiple subject matters to enable more accessible utilization and analysis of the data using data lakes, warehouses, lakehouses, catalogs, etc. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree Proficiency in Microsoft 365 applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, Teams) and Adobe About Our Company DataSoft Technologies is a highly recognized provider of professional IT Consulting services in the US. Founded in 1994, DataSoft Technologies, Inc. provides staff augmentation services for Information Technology and Automotive Services.
