title: Business Intelligence Analyst II
description: Description As we expand the breadth of our data footprint across the company, Payscale is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst, reporting to the Manager, Business Intelligence, supporting the Go-To-Market organization. As a member of the GTM Revenue Operations function, you will work with cross-functional teams to organize and shape data, surface insights, and recommend actions that will drive business decisions. While this role will support all GTM teams, the primary stakeholders will be leaders within the Marketing org including Corporate Marketing, Product Marketing, and Growth Marketing (Demand Generation) functions. You will play an instrumental role in supporting teams that ensure we are generating quality pipeline for Payscale products and services in the most efficient and cost-effective way. The ideal candidate understands the SaaS business model and typical customer journey, has experience and comfort with managing imperfect and/or unorganized data, and has the technical and business skill to curate scorecards and stories which help us understand trends in the business. This role will partner with the broader Business Intelligence team to further democratize and scale our use of data, including enabling stakeholders and end-users to use data more effectively in day-to-day interactions with reps. This is a first of its kind BI role and you will have the autonomy and empowerment to evolve the data landscape within Marketing, transforming the effectiveness and efficiency with which we generate demand for our products and services and build out the Payscale brand. Key Responsibilities Support the GTM organization (~80% of time allocated to the Marketing org) by empowering decision making through data mining, reporting, insights, and storytelling Serve as a business analyst to understand, document, and bring to life data requirements from key stakeholders such as our Sr. Director, Revenue Generation and other members of the Marketing leadership team Lead the creation of dashboards and scorecards that provide insight into Marketing programs, events, and initiatives impacting the sales funnel including but not limited to campaign performance, website and other channel optimization, A/B test performance, etc. Partner with Sales leadership and RevOps to assess market performance and penetration and recommend / support initiatives that increase lead conversion and, ultimately, market share Play a secondary role in supporting the Sales, Customer Experience, and Customer Success orgs with day-to-day data needs Use tools such as Marketo, Google Analytics (GA4), Tableau, Excel, and Salesforce to troubleshoot and reconcile data, conduct analysis, and release reports and dashboards to key stakeholders that answer key business questions and challenge suboptimal processes Build and maintain user friendly documentation around reporting use cases, criteria, potential pitfalls, etc. Enable stakeholders and peers to understand and effectively use data at scale Support business-wide data governance and data integrity across platforms Conduct ad hoc analysis to support stakeholder business questions Qualifications 2+ years of experience in Business Intelligence, data analysis, or similar role 2+ years of experience supporting a Go-To-Market function, ideally at a B2B SaaS company General understanding of SQL, data manipulation, data warehouses, and version control systems such as Git An understanding or willingness to learn key SaaS metrics, especially those relevant to Marketing teams and roles such as Sales Development Representatives (SDRs) Experience with a CRM (Salesforce preferred) and a Marketing automation platform (Marketo preferred), including creating, maintaining, and scaling enterprise-level reports and dashboards Experience with Google Analytics (GA4) and data visualization tools (Tableau preferred) Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, with an ability to collaboratively develop solutions with multiple functional teams in a matrixed organization Ability to effectively prioritize, project manage, and stay organized with a tool like Asana Strong written and verbal communication skills with experience in storytelling and consulting both technical and non-technical stakeholders on data best practices Willingness to share ideas, be a thought leader, and support other members of the team to uplevel their skills Compensation In the spirit of pay transparency, we are excited to share the base salary range for this position is $73,600 - $110,400, exclusive of fringe benefits or potential bonuses. This position is also eligible for an annual corporate bonus of 10%. If you are hired at Payscale, your final base salary compensation will be determined based on factors such as skills, education, and/or experience. In addition to those factors – we believe in the importance of pay equity and consider any internal equity of our current team members as a part of any final offer. Please keep in mind that the range mentioned above is the full base salary range for the role. Hiring at the maximum of the range would not be typical in order to allow for future & continued salary growth. We also offer a generous compensation and benefits package (more information on benefits listed below). Company Description Payscale gives employers and employees confidence to know the what and why behind pay. With our leading data, technology, and experience we make it easier for you to connect compensation to goals. As the industry leader in compensation management, Payscale is on a mission to help job seekers, employees, and businesses get pay right and to make sustainable fair pay a reality. Empowering more than 50 percent of the Fortune 500 in 198 countries, Payscale provides a combination of diverse and dynamic data sources, experienced compensation services, and scalable software to enable organizations such as Angel City Football Club, Target, United Healthcare, Gainsight, eBay, and The Washington Post to make fair and appropriate pay decisions. To learn more, visit www.payscale.com Location Payscale has an employee centric remote-first model that provides you the flexibility to do your best work in a space that supports you, while also finding time to collaborate in person for the moments that matter. In our remote-first model, employees can work from the location that works best for them. We do not have centralized corporate offices.Employees can choose to work from home, in company-paid co-working spaces, or any combination of the two that best suits their unique needs. When it matters (usually no more than a few times a year) we take the time to gather for in-person events. Payscale has employees across the US, Canada, and the UK, however we are currently unable to hire in the Quebec Province, Northern Ireland, and Hawaii. Benefits And Perks All around awesome culture where together we strive to live our 5 values: Respect every individual, work as a team Be Customer first, customer centric Have a Bias towards action Commit to excellence (we give our best everyday) Make Data driven decisions An open and inclusive environment where you’ll learn and grow through programs and resources like: Monthly company All Hands meetings Regular opportunities for executive leadership exposure through things like AMAs Access to continued learning & development opportunities Our commitment to a continuous feedback culture which allows us to drive performance and career growth A growing network of Employee Resource Groups Company sponsored volunteer hours And more! Our More Standard Benefits Flex Paid Time Off, giving you flexibility to rest, relax and recharge away from work 15 Paid Company Holidays, including an extended Fourth of July break, World Mental Health Day, and Juneteenth A comprehensive benefits plan including medical, dental, life, vision, disability, and life insurance covered up to 100% by Payscale 401(k) retirement program with a fully vested immediate company match 12 weeks of paid parental leave for birthing or non-birthing parents Unlimited infertility coverage benefits through our medical plans Health Savings Account (HSA) options and company contribution each pay period Flexible Spending Account (FSA) options for pre-tax employee allocations Equal Opportunity Employer: We embrace equal employment opportunity. Payscale is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. It is our policy that employees will not be subjected to unlawful discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, or ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran or military status, marital status, sexual orientation, political ideology, and any other basis protected by federal, state, or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including but not limited to: recruitment, hiring, transfers, promotions, training, discipline, termination, compensation and benefits, performance appraisals, education, and social and recreational programs. Fraud Alert: Payscale values security and privacy. During your job application and interview process, we will never ask for your personal banking or financial information, social security number, or other sensitive information, if you are unsure if a message is from Payscale, please email [email protected]
summary: Payscale is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst to support the Go-To-Market organization, specifically focusing on Marketing and Revenue Generation. This role involves data analysis, reporting, and insights to drive business decisions. Responsibilities include creating dashboards, scorecards, and reports to analyze marketing programs, website optimization, and A/B testing. The ideal candidate has experience with SaaS business models, data management, and data visualization tools.  This is a remote-first position with flexible work arrangements.

title: SQL Developer
description: Role : SQL Developer Duration : 6 months Contract (Onsite) C2C Location: Auburn ,PA The ideal candidate will have extensive expertise in working with MSSQL databases, SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services), and SQL Agents. This role requires a self-motivated and independent individual capable of managing complex projects and collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams. Education and Experience: • Bachelor's or higher degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field. • 5+ years of relevant experience in back-end software development and data engineering. Additional Skills and Qualifications: • Strong SQL Proficiency: Expertise in writing complex SQL queries, stored procedures, and optimization techniques. • Data Modelling: Proficiency in data modelling and database design principles. • ETL Design: Experience in designing and implementing efficient ETL processes for data integration and transformation. • Version Control: Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) for code management and collaboration. • Self-Management: Ability to work independently and manage projects with minimal supervision. • Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills for documenting processes and collaborating with team members. Key Responsibilities: 1. Batch Processing Data Pipelines: Design, develop, and maintain robust batch processing data pipelines for handling large volumes of data efficiently. 2. MSSQL Database Management: Manage and optimize MSSQL databases for performance, scalability, and reliability. 3. SSIS Integration: Develop, deploy, and maintain ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes using SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) for data integration and transformation. 5. Data Quality Assurance: Proficiency in implementing data quality checks, data validation processes, and data cleansing techniques to maintain high data integrity and accuracy throughout the data pipelines and databases. 6. Performance Tuning: Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks in data pipelines and databases to ensure optimal system performance. 7. Documentation: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for data pipelines, database schemas, and integration processes. 8. Monitoring and Troubleshooting: Set up monitoring tools and processes to proactively identify and address issues in data pipelines and databases.
summary: This role requires a SQL Developer with extensive experience in MSSQL databases, SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services), and SQL Agents to design, develop, and maintain data pipelines, optimize databases, and ensure data quality. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of SQL, data modelling, and ETL processes, as well as experience with version control and communication.

title: Senior Analyst, Market Analytics - ERCOT
description: National Grid Renewables is a full-service renewable energy company headquartered in Minneapolis, Minnesota. National Grid Renewables has developed over 2,400 megawatts of wind and solar projects that are either operational or currently under construction throughout the United States. National Grid Renewables has a multi-gigawatt development pipeline of wind and solar projects in various stages of development throughout the United States. National Grid Renewables provides custom solutions for utilities and corporations looking to harness renewable energy for business growth. With deep roots in agriculture, National Grid Renewables prides itself on developing renewable energy projects that are farmer-friendly, community-driven, and beneficial for rural communities. Job Purpose The Strategy & Technology team drives the strategic direction of National Grid Renewables. The clean energy transition is occurring at a rapid pace and the Strategy & Technology team leads the effort to develop new commercial structures and business models. The Senior Analyst will provide insight and expert analysis of US electricity markets to support project development, origination, and strategic decision making. Key Accountabilities Lead nodal modeling & analysis of specified US electricity markets to support investment decisions, business planning, strategic planning & new business opportunities; Manage, maintain & continuously improve in-house electricity market models and databases ensuring they are fit for purpose; Articulate & explain market model inputs/outputs to stakeholders in project development, origination, corporate affairs & commercial operations with market analysis, modeling & assessments of market impacts; Monitor market developments and provide analysis of critical changes; Track key regulatory changes within specific markets through research and attending conferences and ISO meetings. Become a leading electricity market expert internally and externally. Qualifications Bachelor’s in Electrical Engineering Mathematics or related quantitative field (power system emphasis desired). High level of quantitative & analytical skills with 5+ of relevant work experience providing quantitative analysis, electricity market modeling, consulting and/or energy trading Advanced Excel skills, and Python, VBA, SQL, or other programming skills; Broad knowledge of US power industry structures, policies, regulations & market fundamentals; Familiarity with recent trends in conventional generation, renewables, gas, energy storage, transmission & distributed generation; Strong understanding of transmission system and power flow fundamentals and LMP formation Ability to translate model outputs into business insight & articulate impact of results on the business; Experience in developing & employing market and/or financial models, as well as with commercial production cost modeling software: ProMOD, PLEXOS, Aurora, Gridview, GE MAPS, PSO, Dayzer, etc. Familiarity with linear algebra, linear programming & optimization theory; Specific experience analyzing the ERCOT market is strongly desired Location Preferred location is in the Houston, Austin, Minneapolis or Boston areas. National Grid Renewables believe fostering diversity, equity and inclusion is everyone’s responsibility. Open, honest and respectful ways of working, learning and communicating are the cornerstones of a successful business, and leveraging inclusion and diversity lead to better business results. At National Grid Renewables, we’re focused on creating a work environment where our people feel respected and included, and therefore empowered to be themselves.
summary: National Grid Renewables is seeking a Senior Analyst to join their Strategy & Technology team. This role will focus on providing expertise and analysis of US electricity markets to support investment decisions, project development, and strategic planning. Responsibilities include leading nodal modeling, managing in-house electricity market models, and staying current on market trends and regulations.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: The Senior Data Analyst serves as a key resource for business intelligence, performance and operational analysisfor Central Health. Under general direction of the Central Health's Analytics Quality Manager, the Senior Data Analyst is responsible for organizing, analyzing and reporting on data from large clinical, financial, and enrollment datasets. They will also assist in the design and development of data warehouses, performance dashboards and other systems that support the needs of an integrated network of physicians, safety net providers and hospitals to advance care that is patient centered and data driven. This analyst will act as an Epic subject matter expert for front/back-end Epic reporting development. Hybrid = Individuals in this position may work both at an approved off-site location and onsite at a primary location or multiple locations based on business needs. Collect and document business requirements for reporting and analysis initiatives with customers, which includes gathering, formatting and analyzing clinical, claims, eligibility, financial and other data from various sources to develop reports and dashboards. Serve as an Analytics and Reporting lead on assigned projects. Perform quantitative and/or qualitative data analysis and prepare results to share with internal and external customers. Aid in design and development of data warehouse/data mart applications. Create and maintain reports and dashboards for multiple stakeholders including clinical, operations, finance, planning, strategy, reimbursement and other Central Health teams. Collaborate with IT (Joint Technologies) when necessary to automate reporting and to troubleshoot data issues. Utilize SQL or other advanced analytic tools to perform data extract, integration and query functions. Identify and troubleshoot data anomalies and irregularities. Work closely with Epic Business Intelligence Director to identify potential solutions for various reporting needs. Builds SlicerDicer and Reporting Workbench reports and completes Epic Radar setup for custom SQL metrics. Prepare written and oral reports that communicate necessary information to internal and external customers. Produce and streamline as needed ongoing monthly, quarterly and annual reports in support of CentralHealth. Become a data subject matter expert (SME) and understand various sources and applications of Central Health data. MINIMUM EDUCATION High School Diploma or equivalent with an additional 5 years' experience in a related field (healthcare, statistics, experimental research, data science, economics or public health) will be considered in lieu of degree / Bachelor's Degree Management Information Systems, Finance, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering or related quantitative discipline. PREFERRED EDUCATION Master's Degree Master’s degree in Management Information Systems, Finance, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering or related quantitative discipline. MINIMUM EXPERIENCE 3 years of experience in healthcare, statistics, experimental research, data science, reporting and analytics, economics, or public health. 3 years experience in SQL (preferably T-SQL) or Python scripting with an advanced level of expertise. 3 years experience with MS Excel with an advanced level of expertise. 2 years experience in Tableau or other data visualization tool 2 years experience in report development within Epic EMR using Slicer/ Dicer, RWB, Clarity or Caboodle. PREFERRED EXPERIENCE REQUIRED CERTIFICATIONS/LICENSURE Epic Cogito Certification within 6 Months
summary: A Senior Data Analyst is needed for Central Health to perform data analysis, reporting, and dashboard development. They will work with large clinical, financial, and enrollment datasets and act as an Epic subject matter expert.  The role requires strong analytical skills, experience with SQL and other data tools, and knowledge of healthcare data.

company: Oil and Gas Job Search Ltd
title: Data Analyst - Business Development
description: Our Team The Bilfinger group of companies enhances the efficiency of assets, ensures a high level of availability, and reduces maintenance costs for its clients. Its portfolio covers the entire value chain from consulting, engineering, manufacturing, assembly, maintenance, plant expansion, as well as turnarounds. Bilfinger Inc is a leading provider of complex and comprehensive industrial services specializing in chemicals, manufacturing, assembly, and construction. With over 80 years of experience, on a multitude of projects across multiple markets, we excel at making the impossible possible. Driven by integrity and a long-standing culture of performance excellence, Bilfinger doesn't just build structures - we build relationships. Our professionals share a common goal; to keep promises, honor commitments and exceed client expectations. Our performance is what has helped, and continues to help forge strong partnerships, which are strengthened over time. Bilfinger provides employees with training and opportunities, both internally and externally, to further develop in their role and prepare them for elevated roles. The Role The Data Analyst - Business Development role is responsible for analyzing and interpreting data from Salesforce dashboards and analytics to drive strategic decisions and initiatives within our business development efforts. The role also includes collaborating closely with cross-functional teams to extract actionable insights that enhance sales performance, optimize processes, and improve overall business outcomes. Duties And Responsibilities Analyze Salesforce dashboards and analytics to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for business development. Interpret complex data sets to extract meaningful insights and present findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner. Develop reports and visualizations using tools that effectively communicate key metrics and performance indicators. Utilize systems for data extraction, manipulation, and analysis to support business development initiatives. Collaborate with business development teams to understand their data needs and provide analytical support. Proactively identify areas for process improvement and optimization based on data analysis. Assist in the design and implementation of data-driven strategies to drive sales growth and market expansion. Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in data analysis and business intelligence. Performs other related duties as required and assigned. Requirements Minimum 3 years' experience as a Data analyst or in a similar role, preferably in business development or sales operations. Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role, preferably in business development or sales operations. Willingness to work both independently and as a team to meet quick deadlines and objectives. Technical Knowledge And Skills Working knowledge of construction and maintenance services provided in the oil and gas, and/or chemical industry. Strong proficiency in Salesforce dashboards and analytics tools Working experience using SAP, Salesforce, Power BI and IIR Strong proficiency in data extraction, manipulation, and analysis. Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word, and Power Point Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, or a related field. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail. Excellent verbal and written communication and listening skills required. Self-starter, strong interpersonal communication skills with all levels of colleagues, comfortable working with executive management. Please reach out to Michelle Reynolds,  michelle.reynolds@bilfinger.com  in case of any questions related to this position. Bilfinger Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer - M/F/Veterans/Disabled. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or other legally protected characteristics. This employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. If E-Verify cannot confirm that you are authorized to work, this employer is required to give you written instructions and an opportunity to contact Department of Homeland Security (DHS) or Social Security Administration (SSA) so you can begin to resolve the issue before the employer can take any action against you, including terminating your employment. Employers can only use E-Verify once you have accepted a job offer and completed the Form I-9. Fraudulent employment offers - We are aware that fraudulent employment offers are being transmitted via email by people claiming to be employees or representatives of Bilfinger. Prospective candidates are provided job descriptions and employment letters and are asked to complete and return employment information forms as well as official tax forms. These job offers may look genuine and could include names of Bilfinger legal entities, Bilfinger executives, their signatures, seals of "authenticity", the Bilfinger brand and logo. Please be advised that these communications are FRAUDULENT and are NOT sent from anyone within or affiliated with Bilfinger. These email messages are a scam and should be treated as such. Bilfinger does not make job offers via social media, unsolicited email or without personally interviewing candidates first. We never send you cheques in order to pay contractors to set up a home office. Never send money or pass on personal details to anyone suggesting they can provide employment with Bilfinger, and never reply to an email address that does not end in @bilfinger.com. If you receive such a message, you are advised to contact your local law enforcement agency and provide any details you may have. You also may forward the messages to  compliance.helpdesk@bilfinger.com  . If you are interested in an employment with Bilfinger, please submit your application in the safe environment of our  global job portal  only.
summary: Bilfinger Inc. is seeking a Data Analyst - Business Development to analyze Salesforce data and drive strategic decisions. The role involves collaborating with cross-functional teams, extracting actionable insights, enhancing sales performance, optimizing processes, and improving business outcomes.  Key responsibilities include analyzing data, interpreting findings, developing reports and visualizations, utilizing data extraction and analysis tools, collaborating with business development teams, identifying process improvements, and assisting with data-driven strategies for sales growth and market expansion.

title: Analyst - Decision Analytics
description: Job Summary Responsible for creating solutions for business problems using data mining and analytics. Leverage innovative analytical techniques to uncover patterns and trends in data. Utilize data visualizations to socialize actionable and implementable insights with business partners, including marketing, sales and supply chain. Major Tasks, Responsibilities, And Key Accountabilities Collaborates with internal and external stakeholders to manage data logistics, including data transfers, data structures, and business rules to enable project execution. Utilizes data modeling/analysis techniques to mine systems and applications for knowledge and information that supports the enhancement of business processes. Builds, deploys, and maintains data support tools, metadata inventories and definitions for database file/table creation. Provides analytical solutions to business problems Reviews quality assurance/quality control data and project output for accuracy. Creates compelling presentations that provide actionable insights and recommendations. Participates in reporting presentations to key internal and external stakeholders. Communicates key findings and recommendations. Manages multiple projects concurrently and prioritizes and monitors project timelines and scopes. Nature and Scope Demonstrates skill in data analysis techniques by resolving missing/incomplete information and inconsistencies/anomalies in more complex research/data. Nature of work requires increasing independence; receives guidance only on unusual, complex problems or issues. Work review typically involves periodic review of output by a supervisor and/or direct customers of the process. May provide general guidance/direction to or train junior level support or professional personnel. Work Environment Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable. Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles. Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time. Education And Experience Typically requires BS/BA in a related discipline. Generally 2-5 years of experience in a related field OR MS/MA and generally 2-4 years of experience in a related field. Certification is required in some areas. Our Goals for Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion We are committed to creating a culture that promotes equity, respect, and advocacy for every HD Supply associate. We value the diversity of our people. Equal Employment Opportunity HD Supply is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.
summary: This role involves using data mining and analytics to solve business problems. You will uncover patterns and trends in data, create compelling visualizations, and communicate actionable insights to various stakeholders.

title: Sustainability Data Analyst
description: Do you love data? Are spreadsheets your BFFs? If you have experience in data analytics and enjoy cleaning up and analyzing data sets, this opportunity is for you! About City Of Durham Sustainability and Energy Management (SEM) works to expand the City’s use of renewable energy, reduce greenhouse gas emissions, and improve the City’s resilience to the effects of climate change. SEM will lead implementation of the City’s Carbon Neutrality and Renewable Energy Action Plan unanimously approved by City Council in late 2021. Position Overview & Description The City of Durham is committed to doing its part to address the global climate crisis by decarbonizing City facilities and operations and creating innovation carbon reduction strategies in our community. In 2021, Durham was one of the first cities to commit to ambitious carbon neutrality and renewable energy goals through the Carbon Neutrality and Renewable Energy Action Plan (CNRE). The City’s CNRE Action Plan has four main strategies: Maximize energy efficiency in City buildings and operations Expand renewable energy generation and procurement Transition away from fossil fuels in City fleet and buildings Establish innovative carbon reduction strategies and community partnerships The SEI Climate Corps Fellow will play a key role in creating the systems and processes needed to make data-driven decisions to power this positive change. This role will be responsible for gathering, cleaning, and analyzing vast amounts of City energy data and then creating compelling reports and data visualizations to guide decision-making by identifying anticipated benefits, consequences and impacts of alternative system options. In other words, when we are asked to report progress towards our Carbon Neutrality goals, the Data Analyst will help us provide real answers and point us to opportunities to advance these goals even further. This is a hybid role with 3 days remote and 2 days in office. Responsibilities Quantify and communicate high-level performance indicators, such as total greenhouse gas emissions, renewable energy generation, fleet fossil fuel use, building energy use, and cost savings Data collection from various software tools and sub-metering data analysis for end-use accounting, energy, and water cost analysis Assist in the design and implementation of policies, plans and procedures for continuous monitoring of energy and water performance Report the energy/water performance/savings from energy conservation measures for new and existing facilities Create and maintain energy benchmarking database for a portfolio of buildings Deliver insights through data tables, charts, graphs, reports and presentations Responsible for evaluating the value and impact of various on-site renewable energy assets such as PV solar arrays, battery storage, micro-grids, and efficiency Analyze business case for transition to electric vehicles using a total cost of ownership model Complete City of Durham greenhouse gas inventory using ICLEI Monitor hourly energy profiles to identify problems with system operation and opportunities for reducing off-hour usage Desired Qualifications Some experience in Data Analysis (using Excel, Python or R) is required Interest or experience in clean energy technology, building science, energy efficiency, solar and EV Charging Data visualization Business and financial modeling Business case development Excellent written and oral communication skills Outstanding interpersonal skills Practical knowledge of carbon reduction implementation, application of data analysis and visualization Experience with energy and greenhouse gas inventories is a plus We encourage anyone who is interested in this position and who meets some of the qualifications to apply, even if they do not meet all of them. We recognize that a unique perspective and background can enhance a role when many, if not all, of the listed qualifications are met. If you would need to relocate for this position, please note that you need to be in the state you are relocating to no less than 10 business days before the start of the fellowship.** Benefits End-of-program financial award . Healthcare coverage with 100% of healthcare insurance premiums covered by the employer. Access to a national Member Assistance Program, which includes financial and legal assistance, medical advocacy, and counseling services. Professional and Personal Development Training Career-readiness training in interview preparation, salary negotiation, and developing a professional resume and cover letter. Attending panels, workshops, and presentations by climate resilience industry professionals. Professional networking opportunities. About Climate Corps Climate Corps, a program of SEI, is an award-winning fellowship program that provides professional development opportunities for emerging leaders through the implementation of sustainability and resiliency projects with local governments, nonprofits, and for-profit businesses. To see a full list of climate, energy, and sustainability positions posted by Climate Corps, please visit here: https://jobs.climatecorps.org/listings. We are constantly adding positions, so make sure to frequently check this site to see if there are new opportunities available. SEI is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to promoting diversity, inclusion, and equity. We believe that a wide array of perspectives contributes to creative climate solutions where all communities thrive. We strive to reflect diverse communities, especially those most impacted by climate change and other kinds of environmental, social, and economic injustices. Persons of color, persons with disabilities, and members of the LGBTQ community are strongly encouraged to apply. A commitment to work and learn within an anti-oppression framework is required. https://www.seiinc.org/dei.html
summary: The City of Durham is seeking a Data Analyst Fellow to support the implementation of its Carbon Neutrality and Renewable Energy Action Plan. The role involves gathering, cleaning, analyzing City energy data, creating reports and visualizations, and evaluating the value of renewable energy assets. This hybrid role requires experience in data analysis using Excel, Python, or R, interest in clean energy technology, and strong communication and interpersonal skills.

title: Data Analyst/ Data Engineer
description: Job Title: Data Analyst/ Data Engineer Location: Warren, NJ (1 days a week) Duration: Long Term ( W2 only) Experience level : 10+ yrs Data Engineer Specializing in ADF (Azure Data Factory), Databricks, Spark SQL, and Dashboard Development We are currently seeking a skilled Data Analyst with proficiency in Azure Data Factory (ADF), Databricks, Spark SQL, and dashboard creation. This role involves: Data Analysis with ADF and Databricks: Utilizing Azure Data Factory and Databricks for comprehensive data analysis. This includes extracting, transforming, and loading data (ETL) processes, and managing data workflows. Expertise in Spark SQL: Leveraging Spark SQL for querying and analysing large datasets within Databricks environments. The candidate should possess the ability to write efficient, complex SQL queries. Data Mapping Creation: Developing detailed data mappings to assist in the integration and transformation of data from various sources into structured formats for analysis. Dashboard Development: Designing and building intuitive, informative dashboards that effectively communicate data insights. Experience with tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Databricks' native visualization capabilities is preferred. Data Quality and Integrity: Ensuring the accuracy and consistency of data throughout the data processing lifecycle, from extraction to visualization. Collaborative Project Involvement: Working collaboratively with cross-functional teams, including data engineers and business stakeholders, to understand requirements and deliver data-driven solutions. Data-Driven Decision Making: Assisting in the interpretation of data and providing insights that support business decision-making. Continuous Learning and Improvement: Staying updated with the latest trends and advancements in data analytics, ADF, Databricks, and Spark SQL to continuously improve processes and implementations. Technical Documentation: Creating clear and comprehensive documentation regarding data processes, mappings, and dashboard functionalities. Problem-Solving Skills: Utilizing strong analytical and problem-solving skills to address challenges in data analysis and dashboard development. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, with a demonstrated ability to handle large datasets and build effective visualizations. They should be comfortable working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and possess excellent communication skills to articulate complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Thanks & Regards Anoop Tiwari Extend Information Systems Cell: - 571 - 386 - 2431 Email: Anoop@extendinfosys.com
summary: Data Analyst/Data Engineer with 10+ years of experience specializing in Azure Data Factory (ADF), Databricks, Spark SQL, and dashboard development. title: Data Analyst III
description: Work Schedule Standard (Mon-Fri) Environmental Conditions Office Join our colleagues in bringing our mission to life every single day, enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner, and safer. Our Fisher Healthcare business serves the lab diagnostics industry through its strong brands and commercial footprints over several years. We are at the forefront of growing our business and presence across the care continuum and the diagnostics space. We are seeking a well-rounded leader who can drive the market development effort strategically. As a member of the Healthcare Marketing & Portfolio team, the Commercial & Portfolio Management Digital Analyst will drive operational agility and functional excellence. They will do this by aligning commercial, market development & portfolio objectives with our business strategy in mind. This includes integration of customer data from salesforce, our portfolio offering, performance data, competitive intelligence to generate business insights, and advise strategy among other things. This person must lead projects from implementation through hypercare. This person will have ownership in governance and management of our annual pricing strategy through analytics and insights. They will lead projects and build relevant relationships with internal and external collaborators, and further a culture that encourages innovation and agility. They will demonstrate good communication and collaboration with multi-functional partners. This includes implementing portfolio, market development, and commercial projects and drive alignment on launch activities. They will establish processes and handle demand management across commercial team. The candidate will lead plans for analytics capabilities within the business with a clear roadmap of data, insights, and recommendations. Job Requirements: Education: Bachelor's degree or equivalent preferred with niche training in digital analytics. Experience: 5+ years of relevant data, portfolio, supply chain, and digital experience. Proven understanding of digital programs including but not limited to the suite of Adobe platforms, Generative AI, Power BI, SQL, data ingestion and transformation solutions, Saleforce.com, or other enterprise CRMs, to name a few. Skills/Abilities: Analytical and data skills along with proven coordinate, analyze, and transform data into meaningful and actionable initiatives supporting business growth. Strong strategic project management skills, with the ability to coordinate and communicate sophisticated data. Familiarity with Agile methodology, and Six Sigma will be an advantage. Strategic and growth mindset. Outstanding customer first mentality. Innovative problem solver who is willing to challenge the status quo. Superb communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills. Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.
summary: A Commercial & Portfolio Management Digital Analyst is needed to drive operational agility and functional excellence for the Fisher Healthcare business. The role will focus on market development, aligning commercial, market development, and portfolio objectives with business strategy. This includes integrating customer data, portfolio offerings, performance data, and competitive intelligence to generate insights and advise strategy. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical and data skills, experience with digital programs like Adobe platforms, Generative AI, Power BI, SQL, Salesforce.com, and other enterprise CRMs, and strong project management skills.

title: Data Standard Analyst - Biostatistics Team
description: Our corporate activities are growing rapidly, and we are currently seeking a full-time, office-based Data Standard Analyst to join our Biostatistics team. This position will work on a team to accomplish tasks and projects that are instrumental to the company’s success. If you want an exciting career where you use your previous expertise and can develop and grow your career even further, then this is the opportunity for you. Responsibilities Implement edit check specifications via SAS programming to assist with reconciliation of data discrepancies; Create annotated CRFs and mapping specifications per CDISC SDTM standards; Create SDTM data via SAS programming by implementing data standards for collected study level source data; Perform validation of CDISC SDTM data in accordance with SOPs and guidance documents; Ensure SDTM data conforms to the data standards expected by regulatory agencies; Assist with creation of the define package for submission to regulatory agencies; Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Math, Statistics, Life Sciences, or equivalent SAS programming knowledge preferred TRAVEL: None Medpace Overview Medpace is a full-service clinical contract research organization (CRO). We provide Phase I-IV clinical development services to the biotechnology, pharmaceutical and medical device industries. Our mission is to accelerate the global development of safe and effective medical therapeutics through its scientific and disciplined approach. We leverage local regulatory and therapeutic expertise across all major areas including oncology, cardiology, metabolic disease, endocrinology, central nervous system, anti-viral and anti-infective. Headquartered in Cincinnati, Ohio, employing more than 5,000 people across 40+ countries. Why Medpace? People. Purpose. Passion. Make a Difference Tomorrow. Join Us Today. The work we’ve done over the past 30+ years has positively impacted the lives of countless patients and families who face hundreds of diseases across all key therapeutic areas. The work we do today will improve the lives of people living with illness and disease in the future. Cincinnati Perks Cincinnati Campus Overview Hybrid work-from-home options (dependent upon position and level) Competitive PTO packages, starting at 20+ days Competitive compensation and benefits package Flexible work schedule Company-sponsored employee appreciation events Employee health and wellness initiatives Community involvement with local nonprofit organizations Discounts on local sports games, fitness gyms and attractions Modern, ecofriendly campus with an on-site fitness center Structured career paths with opportunities for professional growth Discounted tuition for UC online programs Awards Named a Top Workplace in 2024 by The Cincinnati Enquirer Recognized by Forbes as one of America's Most Successful Midsize Companies in 2021, 2022, 2023 and 2024 Continually recognized with CRO Leadership Awards from Life Science Leader magazine based on expertise, quality, capabilities, reliability, and compatibility What To Expect Next A Medpace team member will review your qualifications and, if interested, you will be contacted with details for next steps. EO/AA Employer M/F/Disability/Vets

title: Data Analyst, Port Services
description: Journey with us! Combine your career goals and sense of adventure by joining our exciting team of employees. Royal Caribbean Group is pleased to offer a competitive compensation & benefits package, and excellent career development opportunities, each offering unique ways to explore the world. NOTE: This is a full-time in-person role based in the company’s headquarters in Miami, FL. Applicants must be available to work in Miami– Thursday, with work from home on Friday. Position Summary This position will support the Port Vetting and Data Analytics efforts within Port Services and will be responsible for the design, development, and implementation of database, workflow automation, and reporting tools. This person will work closely with internal organizations within RCG such as Deployment, Marine Operations, and Guest Port Services in order to maintain accurate and accountable databases, support our analytics initiatives, and develop and maintain holistic reports and correspondence. Responsibilities Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Support tracking and establishing standardized operational metrics and data driven performance monitoring by using predictive and descriptive analytics for port related operational performance trends, gaps, and potential opportunities. This includes looking at guest flows, guest ratings, ship maneuvers, terminal performance, operational costs, and efficiency as it relates to total cost of operations. Participate in the design and maintenance of a port/berth information database to centralize and socialize with the larger corporation relevant port information including but not limited to: berth specifications and capacities, terminal specifications, services available, booking policies, and any other port intelligence for efficient decision making for the brand Deployment and Itinerary planning. Support development and implementation of Port Services systems, reporting, and user tools. Drive efficiency improvements and technical improvements to our systems and data analytics program. Lead initiatives, determining user requirements and business needs to develop new reporting, while incorporating understanding of the business and our current systems. Responsible for working cross-functionally to identify opportunities to drive and improve processes, presenting findings to Management. Perform industry and financial/ business research analysis as needed. Be willing to actively participate in professional organizations and conferences related to port operations and development. Remain current with industry trends, especially as related to ports and port services. Performs other duties as required. This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee occupying this position. Employees will be required to perform any other job-related duties assigned by their supervisor or management. Qualifications, Knowledge & Skills Bachelor’s Degree in business, data management, or other related fields; 1 to 2 years of business analytics experience preferred Demonstrated ability to develop and deliver high quality, clear and concise presentations Pro-active and collaborative approach Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite Proficiency in PowerBI Familiarity with project management and systems management Familiarity with database management, database tools and analytical tools and concepts Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Strong verbal and written communication skills Ability to learn new tools Attention to detail required Excellent interpersonal skills to interact with a diverse group of co-workers both virtually and in person Excellent organizational and prioritization skills with ability to handle multiple projects We know there's a lot to consider. As you go through the application process, our recruiters will be glad to provide guidance, and more relevant details to answer any additional questions. Thank you again for your interest in Royal Caribbean Group. We'll hope to see you onboard soon! It is the policy of the Company to ensure equal employment and promotion opportunity to qualified candidates without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, sexuality, gender identity or expression, marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Royal Caribbean Group and each of its subsidiaries prohibit and will not tolerate discrimination or harassment.
summary: This role involves supporting the Port Vetting and Data Analytics efforts within Port Services. title: Junior Marketing Data Analyst
description: Are you an analytical thinker, with an extremely high level of detail orientation, who recognizes how data and analytics propel an organization? The Junior Marketing Data Analyst is responsible for supporting the management and organization of product data across various platforms. This position works closely with stakeholders to ensure accurate, consistent, and up-to-date product information is maintained. This role is tasked with data entry, quality assurance, and assisting with the implementation and maintenance of PIM systems and processes. Who We Are Gabriella White is home to our family of brands - Gabby, Summer Classics, and Wendy Jane. We are growing in all areas of the business and are proud to be family-owned and operated since 1987. Together, we furnish life's best moments, from the everyday to the exceptional. We are united by our vision as well as our collective spirit and our culture is shaped by our core values: Dedication – Enthusiasm – Synergy – Integrity – Goal-Oriented – Nimble, or simply put, DESIGN. As a premier innovator, manufacturer, and retailer of luxury furniture and accessories, our brands are loved by designers and design-minded consumers for creating timeless outdoor living and transitional, eclectic furniture and accessories for every part of the home. We’re always looking for talented people to join our team and grow together. What We Offer Competitive health, dental, and vision plans Company-paid short and long-term disability plans 401(k) plan with match after 12 months Employee Assistance Program and Chaplain Services to support mental and emotional well-being Paid sick, vacation, holidays, and paid parental time Annual incentive opportunity Generous Employee Product Purchase discount What You Do Reviews and implements product master change requests to ensure accuracy of data attributes. Drives excellence and ensures continuous improvement in quality of data through cleansing and best practices for data construction. Reports Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) related to material master data management and drives a system of actions to complete requests in accordance with service level agreements (SLAs). Implements changes of PIM data collection templates and creates new templates/attributes as needed. Works collaboratively as a data steward within teams to ensure clear understanding of business requirements that are managed in concert with PIM data. Collects pricing data from competitors. Identifies opportunities to gain efficiencies, automate, and improve data quality. Partners with cross functional stakeholders to support business needs. Engages in continuous process improvement. Maintains up-to-date knowledge of and compliance with company policies and procedures. Other duties as assigned. What You Bring Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Information Management, Computer Science, or related field. Two to three years of experience in data analysis; PIM experience preferred. Strong attention to detail and accuracy. Excellent organizational and time management skills. Proficiency in data entry and manipulation. Familiarity with PIM systems or similar data management tools. Basic understanding of database concepts and SQL queries (preferred but not required). Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment. Effective communication skills, both verbal and written. Proficiency in Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.
summary: This Junior Marketing Data Analyst role involves managing and organizing product data across various platforms. Responsibilities include data entry, quality assurance, implementing PIM systems, and ensuring accurate, consistent product information. The ideal candidate will have a strong attention to detail, data analysis experience, and familiarity with PIM systems.

title: Master Data Analyst
description: Brief Description Job Summary The Master Data Analyst plays a crucial role in an organization by managing and analyzing the master data, which is foundational information that is essential for various business processes and decision-making. Master data includes critical information about products, customers, suppliers, employees, and other key entities. Job Requirements Data Management: Maintain and update master data records in databases and data management systems. Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and completeness by conducting regular data audits and quality checks. Resolve data discrepancies and inconsistencies promptly. Data Analysis Analyze master data to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies. Extract meaningful insights and provide actionable recommendations to support business objectives. Develop and maintain data models for reporting and analysis. Data Governance Establish and enforce data governance policies and standards. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define data ownership and responsibilities. Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and best practices. Data Integration Work with IT teams to integrate master data from various sources into centralized databases. Ensure data flows smoothly between different systems and applications. Documentation Create and maintain documentation related to master data processes and procedures. Document data definitions, data lineage, and data quality rules. Reporting And Visualization Generate reports, dashboards, and visualizations to present data insights to stakeholders. Customize reports to meet specific business needs. Process Improvement Identify opportunities to streamline data management processes and enhance data quality. Collaborate with teams to implement process improvements. Stakeholder Communication Communicate data-related issues, updates, and improvements to relevant stakeholders. Collaborate with business units to understand their data requirements and priorities. Training And Support Provide training and support to end-users on data-related tools and processes. Assist in resolving data-related issues and inquiries. Requirements Experience Proven experience in data analysis and data management. Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, and data visualization tools. Knowledge of data governance principles and best practices. Familiarity with data integration and ETL processes. Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and collaboration skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Knowledge of relevant data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA) is a plus. Experience with data quality management tools and platforms. Familiarity with data modeling and database management systems. Knowledge of industry-specific master data domains (e.g., product data, customer data). Certification in data management or related fields is a plus. Education Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics). Summary This is a general description of the Duties, Responsibilities and Qualifications required for this position. Physical, mental, sensory, or environmental demands may be referenced to communicate the way this position traditionally is performed. Whenever necessary to provide individuals with disabilities an equal employment opportunity, AITX will consider reasonable accommodations that might involve varying job requirements and/or changing the way this job is performed, provided that such accommodations do not pose an undue hardship.
summary: The Master Data Analyst manages and analyzes master data, ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and completeness. They analyze data to identify trends and provide actionable insights, develop data models, establish data governance policies, and integrate data from various sources. They also generate reports and visualizations, streamline data processes, communicate with stakeholders, and provide training and support.

title: Data Analyst - Commercial Lending
description: ptnbsid=hDEQi5CFYIRXTjyRJ%2bMLA5LZS3U%3d Data Analyst - Commercial Lending14664MadisonLocal and Tribal Governments:Wisconsin Housing and Economic Development AuthorityFull-TimeRegular WHY WHEDA? WHEDA serves Wisconsin residents and communities by working with others to provide creative financial and technical resources to stimulate and preserve affordable housing, small businesses, and agriculture. WHEDA values Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion as part of our culture. WHEDA is an equal opportunity and Affirmative Action employer seeking a diverse and talented workforce. Veterans are also encouraged to apply. WHEDA has a remote work policy where certain employees may enjoy a hybrid or remote work schedule, based on position and business needs. See more details below related to this specific position. WHEDA is seeking a Data Analyst to join our Commercial Lending department in our Madison facility. POSITION OVERVIEW: The position of Data Analyst is responsible for leading impact analysis of multifamily financing programs to evaluate program outcomes and strengthen alignment with the mission and strategic priorities of WHEDA. Hiring Range for this position is from $61,044 to $75,195 Annually. Offered Salary will be based on qualifications and internal pay equity. WHEDA provides a competitive salary and WHEDA employees participate in the State of Wisconsin benefit package which includes retirement, health insurance and deferred compensation programs. WHEDA employees participate in the State of Wisconsin benefit package (https://www.wheda.com/about-wheda/careers/benefits). WHEDA offers an excellent benefits package that includes: Medical, Vision, and Dental Insurance, State Retirement plan; 457 Deferred Compensation, Group Term Life Insurance (and optional term life insurance for family members), Disability Insurance, paid sick leave, paid vacation time twenty eight (28) personal holiday hours, Twelve (12) paid legal holidays per year, tuition reimbursement program. Essential Duties Data Management and Analysis: Collaborate with the RAD Team and external partners to collect and organize housing data from various sources, including government databases and industry studies. Use statistical techniques to analyze large datasets to identify trends and insights in housing markets and demographics, supporting data-driven decision-making for performance management and policy development. Automate processes to improve the efficiency of data analysis and reporting. Help establish frameworks with the team for housing analysis, including studies and product evaluations. Develop data collection systems and strategies to track and optimize performance metrics and resource use. Literature Review And Research Conduct literature reviews on housing research, outcome measurement, and impacts such as social determinants of health. Review industry reports and collaborate with partners to identify and adopt best practices in housing that inform organizational strategies. Data Technology Assist in selecting data technologies such as mapping tools, data visualization techniques, and sources to meet WHEDA's objectives. Support the implementation of these technologies to improve data management and analysis. Collaborate with RAD and IT teams to develop data dashboards, charts, and visualizations that establish housing benchmarks aligned with strategic goals. Configure and manage report generation for various departments. Collaboration & Communication Collaborate with Commercial Lending leaders to support team members across different projects. Assist with performance reporting by gathering data and preparing visualizations to communicate key findings. Help prepare and schedule documents for meetings to enhance communication and coordination. Help manage external stakeholder communications and inquiries. Research And Evaluation Lead program evaluation and impact assessment for multifamily affordable housing finance program A bachelor’s or master’s degree program in urban planning, Sociology, Economics Public Policy, Statistics or a related field AND one to three years of experience in planning, housing research/policy, data analysis or related field; OR an equivalent combination of education and experience in a related field Please apply via our Career Website at WHEDA.com. Questions may be directed to whedahr@wheda.com. Applications will be accepted until position is filled.
summary: WHEDA is seeking a Data Analyst to join their Commercial Lending department. The Data Analyst will be responsible for leading impact analysis of multifamily financing programs to evaluate program outcomes and strengthen alignment with WHEDA's mission and strategic priorities. Responsibilities include data management and analysis, literature review and research, data technology, collaboration and communication, and research and evaluation.

title: Clinical Data Analyst
description: Los Banos, CA 93635 Job Accountabilities Reporting and Data Analysis: Extracts and integrates healthcare and operations data from multiple sources, reviews and creates datasets, and prepares analysis and reports based on customer requirements. Visualizes data using charts, graphs, tables, and summaries to support use and understanding. Applies quality assurance processes to ensure data is methodologically and statistically sound and accurate. Identifies and resolves potential issues with analysis assumptions and data quality or escalates as needed. Analyzes and compares data to benchmarks and standards for clinical, operational, and financial measures, and provides summaries of the organization’s performance. Abstracts, validates, and submits data elements to external agencies to support compliance with regulatory reporting. Data/System Management Monitors for incorrect/incomplete data, executing quality assurance processes to ensure data integrity and accuracy of data, reports, and presentation materials. Identifies data gaps. Works with users, system office, and/or vendors to create, modify, and define data structures and dictionaries. Coordinates and supports data transfers/interfaces, ensuring correct mapping and alignment with system standards. Collaborates with the system office for application changes, upgrades, and enhancements, performing necessary testing to assure the functionality and integrity of reporting solutions. Quality Projects Collects quality and performance data, providing data and analysis to support performance measurement, quality outcomes management, planning projects, and audits. Supports the development of metrics and/or performance/quality measures. Applies innovative techniques and processes for measuring, monitoring, analyzing, and reporting on healthcare processes, outcomes, and costs. Technical Support Presents data and analysis to operational and medical leaders and staff, describing and explaining data and results. Trains less-experienced staff in data retrieval techniques, statistical analysis, and/or data visualization methods. Serves as a resource and super-user, assisting end-users with the use of database applications and presentation of data. Develops customized templates and formats. Performance Management And Continuous Improvement Seeks and responds to regular performance feedback. Supports and assists the team when necessary. Contributes ideas and actions toward continuous improvement of processes and workflows. Recognizes and communicates potential issues to the appropriate leader. Qualifications Education: Equivalent experience will be accepted in lieu of the required degree or diploma. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems Management, Mathematics, Statistics, Business or Healthcare Management, or a related field, or equivalent education/experience. Typical Experience 2 years of recent relevant experience. Skills And Knowledge General knowledge and understanding of Quality Management, Infection Control, Risk Management, regulatory compliance, and general hospital/clinical operations and processes. Understanding of the use and application of quality measures and outcomes. Knowledge of various data sources available for quality management reporting and analysis. Familiarity with medical/clinical terminologies and clinical data. Understanding of quality performance/process improvement methodologies (e.g., Lean/Six Sigma, PDSA, Rapid Cycle). Technical skills to integrate data/information to produce reports according to user requirements and specifications. Critical thinking and analytical skills with a keen attention to detail. Ability to compute and apply moderately complex mathematical and statistical calculations. Displays a customer service focus in all decisions and actions. Organizational skills to effectively manage and re-prioritize activities and projects to meet deadlines while maintaining a high degree of responsiveness. Ability to communicate through verbal and written means, especially when helping customers understand technical concepts and data. Ability to interact and maintain effective working relationships with those contacted in the performance of required duties. Demonstrates respect for cultural and linguistic differences and promotes an inclusive work environment. Ability to work effectively in a dynamic and fast-paced environment with changing business priorities. Demonstrates initiative in providing feedback/input to improve workflow/processes. Ability to maintain and work discreetly with confidential information. Ability to use essential applications and databases associated with the role’s duties and responsibilities. Physical Activities And Requirements See required physical demands, mental components, visual activities, and working conditions at the following link: Job Requirements. Required Education Certification Bachelor’s degree We are an equal opportunity employer, and we are an organization that values diversity. We welcome applications from all qualified candidates, including minorities and persons with disabilities. req(phone number removed)
summary: This position involves data analysis and management for a healthcare organization. Responsibilities include data extraction, reporting, visualization, quality assurance, system management, support for quality projects, technical support, and performance management. The role requires proficiency in data analysis techniques, quality improvement methodologies, and communication skills.

title: GCP Data Analyst
description: Relevant experience in GCP or relevant Cloud platform, Data analysis and visualization Extensive experience developing complex data analysis. Primarily customer journeys in commerce and marketing Experience articulating business questions and using quantitative techniques to arrive at a solution using available data. Solid foundation of statistical modeling and machine learning algorithms (classification, regression, clustering, etc) and experimental design (A/B testing, etc.) Must have experience in BI Architecture Hands on experience in GCP – Big Data, Google compute engine Proficient in BI queries, dashboarding, reports & visualizations Advanced knowledge in SQL handling large amounts of data Advanced knowledge in tabular models Hands on experience in R and/or Python Experience with complex DTS packages for ETL Proficient in developing complex stored procedures, triggers, tables, user defined functions, views, and indexes. Experience performance tuning, handling Indexes, and query optimization Proficient in developing complex stored procedures, triggers, tables, user defined functions, views, and indexes. 7-10 years Exceptional teamwork skills; ability to interact and contribute effectively with others in a fast-paced, collaborative team atmosphere Ability to organize and multi-task while completing projects to meet deadlines with a strong attention to detail. Savvy with analytics, reporting and funnel development; considered an Excel and data guru by your peers A self-starter and someone that likes to take control of the reigns Google/Data analysts certification is a plus!
summary: Data Analyst with 7-10 years experience, specializing in customer journey analysis in commerce and marketing. Strong skills in GCP, Big Data, SQL, R/Python, BI, and machine learning. Expertise in data analysis, visualization, and ETL. Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
