Responsibilities include data analysis using PowerShell, tracking and verifying data accuracy, software inventory management, metadata usage, and supporting the IT Manager. The role requires strict adherence to legal and industry regulations for data security.

title: Data Quality Analyst
description: Job Title: Data Quality Analyst Location : Tempe, AZ 85281 Duration : 12+ Months (Possibility of tenure extension) Shift Hours : 40 Hours per week Required Skills: Excellent time management ability, including managing project timelines and schedules, and prioritizing work efforts. Must be a self-starter with the ability to work independently. Experience utilizing data management principles. Proficiency in SQL – reading and writing/developing in multiple SQL languages. Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Ability to communicate and work with business stakeholders, including subject matter experts at various levels within the organization. Ability to work in a collaborative team environment with individual work responsibilities, and communicate with team members to provide status updates on work efforts. Data analyst, data governance, and/or data management experience. Preferred Qualifications: Foundational understanding and experience in Enterprise data quality approaches and implementation. Experience conducting Data Quality improvement projects, preferably utilizing the Ten Steps to Quality Data. Experience with Collibra Data Quality & Observability and Data Catalog/DIP. Experience in an agile environment with daily standups, kanban/storyboard approach to work efforts. Information Governance/Data Management experience – mid-level experience. Education Required: Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Data Management, or a related field.
summary: This is a 12+ month contract position for a Data Quality Analyst in Tempe, AZ. The ideal candidate will have strong SQL skills, data management experience, and experience with data quality improvement projects. Experience with Collibra Data Quality & Observability and Data Catalog/DIP is preferred.

title: Data Quality Analyst
description: Employment Requirements This opportunity is not open to C2C relationships or visa sponsorship. This opportunity is for local candidates only. Job Description Discover exciting opportunities as a Data Quality Analyst with our team! We are looking for individuals proficient in SQL, adept at reading, writing, and developing in multiple SQL languages, with a preference for at least 5 years of experience. Candidates should have a strong background in data management principles including data profiling, cleansing, and transformation, coupled with excellent problem-solving abilities and meticulous attention to detail. Effective communication skills are essential for collaborating with business stakeholders and subject matter experts across different organizational levels. The role demands outstanding time management skills for handling project timelines and prioritizing tasks efficiently, alongside the initiative to work autonomously and provide clear status updates within a collaborative team environment. Experience as a Data Analyst or Data Engineer is highly valued, and familiarity with tools like Informatica, PowerBI, or Tableau is advantageous in the absence of Collibra expertise. Preferred qualifications include a foundational understanding of enterprise data quality approaches, involvement in data quality improvement projects, and familiarity with Collibra Data Quality & Observability and Data Catalog/DIP. If you are passionate about ensuring data quality and eager to contribute to our innovative team, apply now to explore this rewarding opportunity! Qualifications • Proficiency in SQL – reading and writing/developing in multiple SQL languages; 5 years preferred. • Experience utilizing Data Management principles including data profiling, data cleansing, and data transformation. • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. • Ability to communicate and work with the business including subject matter experts at various levels within the organization. • Excellent Time Management ability including managing project timelines and schedules and ability to prioritize work efforts. • Must be a self-starter. • Ability to work in a collaborative team environment with individual work responsibilities and communicate with team members and provide status on work efforts. • Data Analyst, Data Engineer experience. • If no Collibra exp, good substitutes include Informatica, PowerBI, Tableau etc. Preferred Qualifications • Foundational understanding and experience in Enterprise data quality approaches and implementation. • Experience conducting Data Quality improvement projects, preferably utilizing the Ten Steps to Quality Data. • Experience with Collibra Data Quality & Observability and Data Catalog/DIP. • Experience in an agile environment with daily standups, kanban/storyboard approach to work efforts. • Information Governance/Data Management experience – mid-level experience.
summary: We are seeking a Data Quality Analyst proficient in SQL with 5+ years of experience. The role involves data profiling, cleansing, and transformation, requiring strong problem-solving, communication, and time management skills. Experience with Informatica, PowerBI, Tableau, or Collibra is beneficial. Preferred qualifications include data quality improvement project experience and familiarity with Collibra Data Quality & Observability.

title: Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst I Pleno (REMOTO)
description: Job Description Somos referência na implantação de negócios digitais na América Latina e Europa. Como uma das maiores empresas desse nicho, somos reconhecidos por nossa excelência, e hoje estamos posicionados como a agência mais valiosa (MVP) do Quadrante Vtex. Com operações no Brasil, México, Chile, Argentina e Espanha, atuamos em mais de 40 países junto às maiores marcas do mercado com serviços de desenvolvimento, implantação e evolução de e-commerce, SEO, Mídia, CRO e CRM. Crescemos muito e continuamos nessa expansão, assumindo projetos cada vez maiores, mais complexos e desbravando mercados internacionais. Nesse processo fomos adquiridos pelo grupo WPP, maior empresa de comunicação do mundo. Hoje contamos com mais de 600 pessoas corajosas, determinadas, inovadoras, ágeis e colaborativas que lideram e constroem juntas o futuro do e-commerce. Vem construir esse futuro com a gente #vemsercorebiz. Responsibilities and assignments O Analista de BI tem como responsabilidade analisar e elaborar dashboards viabilizando a tomada de decisão por meio de dados. Requirements And Qualifications Colaborar com o planejamento estratégico das contas Criar reports gerenciais de alto nível (proficiência em Excel, Power BI, Power Point, Data Studio) Domínio avançado do Google Analytics (proficiência em análises e limitações) Auxiliar em travas, impedimentos ou problemas nos projetos em que atua Acompanhar periodicamente de backlog juntamente com o POs da Squad Analisar resultado de ações de acordo com objetivo no funil de consideração e caraterísticas (ex.: promocional, remarketing, Mídia paga, CRM etc.) Criação de relatórios automatizados por meio do Supermetrics Extração de dados da Vtex (pedidos, produtos, especificações de produtos e skus, estoque, etc.) Realizar consultas em banco via MySQL Conhecimento básico em implantação de Google Analytics (via Google Tag Manager) Elaborar planos de ações para possíveis problemas e futuras correções Estruturação de Banco de Dados (relacional)Criação de dashboards completamente automatizados com Power BI / Tableau / Data Studio / etc Análise de dados por meio de Python, R, Etc Automações por meio de Python, R, JavaScript, Etc Diferenciais Inglês (Intermediário) Ensino Superior (Concluído) Process stages Step 1: Registration1Registration Step 2: Entrevista | Time People2Entrevista | Time People Step 3: Teste Técnico (Opcional) 3Teste Técnico (Opcional) Step 4: Entrevista | Liderança4Entrevista | Liderança Step 5: Referências e Recomendações5Referências e Recomendações Step 6: Hiring6Hiring Sobre a Corebiz nossa história em 2013 nasceu a Santa Mônica produtora digital com foco em e-commerce. Nesta época, os fundadores Felipe Macedo e Renan Mota não imaginavam onde o sonho deles os levaria. em menos de 10 anos, a Corebiz – como agora é conhecida & reconhecida – expandiu seus negócios e fixou operações em 5 países: Brasil, Argentina, México, Chile e Espanha. quem somos hoje somos mais de 500 colaboradores ao redor do mundo, apoiando clientes em 29 países. Recentemente, passamos a fazer parte do Grupo WPP, o maior grupo de comunicação e publicidade do mundo, integrando a rede global da VMLY&R COMMERCE. Nada disso seria possível sem uma peça fundamental: as pessoas. a corebiz só chegou até aqui graças aos profissionais talentosos que fazem (ou fizeram) parte do nosso time nesses anos. nossa cultura nós somos a nossa cultura: somos determinados, inovadores, colaborativos, ágeis e corajosos. a experiência corebiz Buscamos Cuidar Das Nossas Pessoas o Tempo Todo e Por Isso, Fomentamos Programas, Iniciativas e Benefícios Que Possibilitem Uma Experiência Positiva Para Cada Integrante Do Time. Atualmente, o Nosso Pacote De Benefícios Inclui ⛑️seguro de vida 🏥assistência médica Unimed 🦷assistência odontológica 💳🍔cartão flash 🏡jornada de trabalho flexível 💬cultura de feedback e 1:1 constante 👂gestão de engajamento e escuta ativa ⚖️canal externo de ética 🎓plataforma interna de cursos e certificações 🌐bolsa de estudo de idiomas 💰participação nos lucros 💲clube de vantagens e parcerias 🗣️programa de indicação com premiação 👶auxílio creche 🎂day off de aniversário 🌱feel good: iniciativas de qualidade de vida 🌈coreyou: iniciativas de diversidade e inclusão 🌈game friday 🏋️‍♀️totalpass (parceria academias) #VemSerCorebiz A Corebiz está atenta às questões de diversidade de gênero e já concentra os seus melhores esforços na otimização de suas condições, como ações de diversidade e inclusão, adequações das políticas de remuneração e avaliação para que todos tenham oportunidades igualitárias. Assim, a partir do presente ano, nos termos da Lei n. 14.611/2023, a Corebiz publicará dados consolidados referentes ao seu quadro total de colaboradores/as, o que auxiliará a fornecer uma imagem mais representativa das práticas de remuneração e garantir a compreensão de quaisquer variações. O último relatório disponibilizado pode ser verificado aqui. Vale notar que as estatísticas apresentadas no relatório não refletem a realidade material ou a cultura da companhia, pois há uma ampla gama de situações (em termos de cargos/níveis /salários) agrupadas no mesmo conjunto de códigos ocupacionais (CBOs). Para quaisquer dúvidas, falar com nosso time de People espacorh@corebiz.ag
summary: Corebiz, a leading digital business implementation agency with operations in Latin America and Europe, is seeking a BI Analyst to join their team. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of data analysis, a proven track record in developing dashboards and reports, and proficiency in tools such as Excel, Power BI, Power Point, Data Studio, Google Analytics, Supermetrics, MySQL, and Python. They will be responsible for analyzing data, creating reports, automating tasks, and collaborating with the team to improve the overall efficiency of the business. Corebiz offers a comprehensive benefits package, including health insurance, dental insurance, flexible work arrangements, a learning platform, and more.

title: Analytics Consultant
description: Senior Data Analytics Consultant Bytecode IO is a growing data consulting company that is looking for a customer-focused Data Analytics Consultant to join our team. We work on the latest technologies - Snowflake, BigQuery, Stitch, Looker - with a wide range of fast growing companies. The ideal candidate can work with minimal direction delivering analytic solutions to unlock data value. You will engage on a variety of client projects using both new and proven technologies. This is a remote full-time W2 position - US only based You must prove you are authorized to work in the US - if hired ABOUT THE ROLE Develop data models, reports and dashboards from ideation through production Integrate and transform data for analysis using SQL, ETL tools and API integrations Validate data to ensure accuracy Provide guidance to clients on optimizing their data environment Work with clients (product managers, marketers, engineering team) to define requirements, establish priorities, offer solutions and execute development Perform technical and business user training Execute projects with minimal guidance WHO YOU ARE Required: 5+ years of SQL experience Consulting experience leading projects Technical expertise with data modeling and database design Experience with business intelligence software Excellent communication and problem-solving skills Ability to manage multiple clients concurrently Availability to take conference calls with clients during business hours Interest in mentoring Great if you have (not a must): Experience working remotely Experience with Looker Familiarity with Python, Javascript, HTML Experience with SQL-type database administration BS in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Engineering, Statistics or Mathematics BENEFITS Flexible daily schedule to maximize work / life balance Health Benefits Vacation, Sick Leave, Paid public holiday 401K Training and Certification on Looker, AWS and Google Cloud Company Laptop
summary: Bytecode IO seeks a customer-focused Senior Data Analytics Consultant with 5+ years of SQL experience to work on projects using Snowflake, BigQuery, Stitch, and Looker. Responsibilities include data modeling, reporting, dashboard development, data integration, validation, client guidance, project management, training, and communication. Ideal candidate is comfortable working remotely with minimal direction.

title: Business Continuity Data Analyst
description: The Business Continuity Data Analyst will support the rapidly growing Business Continuity program. The role will involve querying and analyzing large amounts of complex and disparate data to help drive the Business Continuity program's plans and help improve technology within the team. Roles and responsibilities: Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality. Work with Leadership to prioritize business and information needs. Building SOPs for gathering data and searching specific systems. Regular control monitoring report resolutions. Use individual problem-solving and analytical skills to authenticate details and data. Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports. Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems. Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets. Filter and "clean" data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems. Locate and define new process improvement opportunities. Requirements Excellent client-facing and internal communication skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. A professional with a proven history of working in a fast-paced environment. Strong attention to detail and organizational skills. Advanced MS SQL Server based analysis skills. ETL, Complex Joins, Functions, Stored Procedures, Loops. Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau etc.). Experience assessing data integrity (completeness, accuracy, explaining impact of data integrity on decisions/assumptions). Experience examining and evaluating processes and information systems, recommending controls to ensure reliability and data integrity. Benefits Control Risks offers a competitively positioned compensation and benefits package that is transparent and summarized in the full job offer. We operate a discretionary bonus scheme that incentivizes, and rewards individuals based on company and individual performance. Control Risks supports hybrid working arrangements, wherever possible, that emphasize the value of in-person time together - in the office and with our clients - while continuing to support flexible and remote working.
summary: The Business Continuity Data Analyst will support the company's Business Continuity program by querying and analyzing data to drive program plans and improve technology. The role involves developing databases, data collection systems, and analytical strategies to optimize efficiency and quality.  This position requires advanced MS SQL Server skills, experience with ETL, complex joins, functions, stored procedures, and loops, along with experience in data visualization tools like Power BI and Tableau. Data integrity assessment, process evaluation, and control recommendations are also key responsibilities.

title: Data and Reporting Analyst
description: Westfalia Technologies, Inc. is growing! We are seeking a skilled Data and Reporting Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, experience with SQL, and proficiency in data visualization tools. This role involves extracting and manipulating data, developing reports and dashboards, and collaborating with various teams to support business decision-making processes. Write, update, and troubleshoot queries to pull data from multiple sources. Utilize SQL queries to extract and manipulate data from databases, performing data cleansing and validation to ensure accuracy. Conduct regular audits of existing analyses and reports to identify and address any data discrepancies or formatting issues. Perform ad hoc analysis as requested by team members. Develop and automate reports and dashboards using tools such as Power BI and Reporting Services, providing insights to support business decision-making processes. Migrate, maintain, and enhance existing Excel reports, ensuring a seamless transition to modern analysis technology. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify key performance indicators (KPIs) and develop metrics for measuring business performance. Collaborate with the Sales team to deliver sales analysis to potential clients. Collaborate with Business Solutions team to design, create, deliver, and support new features with business value. Update items in a DevOps backlog. Present findings and insights to stakeholders using data visualizations, presentations, and written reports. Required Skills / Abilities Experience with SQL (Microsoft SQL Server). Experience with reporting software for sharing analysis (Power BI, SQL Server Reporting Services, and Excel). Proven ability to quickly adapt to changing environments, learn, and apply new skills to complex problems. Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Strong desire to learn. Demonstrated ability to learn and understand business processes quickly. Good collaboration skills. Works effectively with minimum direction. Desired Education / Experience College degree in Information/Computer Sciences, Accounting/Finance, or a related field. A combination of relevant education and experience may be considered instead of a degree. 3+ years of experience in Data Analysis and Reporting or a similar role. Manufacturing experience is a plus. Why Work for Westfalia Technologies, Inc.? Our culture can be defined as one of progression and flexibility. Over the years, we have learned it is not only about pay or job title, but more importantly, the relationships and benefits that keep our employees happy and engaged! Competitive Salary Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage 401K and match options Educational Assistance Reimbursement Wellness Program Healthy Living Reimbursement Paid Parental Leave And more! Check out our Careers page for more information regarding our culture and additional benefits at https://www.westfaliausa.com/company/careers! Westfalia Technologies, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, religion, age, disability, gender identity, results of genetic testing, or service in the military. Equal employment opportunity applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leave of absence, compensation, and training.
summary: Westfalia Technologies, Inc. is searching for a Data and Reporting Analyst with strong analytical skills and expertise in SQL and data visualization tools. The role involves extracting, manipulating, and analyzing data, creating reports and dashboards, collaborating with various teams, and supporting business decisions.  The ideal candidate will have 3+ years of experience in data analysis and reporting, a college degree, and strong communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills.

title: Data Analyst
description: This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Calling all innovators - find your future at Fiserv. We're Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments, and we move money and information in a way that moves the world. We connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants, and consumers to one another millions of times a day - quickly, reliably, and securely. Any time you swipe your credit card, pay through a mobile app, or withdraw money from the bank, we're involved. If you want to make an impact on a global scale, come make a difference at Fiserv. Job Title Data Analyst What does a successful Data Analyst do at Fiserv? The Data Conversion team works directly with new clients to convert their existing credit card portfolios onto Fiserv processing platforms. The team, comprised of project managers, data analysts, and conversion programmers, perform an initial review of a converting client's data files to develop an extensive list of reports. Then, they utilize custom tools to analyze the data, develop technical specifications for converting the data and present the specifications to the client. They also write the conversion programs and processes and assist with the testing/loading process. This position offers a variety of opportunities to handle both business and technical projects, learn and use multiple Fiserv applications/products, work with new technologies (like EMV and digital payments) and develop relationships with many large financial institutions across the globe. We provide associates the opportunity to try different roles (programmer, analyst and project manager) based on experience and our associates are encouraged to develop new skills and knowledge allowing them to take on new challenging assignments for our clients. Our team is encouraged to think “outside the box” and make process improvements. The role provides a unique opportunity to use both technical and analytical skills, knowledge of the payment processing industry, and soft skills (communication, managing expectation, leading large efforts) required to work effectively with clients. What You Will Do Perform technical data mapping analysis. Deliver and execute conversion project milestones for the full project life cycle from initiation through project closure. Design and document complex technical requirements for business applications. Ensure quality of data conversion suite including holding quality inspections and validate offline System and Output testing of data conversion files. Monitor and report progress; identify risks and issues; manage and escalate appropriately. What You Will Need To Have Bachelor's degree IT, Finance, Accounting, Economics, Mathematics, or Statistics or equivalent work experience. 3+ years' experience in a client-facing role. 2+ years' experience in testing and validation of output, reports, and financial balancing. Travel required: 1-2 trips annually. What Would Be Great To Have Experience in Mainframe applications, COBOL, IBM JCL, and TSO/TPX. Experience in converting to new credit issuing platforms, especially Optis Experience with and knowledge of Fiserv production programs and processes. Understanding of the Issuing Industry and associated products. Analytical and critical thinking skills, and meticulous attention to detail including the ability to analyze and/or code data from different platforms in order to integrate the data into a Fiserv platform. This role is not eligible to be performed in Colorado, California, District of Columbia, Hawaii, Maryland, New York or Washington. Please note that salary ranges provided for this role on external job boards are salary estimates made by outside parties and may not be accurate. Thank You For Considering Employment With Fiserv. Please Apply using your legal name Complete the step-by-step profile and attach your resume (either is acceptable, both are preferable). What You Should Know About Us Fiserv is a global leader in payments and financial technology with more than 40,000 associates proudly serving clients in more than 100 countries. As one of Fortune® magazine's "World's Most Admired Companies™" 9 of the last 10 years, one of Fast Company's Most Innovative Companies, and a top scorer on Bloomberg's Gender-Equality Index, we are committed to innovation and excellence. Our Commitment To Diversity And Inclusion Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and we welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce that reflects our world. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other category protected by law. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation. Warning About Fake Job Posts Please be aware of fraudulent job postings that are not affiliated with Fiserv. Fraudulent job postings may be used by cyber criminals to target your personally identifiable information and/or to steal money or financial information. Any communications from a Fiserv representative will come from a legitimate business email address. We will not hire through text message, social media, or email alone, and any interviews will be conducted in person or through a secure video call. We won't ask you for sensitive information nor will we ask you to pay anything during the hiring process. We also won't send you a check to cash on Fiserv's behalf. If you see suspicious activity or believe that you have been the victim of a job posting scam, you should report it to your local FBI field office or to the FBI's Internet Crime Complaint Center.
summary: Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments, seeks a Data Analyst to join their Data Conversion team. This role involves converting client credit card portfolios onto Fiserv platforms, performing data mapping analysis, delivering project milestones, designing technical requirements, and ensuring data conversion quality. The ideal candidate will have experience in client-facing roles, testing and validation, and understanding of the issuing industry. They may also have experience with Mainframe applications, COBOL, IBM JCL, TSO/TPX, and Optis.

title: Lead Data Analyst, Legal
description: The Legal Operations Lead Insights Analyst role is a full-time, professional track role whose primary responsibility is to identify, generate and communicate insights for the Legal Department through the blending, transformation, and critical evaluation of data through descriptive, diagnostic and limited predictive methods relying on Chick-fil-A’s established analytics tooling stack. The Legal Department is in the early stages of this capability so this role will build from the ground up and influence the metrics and KPIs of the department. This role will also be expected to provide analytical support for multiple projects or workstreams in the Legal Department with some dependencies on other departments. It will require acting as a Subject Matter Expert in a broad suite of standard data, methods and tools, including complex features. This role will report directly to the Legal Operations Systems & Analytics Principal Team Leader. To succeed in this role, the candidate must have a comprehensive knowledge of data, statistical analysis, reporting and data visualization to help investigate and analyze business performance, provide insights, and drive recommendations to improve performance. Our Flexible Future model offers a healthy mix of working in person and virtually, strengthening key elements of the Chick-fil-A culture by fostering collaboration and community. broader business Demonstrate strong knowledge of Chick-fil-A’s business and the restaurant industry, including use and calculation of relevant Key Performance Indicators and benchmarks Creation of Tableau and/or ThoughtSpot type visualizations, finding and building data to be retrieved via SQL, and data curation via Alteryx or similar tools for dashboard presentations or ad hoc analyses Develop decisions, including the area of annual planning Define data requirements, gather and validate information using judgment and statistical tests Persuasively recommend insights-informed action to select predictive methods, with minimal oversight Confidently leverage a broad suite of standard analytics tooling that may require unique or complex integrations across systems while coaching others to do the same, including Tableau, Alteryx, ThoughtSpot and Business Objects to build data queries and visualizations to answer key business questions for the department Act as Subject Matter Expert for standard data usage patterns, analytics tooling and analytic methods and procedures while coaching others within the analytics community to do the same Use analytical and technical skills to identify and report on trends related to all department data and assist team leads with predictive analysis for strategic planning using those trends Partner with leaders of strategic work to solve complex business problems and influence project execution, specifically focusing on LEAN initiatives, self-service analytics, and workflow automation Communicate findings and analysis to a non-technical audience Create and analyze survey data for legal practice teams using statistical analysis to extract insights Minimum Qualifications Proficient with Tableau or similar data Experience providing data or analytical support for a Legal Department General awareness of a breadth of cloud computing concepts and capabilities Strong statistical programming skills in R or Python title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: The Medpace Analytics team is growing rapidly and is focused on building a data driven culture across the enterprise. We leverage our business acumen and technical skillsets to help identify and deliver on initiatives ranging from Adhoc or operational reporting to the development of strategic reporting tools driving new revenue streams. WHAT’S IN THIS FOR YOU? Have a hand in building and growing our expanding Analytics team Work in a supportive, fast paced, entrepreneurial, and innovative workplace Opportunity to shape development and best practices for our Analytics initiatives Gain experience and exposure to BI concepts from visualization to data warehousing Grow business knowledge by working with leadership across all aspects of Medpace’s business Responsibilities WHAT’S INVOLVED? We are looking for an experienced Business Intelligence Analyst to add additional depth to our growing Analytical team in a variety of areas - from Visualization and Storytelling to SQL, Data Modeling, and Data Warehousing. This is a critical role which will be responsible for developing, supporting, and enhancing reports and dashboards across the enterprise. An ideal candidate in this role will apply proven communication skills, problem-solving skills, and experience and knowledge of best practices to continue developing our Analytics capabilities as well as coaching and mentoring more junior analysts. WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE - AND WHY WE NEED YOU! Demonstrable data analysis and data mining skills (SQL, DAX, Data Modeling, etc.) Strong data visualization skills within Power BI (or other data visualization suite) Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate business needs into technical solutions Understanding of reporting and business intelligence best practices Good understanding of BI concepts (e.g. data governance, data lineage tools, data management, data modeling, data cleansing, data extraction and transformation (ELT/ETL), and data analysis) Experience working on high performing Agile/Scrum teams Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Business/Computer Science or similar 3+ years of experience with Microsoft BI Stack - or combination of relevant technologies Solid understanding of BI concepts, and the ability to articulate these concepts to technical and non-technical audiences Experience in business data modeling, metadata structure and business subject areas for key business processes Familiarity with Agile methodology and Scrum framework (preferred) Medpace Overview Medpace is a full-service clinical contract research organization (CRO). We provide Phase I-IV clinical development services to the biotechnology, pharmaceutical and medical device industries. Our mission is to accelerate the global development of safe and effective medical therapeutics through its scientific and disciplined approach. We leverage local regulatory and therapeutic expertise across all major areas including oncology, cardiology, metabolic disease, endocrinology, central nervous system, anti-viral and anti-infective. Headquartered in Cincinnati, Ohio, employing approximately 4,500+ people across almost 40 countries. Why Medpace? People. Purpose. Passion. Make a Difference Tomorrow. Join Us Today. The work we’ve done over the past 30+ years has positively impacted the lives of countless patients and families who face hundreds of diseases across all key therapeutic areas. The work we do today will improve the lives of people living with illness and disease in the future. Cincinnati Perks Cincinnati Campus Overview Hybrid work-from-home options (dependent upon position and level) Competitive PTO packages, starting at 20+ days Competitive compensation and benefits package Flexible work schedule Company-sponsored employee appreciation events Employee health and wellness initiatives Community involvement with local nonprofit organizations Discounts on local sports games, fitness gyms and attractions Modern, ecofriendly campus with an on-site fitness center Structured career paths with opportunities for professional growth Discounted tuition for UC online programs Awards Named a Top Workplace in 2024 by The Cincinnati Enquirer Recognized by Forbes as one of America's Most Successful Midsize Companies in 2021, 2022, 2023 and 2024 Continually recognized with CRO Leadership Awards from Life Science Leader magazine based on expertise, quality, capabilities, reliability, and compatibility What To Expect Next A Medpace team member will review your qualifications and, if interested, you will be contacted with details for next steps. EO/AA Employer M/F/Disability/Vets

title: Data Analyst - Digital Learning at UT
description: Digital Learning at the University of Tennessee, Knoxville, is a newly created unit charged with advancing UT’s commitment to discovery, creativity, learning, and engagement, specifically for online learners. Using advanced and innovative technologies, Digital Learning at UT will provide scalable solutions that enhance the online learning experience and reduce barriers to student access and success, providing a tremendous impact to online learners across the state and the nation. At Digital Learning, we want to be bold and impactful, transforming the future of online education through innovative thinking and collaboration problem-solving. This role supports the Digital Learning division by providing timely, accurate, and relevant insights to decision makers. Collects, organizes, and interprets data to help inform the decisions that shape the future of Digital Learning. Creates and maintains interactive dashboards that contain a variety of data visualizations and key performance indicators (KPls) designed to meet the needs of the end user and inform decisions at the highest levels of the division. Responsible for linking data from multiple internal sources as well as importing and linking data from external sources. Integrates concepts and data from various sources such as Google Analytics, Salesforce, CPD platforms, and internal systems such as Slate and Banner. Performs the evaluation and testing of data and reports received from other offices, establishes automatic data verification, resolves data discrepancies, creates queries, and develops standard and ad hoc reports. The salary range for this position is approximately between $70,000-$80,000 per year, commensurate with experience, with the potential for a hybrid working capacity. Job Other Professional Primary Location US-Tennessee-knoxville Organization Digital Learning At Ut Schedule Full-time Campus/Institute Knoxville Job Posting Jul 9, 2024, 9:52:05 AM Job Duties Data Analysis and Data Visualization: Works on a variety of projects analyzing marketing, admissions, enrollment, academic program, and other student data. Designs and maintains automated reports and interactive dashboards to inform business decisions using Microsoft Power BI, Google Looker, RStudio, Tableau, and other data visualization applications. Organizes results and conclusions of data analysis for use and presentation by departmental leaders. Develops overall subject matter expertise regarding internal and external data sources that support departmental mission. Provides guidance and technical advice to departmental customers in the areas of data visualization and reporting. Remains current and learns new skills and software applications as tools and data analysis needs change over time. Coordinates testing of new releases of data analysis and visualization applications to identify impacts to and across data libraries and/or databases to ensure data integrity. Data Collection from Internal and External Data Sources: Designs and maintains complex SQL queries to pull data from institutional relational databases that can be packaged as data sources for data analysis and visualizations. Joins disparate data sources and establishes procedures to conduct regular data sampling and full data comparison on divisional and other data sets. Automates repetitive tasks by writing clean and tested code that can be maintained and extended by other analysts. Contributes to data analysis and data visualization needs via ETL (extract, transform, load) procedures to translate raw data into user friendly formats, trend analyses, static and interactive graphs. Collects and assists with the analysis of relevant data from external data sources such as the U.S. Department of Education Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System (IPEDS). Merges data from external and internal databases and makes correlations across merged data sets. Uses independent judgment to research and problem solve data collection discrepancies and irregularities. Implementation, maintenance, and documentation of the internal reporting processes: Timely and accurate generation and dissemination of standard and on demand reports for use by departmental units. Must be able to respond ad hoc to requests accurately and quickly. Automates repetitive (standard) reports. Consults with clients to understand data needs and develops tools to collect and deliver requested information. Develops and maintains procedures to improve accuracy and efficiency of data querying, report generation, and data dissemination processes. Identifies data discrepancies and addresses data quality issues to ensure consistency and integrity of data collection and reporting. Maintains departmental documentation for data definitions, a query catalog, sources of data and operation procedures for routine departmental processes. Required Education And Experience Bachelor's degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Computational Social Science, or a related field Minimum of one (1) year of experience in data analysis and visualization, reporting, or statistical analysis. Applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis without need now or in the future for sponsorship for employment visa status. Preferred Experience Master’s degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Computational Social Science, or a related field Two or more years of experience in analytics and data visualization, reporting, or statistical analysis. Experience working in a higher education setting. Experience working with marketing, admissions, enrollment, academic program, and other student data. Experience with complex data sets including manipulating, merging, restructuring, and analyzing large data sets. Demonstrated successful management of multiple short-term and long-term projects, independent completion of projects with accuracy, thoroughness and creativity, and timely meeting of deadlines under pressure. For full consideration, applicants must attach a letter of interest, resume, and the name, address, email, and phone number of three professional references, in addition to completing the applicant file to the Human Resources online application system, Taleo. Screening of applicants will begin immediately and continue until the position has been filled. DL_UT
summary: This position analyzes data to support the Digital Learning division at the University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Responsibilities include creating dashboards, interpreting data, and developing reports using tools like Power BI, Looker, and Tableau.

title: Production Data Analyst
description: Live an Adventure, Master your Craft, Find your Purpose At Dynamic Aviation, we solve unique challenges for our customers with innovative aviation solutions. Our focus is on operations that serve, protect, and enhance the lives of families and communities worldwide. Whether modifying aircraft to help protect our service members overseas, performing geographical mapping for scientific research, or working to suppress large wildfires on the West Coast, we serve with integrity and excellence. Production Data Analyst Bridgewater, VA Job Purpose : The Production Data Analyst is responsible for providing reporting support on production activity to internal customer, as well as resource planning and other projects. To support Program Management, Technical Operations, and Corporate stakeholders with data/information to help improve operational effectiveness. Duties Responsible to support and maintain a Master Schedule. Supports the organization with resource planning to ensure upcoming and current projects are staffed adequately. Supports EVMS by calculating on-time delivery metric for aircraft projects. Analyzes schedules, budgets, and operational data to provide CPI & SPI. Supports forecasting requirements and the development of EAC & ETC. Supports program management and planning team. Provide reports and data to customers on current operations within Dynamic Aviation Technical Operations, including production status, maintenance progress, and other external reporting requirements. Develop and maintain reports for internal customers. Audits WBS and Contract information on applicable Pentagon/ERP work orders to ensure billing alignment. Perform audits on WOF (work order form) releases to help Program Management manage scope and ensure proposal alignment to work being requested. Work with scheduling team to generate historical data to justify schedules and understand how schedules should be developed. Assist estimating with the generation of estimates and associated data used to develop the estimates. Provide support to internal positions to provide data and reports for status and customer needs. Support program management with status reporting on current programs as needed. Supports the Planning team with the development of reporting tools to better support the operational effectiveness. Assist with Production Planner I duties of opening and closing work order cards, as needed. Other duties as assigned. Skills/Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in business or related field; relevant work experience can be substituted for a degree. Two to five years of experience. A technical background, such as job-related experience in coordination of planning, project management, scheduling, and production control. Strong background with the Microsoft Office Suite, specifically Excel. Strong aptitude in using computer-based software for reporting and data mining (i.e. SQL, Power BI, SharePoint, ERP Systems). Ability to understand customer (Internal/External) needs and develop reporting documents to support the operation. Strong initiative and ability to support multiple projects. Excellent communication skills with the ability to relay information effectively to leadership, team members, subject matter experts and customers. Ability to read and understand technical data (Scopes of Work, Proposal Documentation, Engineering Drawings, etc.). Must be detail and task oriented with strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to work well with others in a fast paced, dynamic environment. Estimating and data collection experience preferred. Previous experience with military/government contracts preferred. Budget Analysis experience preferred. It is the policy of Dynamic Aviation to prohibit and eliminate discrimination on grounds of race, color, religion, sex, (including pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or any other characteristics protected by law. It is also Dynamic Aviation's policy to provide equal employment for all and comply with any affirmative action obligations pursuant to the Federal Executive Orders, 11246 and 11375, as amended. Apply Now

The role involves analyzing schedules, budgets, and operational data to improve operational effectiveness. Responsibilities include maintaining a Master Schedule, supporting resource planning, calculating on-time delivery metrics, and generating reports for both internal and external customers.

title: GIS Analyst (Data Analyst III)
description: A career with Johnson County Government is more than just a job, it is an opportunity to serve a diverse and expanding community in meaningful ways. We challenge ourselves to be a different kind of government because we care deeply about our community and each other. Committed to our shared values, we provide excellent public service, seeking always to improve ourselves and our organization. We offer wonderful benefits, retirement plans, wellness incentives, a great organizational culture, and much more! If you’re searching for something more than just a job, something akin to a calling, then consider the challenge and opportunity of being a member of Johnson County Government! Johnson County Department of Technology and Innovation (DTI) is seeking a dynamic individual with a diverse skillset as it relates to Geographic Information Systems (GIS), process automation (i.e., Extract Transform Load (ETL)), data visualization, and analysis.  The GIS Analyst position is assigned to the AIMS (Automated Information Mapping System) unit within Enterprise Services of DTI, for support of GIS, mapping, data visualization, and analysis functions at the County.  This position is eligible for a hybrid work assignment. First review of applications will begin on August 6, 2024. The ideal candidate would possess and be able to perform the following skills/task: Work with Johnson County departments on data and spatial analysis projects to provide solutions to complex issues using various GIS technology solutions. Possess considerable knowledge of GIS technologies and applications as they relate to the ESRI GIS Software Suite including ArcGIS Pro to perform GIS workflows, data management, conversion, creation, editing, analysis and geoprocessing, cartography, visualization, and sharing. Extensive experience using ArcGIS Online and Portal specifically using, Dashboard, Story Maps, Field Collector, Survey 123 to assist County department and AIMS data partners. The ability to manipulate and query data as well as provide reports and visualizations of data utilizing T-SQL, SQL Server Management Studio, SQL Server Reporting Services, Tableau and Power BI. Knowledge of automation tools and programming software such as Python, model builder, Feature Manipulation Engine (FME), Power Automate, and other ETL tools. As Mapper of the Day (MOD), work with the general public and AIMS Data Partners by answering questions related to AIMS data and services, and by responding to specific requests for data and services (e.g., map creation). Additional desirable skills would include experience working with Census & Population Data, ACS Variables/Tables and Forecasting; familiarity with Cadastral Mapping, Coordinate Geometry mapping (COGO) and PLSS System; Experience with Asset Management System (Central Square or comparable); and familiarity with Tableau as a data visualization tool. Candidate must be able to lead and coordinate projects and have the ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.  In addition, candidate should have practical experience providing solutions relative to data and GIS and an understanding of the functions of County government. Bachelor’s degree in the following field(s) of study: geography, data analysis, statistics, engineering, mathematics, computer science, or relevant field of study and five (5) years of experience using GIS or other data analysis software. Experience can substitute for education.  Education can substitute for experience. This position is currently eligible to work in a hybrid work environment with both onsite and remote work.  Residency within the Kansas City-Overland Park-Kansas City, MO-KS Combined Statistical Area, which generally includes the Kansas counties of Johnson, Wyandotte, Leavenworth, Miami, and Linn, and the Missouri counties of Jackson, Clay, Platte, Cass, and Ray, is required. __________________________________________ Johnson County Government requires successful completion of reference/background screening for all positions. Physical, Environmental, and Special Working Conditions: All County employees may be called upon to assist other departments/agencies in a declared emergency situation.
summary: Johnson County Department of Technology and Innovation (DTI) is seeking a GIS Analyst to support the AIMS (Automated Information Mapping System) unit. The role involves working with County departments on data and spatial analysis projects using GIS technology, data visualization and analysis, and automation tools. Responsibilities include data management, conversion, creation, editing, analysis, geoprocessing, cartography, visualization, and sharing using ArcGIS Pro, ArcGIS Online, and Portal. The candidate must have strong skills in T-SQL, SQL Server Management Studio, SQL Server Reporting Services, Tableau, Power BI, Python, model builder, Feature Manipulation Engine (FME), Power Automate, and other ETL tools.  Experience with Census & Population Data, ACS Variables/Tables and Forecasting, Cadastral Mapping, Coordinate Geometry mapping (COGO), and PLSS System, Asset Management System, and Tableau as a data visualization tool are desirable.

title: Data Analyst
description: Summary Provides support to the Director Behavioral Education and the management function in the area of data retrieval creating databases developing reports maintaining statistics and other informational reports. Assists department and/or medical staff in evaluating data and implementing changes where necessary. Ensures standards of Hospital training and education program Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (Joint Commission) and other regulatory agencies are met. Assists the Department and/or medical staff in the creation of education presentations and materials utilizing a full spectrum of computer audio visual and graphic applications. Provides secretarial and communication support services to all staff of the Department. Responsibilities PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Consistently applies the corporate values of respect honesty and fairness and the constant pursuit of excellence in improving the health status of the people of the region through the provision of customer-friendly geographically accessible and high-value services within the environment of a comprehensive integrated academic health system. Is responsible for knowing and acting in accordance with the principles of the Lifespan Corporate Compliance Program and Code of Conduct. Collaborates with Bradley staff and management personnel to collect and analyze data in support of the goals and objectives of the Behavioral Education Department. Participates on project teams across departments and affiliates. Collects and analyzes employee training and education data. Collects and analyzes external and community training and education data. Acts as a resource to Director Behavioral Education and other managers through the development and utilization of data from various data systems. Creates databases and spreadsheets. Utilizes spreadsheets relational databases and other software which may require merging data from multiple sources to enter organize and analyze data. Downloads information from various Lifespan data systems and other sources to build and maintain databases for the department. Programs special report runs and modifies report specifications as needed to meet user needs. Maintains statistics and other training and education related reports. Acts as liaison person between the department and information systems. Collaborates with Corporate Information Systems to project manage the consolidation and linking (interface) data between desktop applications and an Intranet application. Project manages file data conversion/interface between multiple database applications and hospital applications. Analyzes raw and statistical data used in reports to determine accuracy. Investigates and resolves discrepancies as appropriate. Recommends methods to monitor update and assess quality of data available for reporting needs. Develops and prepares various standard and ad hoc reports for the department. Prepares various reports from a variety of databases. Completes special analyses and projects as needed. Acts as resource to customers to interpret explain and clarify statistical data produced. Consolidates statistical database information into visual presentations using various graphic flow-charting histogram software programs to format and present the technical information based upon the audience. Prepares and analyzes data to monitor performance of Hospital�s training and education functions and to evaluate compliance to standards. Compiles data on clinical processes performance results and occurrence data. Generates reports that identify problems causes and activities from database related to provision of clinical care. Reviews appropriate literature to maintain and enhance knowledge of federal state and voluntary regulatory standards that relate to training and education and Joint Commission accreditation. Performs literature and web searches as directed. Administers pre- and pos- tests and evaluation surveys to employees and/or community trainees as directed. Administers and scores standardized psychological tests in accordance with the instructions in the test manuals. Administers rating scales and behavior checklists including self-report inventories according to standardized procedures. Compiles and performs statistical computation and analysis of data as directed. Maintains ad manages payroll entry system for all staff. Manages changes and corrections for inaccurate paycheck and other payroll related records. Performs staffing coordination and scheduling functions as directed referring staffing variances to management. Maintains a staff information and performance management evaluation tracking system for management. Contacts Facilities Management for repairs and installations. Files and reports work orders and related safety reports to faculties and safety administration. Orders supplies materials and services for the Department. Keeps full inventory and stock of supplies. Organizes class rosters. Organizes schedules for coursework and training events. Maintains records for external and community services provided by the Department. Maintains an accurate and comprehensive filing system for the Department. Is knowledgeable and competent in word processing. Manages photocopy and fax requests. Prepares and types letters memoranda minutes and reports for program management. Handles calls correspondence visitors and inquiries for program and staff. Maintains office and classroom environment in a safe neat and orderly condition. Partake in interviewing and training of new hires. Aides in coordination of Marketing Platforms and tracking revenue. Invoicing and corresponding with appropriate parties through government approved grants. Other Information BASIC KNOWLEDGE: Level of knowledge in business data management and quantitative analysis normally acquired through completion of an associate degree in business or related field. Course work in computer science or a related field is desirable. Use of microcomputers and a variety of spreadsheet and database applications including the ability to download and merge information from a variety of sources. Knowledge and ability to perform financial and quantitative analyses. Knowledge of data sources such as medical records administrative data department/service specific data and various Hospital-wide manual and automated data systems. Interpersonal skills to work with all levels of Hospital personnel including physicians and to elicit detailed project goals. Experience One to two years progressively more responsible experience in education training or health care. Work Environment And Physical Requirements Normal office conditions. Lifespan is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race color religion sex national origin age ethnicity sexual orientation ancestry genetics gender identity or expression disability protected veteran or marital status. Lifespan is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor. Location: Bradley Hospital USA:RI:East Providence Work Type: Part Time Shift: Shift 1 Union: Non-Union
summary: This role involves supporting the Director of Behavioral Education and management in data retrieval, database creation, report development, statistics maintenance, and other informational reports. The position also involves analyzing data, implementing changes, ensuring compliance with training and education standards, and assisting with education presentations and materials. Additionally, it includes secretarial and communication support services for the department.

title: IT Systems and Data Analysis Intern
description: About WHYY WHYY serves the Philadelphia region with trusted journalism, eye-opening storytelling and intimate local arts programming. Our curiosity and commitment to this community is what drives our programming. It’s also what drives our hiring. Below you’ll find an employment opportunity in the fast-paced setting of the Philadelphia region’s leading public media provider. The award-winning professional staff of WHYY sets the bar high in television, radio and online. Whether it’s preparing a program to air or a behind-the-scenes role in support, all positions are vital to continuing—and growing—our impact in our community. WHYY offers a voice to those not heard, a platform to share everyone’s stories, a foundation to empower early and lifelong learners and a trusted space for unbiased news. Learn more about our Social Responsibility Program. It’s how we live. Duties And Responsibilities Assist with Information Technology operations & support. Assist with the development of data reporting and analyses. Help explore innovative uses of artificial intelligence technologies, including predictive models and LLMs.

Responsibilities include assisting with IT operations, developing data reporting and analyses, and exploring innovative AI applications.

title: Data Analyst
description: Description Robert Half is seeking a Contract Data Center Analyst to join our client's IT team. As a Contract Data Center Analyst, you will be responsible for the maintenance, monitoring, and optimization of the data center infrastructure. This role involves ensuring the efficiency, security, and reliability of the data center environment. This is a contract position offering an exciting opportunity to work with a respected organization. Key Responsibilities Data Center Maintenance: Oversee the day-to-day operations of the data center, including hardware maintenance, equipment upgrades, and system installations. Infrastructure Monitoring: Monitor data center performance, including servers, storage systems, networking devices, and power/cooling infrastructure, ensuring optimal operation and reliability. Incident Response: Respond promptly to data center incidents, troubleshoot issues, and implement solutions to minimize downtime and ensure data integrity. Capacity Planning: Assess and forecast data center capacity requirements, making recommendations for upgrades or changes to meet current and future business needs. Security Implementation: Implement and maintain data center security protocols, including access controls, firewalls, and physical security measures. Documentation: Maintain detailed records of data center configurations, changes, and incidents for auditing and troubleshooting purposes. Disaster Recovery Planning: Contribute to the development and testing of disaster recovery plans to ensure business continuity in case of data center failures or disasters. Vendor Coordination: Work with vendors and service providers to procure equipment, manage service contracts, and coordinate maintenance activities. Requirements Qualifications: Previous experience as a Data Center Analyst or in a similar role within a data center environment. Strong knowledge of data center infrastructure components, including servers, storage systems, and networking devices. Proficiency in data center operations, capacity planning, and incident response. Understanding of data center security best practices and protocols. Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills. Strong communication and collaboration abilities. Relevant certifications (e.g., CompTIA Server+, Cisco CCNA Data Center) are a plus. Ability to work efficiently both independently and as part of a team. Technology Doesn't Change the World, People Do.® Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles. Robert Half works to put you in the best position to succeed. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity - whenever you choose - even on the go. All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Benefits are available to contract/temporary professionals, including medical, vision, dental, and life and disability insurance. Hired contract/temporary professionals are also eligible to enroll in our company 401(k) plan. Visit © 2024 Robert Half. An Equal Opportunity Employer. M/F/Disability/Veterans. By clicking “Apply Now,” you’re agreeing to
summary: Robert Half is seeking a Contract Data Center Analyst to maintain, monitor, and optimize data center infrastructure. Responsibilities include hardware maintenance, equipment upgrades, system installations, infrastructure monitoring, incident response, capacity planning, security implementation, documentation, disaster recovery planning, and vendor coordination.

title: HR Data Analyst
description: At Constant Contact, we are seriously awesome people who take ownership and make an impact by operating with the mindset, integrity and courage of a small business owner. There’s something so profoundly rewarding about knowing that your work is empowering people everywhere to pursue their dreams . Here, we all play an integral part in helping business owners, entrepreneurs, non-profits and individuals to succeed by giving them all the help and tools they need to grow online. We’re energized by new challenges and new possibilities-and we’re just getting started! Constant Contact is a fast growing and ambitious technology company looking for a smart, talented, and resourceful HRIS Analyst to join our People team. The position is responsible for the planning, implementation and maintenance of People Ops systems, as well as being the point person on our reporting and analytics. You will work closely with our Business Partners, Operations, and Finance teams, along with other internal stakeholders. If you’re highly motivated by providing insight and value, a data guru who can make metrics matter and take our game to the next level this may be the job for you. What you’ll do: Manage data/analytics requests; assemble, analyze, and format data into reports for all levels of the business-lead projects as defined by leadership Interpret complex data sets and communicate actionable insights effectively through compelling narratives Develop both scheduled and ad-hoc reporting systems for HR functions and company-wide operations Audit and maintain People systems in order to detect, troubleshoot and resolve issues in order to ensure integrity of data throughout the organization Partner with key stakeholders to actively contribute to the advancement and refinement of our business intelligence tool. Ensures the efficient and accurate integration of data files originating from our HR system to various third-party recipients. This includes data validation, transformation, and transmission, to guarantee smooth and reliable exchanges that meet the needs and standards of all stakeholders involved. Evaluate systems needs and business requirements to make recommendations on improvements, as well as new systems and processes Build and maintain system back ends - data tables, workflows, security, etc. Provide expert-level support to end users, addressing and resolving ad-hoc system issues promptly and effectively. Provide backup support for team members across a range of HR systems, ensuring seamless continuity and proficient operation during absences or high-demand periods. Who you are: 2-4 or more years of People Ops/HRIS/Analyst or equivalent experience Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Information Technology, Human Resources, or a related field Experience using the Workday product suite, Greenhouse, Cornerstone or ServiceNow preferred. Strong background in using HR data and HRIS products desired and experience producing analytics containing sensitive information and high levels of accuracy Expert level in Excel Experience with Business Intelligence tools, i.e. Tableau, Domo, etc. Excellent communications skills, verbal, written, and active listening to effectively communicate HR information to HR and non-HR individuals. True sense of pride, ownership and a demonstrated willingness to go the extra mile The specific salary offered to a candidate may be influenced by a variety of factors including the candidate’s experience, their education and work location. In addition, some roles may be eligible for additional on target commission pay or bonus. The compensation package includes health and welfare benefits including paid leave. Pay Transparency - All Full Time Employees $60,400—$75,500 USD Why You’ll Love Us: We celebrate one another’s differences. We are proud of our culture of diversity and inclusion, and we're always working hard to strengthen and improve this culture. We have programs in place that bring us together on important issues and provide educational opportunities for all employees. Join the experts. If you're passionate about supporting businesses and organizations, you won’t find a better spot to share your talent. We’re dedicated to improving the quality of our product from a customer standpoint and have a true desire to enable the success of businesses, non-profit organizations, and community groups. You’ll have opportunities to grow your career. We encourage and support our team members to learn different aspects of the business, take on stretch assignments, seek coaching opportunities and professional development opportunities. A generous paid time off policy and a competitive benefits package that supports the health and well-being of you and your family At Constant Contact, we’re all about work flexibility and are proud to serve our customers as a hybrid workforce. Our hybrid work model combines the convenience of remote work with access to our great office locations to collaborate in-person, participate in live trainings, and socialize with colleagues. summary: Constant Contact is seeking an HRIS Analyst to join their People team. The position involves managing data and analytics, developing reports, auditing People systems, partnering with stakeholders, and providing support to end users. The ideal candidate will have 2-4 years of experience in HRIS or a related field, a Bachelor's Degree, strong Excel skills, experience with HR data and HRIS products, and experience with Business Intelligence tools. The role offers a competitive salary and benefits package, including health and welfare benefits, paid leave, and a hybrid work model.

title: Quantitative Analyst
description: Job Description We are seeking a skilled and analytical Quantitative Analyst to join our team. The Quantitative Analyst will be responsible for developing mathematical models, conducting statistical analysis, and using data to inform investment strategies and financial decisions. This role requires expertise in quantitative research, financial modeling, and programming skills to analyze and interpret complex data sets. Roles And Responsibilities Model Development and Analysis: Develop quantitative models and algorithms for analyzing financial data and market trends. Conduct statistical analysis and back-testing to evaluate model performance and accuracy. Data Collection and Preparation: Collect, clean, and preprocess data from various sources to ensure data integrity and consistency. Perform data validation and quality checks to maintain accuracy in analytical processes. Financial Modeling and Forecasting: Build and maintain financial models for pricing, risk assessment, portfolio optimization, and performance analysis. Develop predictive models and algorithms using statistical techniques and machine learning methods. Risk Management and Strategy Development: Assess and mitigate financial risks through quantitative analysis and scenario modeling. Provide insights and recommendations to support investment strategies and decision-making. Reporting and Presentation: Prepare detailed reports, presentations, and dashboards to communicate analysis results and insights to stakeholders. Present findings and recommendations to senior management and investment teams. Technology and Tools Utilization: Utilize programming languages (e.g., Python, R, MATLAB) and statistical software (e.g., SAS, Stata) for data analysis and modeling. Implement and optimize quantitative models and algorithms in trading platforms or financial systems. Continuous Learning and Development: Stay informed about industry trends, regulatory changes, and advancements in quantitative finance and data science. Participate in professional development activities and training programs to enhance skills and knowledge. Collaboration and Teamwork: Collaborate with portfolio managers, traders, and other stakeholders to align quantitative strategies with business objectives. Work closely with cross-functional teams to support quantitative research projects and initiatives. Skills And Qualifications Master's or PhD in Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Quantitative Finance, or related field. X+ years of experience as a Quantitative Analyst, Quantitative Researcher, or in a similar role within the financial services industry. Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, MATLAB, or similar for quantitative analysis and modeling. Strong understanding of financial markets, investment principles, and portfolio management concepts. Experience with statistical analysis, mathematical modeling, and machine learning techniques. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail and accuracy. Effective communication skills, with the ability to explain complex quantitative concepts and analysis results to non-technical stakeholders. Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment, with a focus on delivering actionable insights and solutions. Compensation The salary for this position is competitive and commensurate with experience. Benefits package includes health insurance, retirement plan options, paid time off, and professional development opportunities. Application Process Please submit your resume and cover letter detailing your qualifications and interest in this position. We will contact selected candidates for further interviews. This job description is tailored to attract qualified candidates for a Quantitative Analyst position by outlining specific responsibilities, required skills, and offering details about compensation and benefits. Adjustments can be made based on the company's industry, size, and specific quantitative analysis needs, such as specialization in particular asset classes or quantitative trading strategies.
summary: We are looking for a Quantitative Analyst to develop mathematical models, conduct statistical analysis, and use data to inform investment strategies and financial decisions. This role requires expertise in quantitative research, financial modeling, and programming skills to analyze and interpret complex data sets. Responsibilities include model development, data collection and preparation, financial modeling and forecasting, risk management, reporting and presentation, technology utilization, continuous learning, collaboration, and teamwork.
