title: System Design Engineer
description: Job Title : System Design Engineer Location : Sterling Heights, MI (Onsite: 70-80%) Salary : Competitive, depending on experience Company Overview : Our client is a leading engineering and technology company looking to expand our team with a talented System Design Engineer. Their company offers a dynamic and innovative work environment with a focus on cutting-edge technology. If you are a highly skilled engineer with a passion for system design and development, we invite you to join our team and contribute to the future of engineering. Job Description : As a System Design Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in the development of system and subsystem design, software requirements, integration, and verification testing. Your primary responsibilities will include ensuring that the design is well-defined, traceable, and rigorously validated during testing, right down to the components and software requirements. You will be responsible for meeting deadlines and delivering high-quality products. Roles and Responsibilities : Define and ensure traceability of system and subsystem requirements and software requirements. Perform functional analysis to develop flows and concepts of execution. Design and develop the system and subsystem architecture, interfaces, and design, including commonality considerations. Decompose system and subsystem performance and verification requirements and develop design verification plans and reports. Identify, define, and manage power, data, and other system interfaces. Ensure the maintenance of system, subsystem, and component interfaces. Support the management of power and network bandwidth allocations for vehicle functions. Ensure alignment of the system design across physical, power, data, and software. Integrate and verify system and subsystem components in the Lab/Vehicle. Define and execute system and subsystem integration, test, and verification plans. Provide technical inputs to planning, schedules, and cost estimates. Achieve proficiency in one or multiple domains (e.g., Power, Fire Control, Diagnostics, Information Assurance, C4, Software User Interface design, etc.). Qualifications Sought : Strong skills in system/subsystem/software requirements development, design, and testing. Experience with data bus design and management and associated data collecting tools (CAN, Ethernet, 1553, etc.). Experience with Requirements Manager (TEAMCENTER) and/or DOORs. Bachelor’s Degree in an Engineering Discipline required, with a preference for electrical engineering. A minimum of 7 years of applicable experience. Proficiency in troubleshooting system/subsystems. Preferred knowledge of military vehicles. Ability to write test procedures and reports. Highly motivated and able to work both as part of a team and independently. Willingness to work occasional evening and/or weekend overtime as required. Strong communication, interpersonal, and leadership skills. Ability to work in various environments, including office, shop, test lab, test site, and in vehicles. Eligibility for U.S. security clearance. How to Apply : If you are a passionate and highly skilled System Design Engineer looking to work on cutting-edge projects in an innovative environment, we encourage you to apply. Join our team and be part of shaping the future of engineering with a company that values your skills and dedication.
summary: A leading engineering and technology company is seeking a System Design Engineer to contribute to the development of system and subsystem design, software requirements, integration, and verification testing. Responsibilities include defining and ensuring traceability of system and subsystem requirements, performing functional analysis, designing and developing architecture, interfaces, and design, decomposing performance and verification requirements, identifying and managing interfaces, ensuring maintenance of interfaces, supporting bandwidth allocations, aligning system design across physical, power, data, and software aspects, integrating and verifying components, defining and executing integration, test, and verification plans, providing technical inputs to planning and estimates, and achieving proficiency in multiple domains. Ideal candidates possess strong skills in requirements development, design, and testing, experience with data bus design and management tools (CAN, Ethernet, 1553), familiarity with Requirements Manager (TEAMCENTER) or DOORs, a Bachelor's Degree in Engineering (preferably electrical), 7+ years of applicable experience, proficiency in troubleshooting, preferred knowledge of military vehicles, ability to write test procedures and reports, strong communication, interpersonal, and leadership skills, and eligibility for U.S. security clearance.

title: Senior Software Engineer

title: Mobile Developer - IOS - Android/Swift IT Software Engineer

title: Manufacturing Execution System Engineer
description: Job Summary: The Manufacturing Execution System (MES) Engineer will provide expertise in technical operations of the plant. Responsible for shop floor systems, manufacturing applications, machine integration with MES, printers and other manufacturing hardware. Provides technical support to troubleshoot equipment issues through structured problem-solving processes. Responsible for implementation of production line systems and improvement of existing system by modifying and/or updating MES process flow. Essential Functions: Create reports/dashboards from data stored in various production database. Work with Process Engineers, Production departments, IT and Maintenance to evaluate MES requirements for production line improvements and modifications. Provide production support for MES functions including QAD interfaces, PLC interfaces, Electrical Test interfaces, MES master data maintenance & process modeling, MES functionality (transactions and user interfaces) and Database / reporting functions. Develop, modify or debug MES logic and related IT Applications to enhance equipment interface and operation of the MES. Diagnose and help resolve causes of process and communication malfunctions on all equipment. Author and execute software validation activities with proper oversight to support and maintain the MES. Provide training to technician on the operation and diagnostics of the machine process and applications. Support manufacturing metrics (Safety, Engineering Change, OEE, Scrap, Waste) Configure system settings and options, plans and executes integration acceptance testing with required documentation Perform system configuration changes, monitor systems and correct errors. Train others on systems, software, equipment and processes. Research and implement cost effective upgrades to the equipment and manufacturing applications. Modify and create SQL queries and stored procedures to create reports and functions. Support web applications and solutions. Coordinate IT/MES activities with internal and external departments for zero downtime goals. Requirements: 3-5 Minimum Years of Experience with MES such as Matrix, Solidat, MPDV Hydra, GE Proficy, Pyramid, or other MES. 1-3 Minimum Years of Experience within the automotive industry Understanding of programming languages and structured database (SQL/PostGRE) management. Experience in a fast pace broadcast delivery (JIT/JIS) environment so equipment and tooling uptime is essential Experience with Microsoft SQL is required Experience in Allen Bradley ControlLogx (PLC), communications interface and ladder-logic Preferred Qualifications: Ability to work well with hourly and maintenance employees and have a good working relationship with other departments within the plant. Working knowledge of manufacturing broadcast and sequencing system and processes Experience in programming language such as VB.NET, C#, C++ Education: Degree | Area of Study: Computer Science, Electrical engineering. *Equivalent work experience may also be considered for certain positions.
summary: The Manufacturing Execution System (MES) Engineer is responsible for technical operations of the plant, including shop floor systems, manufacturing applications, machine integration with MES, printers, and other manufacturing hardware. They troubleshoot equipment issues, implement production line systems, and improve existing systems by modifying and/or updating MES process flow. This role also involves creating reports/dashboards from data, supporting MES functions, developing and debugging MES logic, diagnosing and resolving process and communication malfunctions, authoring and executing software validation activities, providing training to technicians, and supporting manufacturing metrics.

title: Lead Data Engineer – Hadoop Apps (Bangkok-Based, Relocation Provided)
description: About Agoda Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world. Our Purpose – Bridging the World Through Travel We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness. We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone. Get to Know Our Team The Data department oversees all of Agoda’s data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company’s culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward. Why Agoda Hadoop Apps Team? Joining this team, you will be solving some of the most difficult challenges out there today for the Hadoop ecosystem. We focus largely on building user tools and applications for other teams to use, most of these are built on top of Yarn utilizing Apache Spark as well as other cutting edge technologies. We are also the engine that drives a fully functional world class data warehouse on top of Hadoop, this means providing tools to define data cubes and syncing high load of data from a processing Hadoop to other systems using in-house built Applications. In this Role, you will get to Lead the team technically in improving scalability, stability, accuracy, speed and efficiency of our existing Data Platform Build, administer and scale Data Platform Be comfortable navigating the following technology stack: S3, Kubernetes, KubeFlow, Spark, SQL, Impala, Scala, java, Python, scripting (Bash/Python) etc. Work with experienced engineers to identify and build tools to automate many large-scale data platform management What You’ll Need To Succeed Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science /Information Systems/Engineering/related field 6+ years of experience in Data Platform Administration eg. Hadoop, S3, AWS, Google Cloud etc. 6+ years of experience in Kubernetes Administration in non cloud platform Good experience in Apache Spark performance tuning and debugging Good level understanding of JVM and either Java or Scala Experience in WorkFlow Scheduler eg. KubeFlow, AirFlow, Oozie etc. SQL experience eg. summary: Agoda, a travel booking platform, is seeking a Data Platform Engineer to lead the Hadoop Apps team. This role involves building and maintaining the company's data platform, including tools and applications for other teams. Responsibilities include improving scalability, stability, and efficiency of the platform, working with Apache Spark and other technologies, and managing large-scale data platform management tasks.
